story:
ANNOUNCE: Panic Buying of 2016 World No.1 Smart Business Car Charger with Key Current Separation Tech™ (Four Ports 9.6A Output).

Two choices:

a. single BizCharger Empire™ charger only

b. BizCharger Empire™ charger+ 1 MFi Lightning Cable

300pcs free Water-proof Golden USB flash drive gift (each worth USD20) for Early Birds!




BizCharger Empire™ is a REAL SMART car charger for Business. It doesn’t only charge up your devices in front seats of your car but also for backseats--your customers . In terms of quality, BizCharger Empire™ is a fireproof car charger that meets US Military Standard.  




Why we offer MFi Lightning Cable?   In today's market, there are lots of High Immitation Fake MFi Lightning Cables and just from cosmetic, consumer could not distinguish true or fake.  We buy these MFi Lightning Cable from our Partners who only manufacture Lightning Cable for Apple Inc.   By using our real MFi Lightning Cable, the charging speed will not fail.


Perfect Design for  Businessman, always make customer Happy!

  



Smart Device Detection

With its advanced US smart device detection IC technology,  BizCharger Empire™ detects what device it's charging and delivers the maximum amps output accepted by your device, enabling your device to charge at its fastest speed.


Lightning Charging

Charge 4 devices at their maximum speed, faster than a normal car charger.


US Military Grade

BizCharger Empire™ is a fireproof car charger to meet US Military MIL-STD-810G High Temperature Standard. It is crafted from the highest grade PC/ABS with all metal parts coated in Nickel in order to work under temperatures up to 100°C/212°F.



BizCharger Empire™ Charger formed through 26 workart processes to make sure High Quality. (Detailed processes such as plastic injection, immersion tin, cuting angle, welding, cleaning, QC test, and so on.)


Besides above, there are also drop test and others to make sure quality is on high end.


First 300 Early Birds will get a free Waterproof Golden USB flash drive, USB2.0 PORT, 4GB Pass H2 test:


All Backers will always get special discount coupon when they buy USFLASHCOOL® in future!






Hiroaki Takahashi (Co-Founder of Singapo Group)

“Today is a mess in USB car charger market—lots of different brands with different quality level but no brand just focus on USB car charger which means no real professional brand make USB car charger. And consumers could not easily distinguish which brand is better and are very likely to buy a Junk charger when buying online. 

USFLASHCOOL brand’s aim is to settle 3 things:

the first is USFLASHCOOL brand only focus on high quality USB car charger—no other products will launch ;

the second is we focus on stable High Quality charger with U.S., Japan & Taiwan IC, we really do innovation but with pre-condition “Stable”—if innovation + bad functionality=”Junk”;

the third is our great business model idea—that is M2C (manufacturer-brander to end users), we cut medium dealers or distributors to save MONEY for end users and we only focus on online selling—you cannot buy from a real store as there will be extra cost for prices. 

All we to do, is always to think about how to save money for our customers and let them buy right, buy wise! We will surely change the saying: “you get what you pay for” to be “you will get the best while you pay for much less!”

“USFLASHCOOL®—Ace up your car” is a World Premium brand which was born in July,2015 to solve all quality problem (such as not real amps output, not well connected with your device, short lifetime, not compatible for all mobile devices, not good protection etc.) of USB car charger and offer best benefit to end users.  Mr. Chester Xie—with MBA background sets up this brand with multinational team including an American & a Japanese partner who both has more than 5 years excellent electronic technical & quality control background work very hard to reach this target out. Since 2010, they tried to prepare all knowledge of this top brand and make so much research on how to improve the technical & quality.  With their exhausted efforts, they finally got what they need and built up 2 companies: Singapo Group Inc. &Singapo Group (HK) Co., Ltd.  

“USFLASHCOOL®—Ace up your car” is the leading World Top USB car charger brand who is the only one focus on car charger.  With Japan & U.S. Smart Key Technology, the charger we made is much more stable than other competitors.  Each USB car charger under USFLASHCOOL brand formed through 26 work arts process & 10 tests to make sure it is the real amazing quality.

What’s more, we launch Lean Production and Six Sigma to ensure our each process is well done and before mass production we launch PPAP for trial production. Today the defect rate is around 1pcs out of 10000pcs—this is already amazing number, but with Japanese quality spirit, we still strive to improve again & again to challenge 0 defect. We always take our own responsibility on quality side to our customers. And we will always keep our words and insist in making High Quality USB Car Charger all our lifetime!

We focus, so we are more professional;

We insist, so quality is much more stable;

We strive to improve, so our brand will always surprise our customers!

Buy “USFLASHCOOL” means No Junk!

Buy “USFLASHCOOL” means Save Money!

Buy “USFLASHCOOL” means Buy Top Brand with Excellent Quality!

Buy “USFLASHCOOL” means Always Enjoy Your Driving—Charging Life!

“USFLASHCOOL”, only for you & always with you!



We've done lots of work & technical research in ensuring a high quality product. We've tested several IC from U.S., Japan & Taiwan and found the U.S. one is the best match for this business charger. Now, after months of work, we're ready to share BizCharger Empire™ with you. We are confident that we can ship in time as we already start to place U.S. IC order, even U.S. IC lead-time is around 2 months. The only risk is if the campaign gets funded beyond our wildest dreams (such as over $0.7M), then we would need to purchase more U.S. IC to speed up manufacturing.


1. How to distinguish a high quality car charger?

A High Quality car charger should be installed with High Quality Integrated Circuit, PCBA board.  For Integrated Circuit, we use made in U.S. to insure very good performance and lifetime.

2. What kind of phone can be charged by BizCharger Empire™? 

Any mobile phone devices with iOS or Android system could be charged by our BizCharger Empire™.

3. Does BizCharger Empire™ work if there's no power when the car's engine has been turned off?

Once you turned off the Car’s engine and plug out the key, BizCharger Empire™ will stop working.

4. How can I get a free Water-proof Golden USB Flash Drive? 

a. First 300 Early Bird will get 1pc Water-proof Golden USB Flash Drive;

b. Buy 2 pcs BizCharger Empire™ will get 1pc Water-proof Golden USB Flash Drive;

c. Buy 3 pcs BizCharger Empire™ will get 1pc Water-proof Golden USB Flash Drive;

d. Buy 5 pcs BizCharger Empire™ will get 2pcs Water-proof Golden USB Flash Drives;

f.  By sharing our link to your 2 friends and they buy any of our package, you will get a free water-proof Golden USB Flash Drive(pre-condition, you buy one also)

5. How can I get additional BizCharger Empire™ units? 

You can buy more of a specific package. For example, if you want to get four BizCharger Empire™ units, you can pledge for two of the couple packages, bringing your total amount + shipping depending on where you're located.  For special request, please send us e-mail.

6. Will BizCharger Empire™ drain my car's battery if it is left plugged in and if I don't drive my car for a long time? 

If BizCharger Empire™ lights are off after you've turned off the ignition, there will be no battery drain problem. If BizCharger Empire™ lights are on after the ignition is off, especially when the light is still on after 2 hours or during the whole night, and you're not going to drive the car for more than 3 weeks, we recommend that you unplug BizCharger Empire™ from the socket. 

7. How can I upgrade or change my perk level? 

Please follow these instructions from Indiegogo: 

https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/526756-How-to-Upgrade-Your-Perk

8. How will you ship out my package?

We will ship via a third party shipping company.

9. When will you start shipping?

By mid-Febuary, 2016.

story:
What is i74? 

i74 is a legislative proposal initiated by the citizens of Romania via article 74 of the Romanian Constitution – which allows 100.000 citizens to introduce a law into Parliament. i74 aims to reform the functioning of the Parliament of Romania by closing loopholes in the current legislation defining Parliamentary activity, along three main lines:

a. Ensuring transparency and traceability of votes in the Parliament

b. Establishing clear rules for expenditures by elected Members of Parliament 

c. Penalising unexcused absences from plenary meetings

d. Promoting transparency in hiring practices and in the management of public resources

The initiative was born within the CAESAR Foundation and has been widely embraced by the public, having gathered 15,000 virtual signatures in the first 15 days after its launch. It has so far mobilized close to 1,000 volunteers.

The Impact

i74 is the first grassroots legislative initiative in Romania’s democratic history after the 1989 Revolution that goes through all stages required by law – from drafting, to collecting 100.000 signatures and being voted upon in the Parliament. Besides much-needed impact on current legislation, i74’s vision is to empower citizens to take ownership of a country that has been affected by corruption, lack of transparency, and a political class completely disconnected from voters. i74 aims to inspire citizens to take action and realize the potential of citizen involvement in the everyday functioning of democracy.

What we need and what you get? 

In order to be voted upon in the Parliament, i74 needs to secure 100,000 signatures in less than 6 months, from 11 counties in Romania. Everything that goes into drafting a legislative proposal - volunteers, promotional materials, website development, photos, videos, mass-media coverage and radio / TV appearances - all of these key steps require time, money and other resources  from volunteers and supporters of the project. That is why we need your help in raising the funds we require in order to complete our tasks. For your contribution, you will not only receive some great perks, but you will actively take part in strengthening Romania's democracy. 


Ce este i74?

Inițiativa legislativă a Fundației CAESAR are la bază Articolului 74 din Constituţia României. Prin prevederile acestui articol, cetățenii au dreptul de a introduce legi în Parlament și de a schimba modul în care se iau deciziile la nivel înalt. Conform Art. 74, „(1) Iniţiativa legislativă aparţine, după caz, Guvernului, deputaţilor, senatorilor sau unui număr de cel puţin 100.000 de cetăţeni cu drept de vot.”

Cum ne propunem să reușim?

Prin a strânge, împreună, peste 100.000 de semnături din cel puțin 11 judeţe, fiecare cu cel puțin 5.000 de semnatari. Proiectul de lege va ajunge atunci pe masa Parlamentului, în primăvara anului viitor. Obiectivul este ca legea să fie adoptată înainte de alegerile parlamentare din 2016.

De ce i74?

Pentru că fiecare român își dorește să aibă pe cine să voteze, nu împotriva cui să voteze. Pentru ca acest lucru să se întâmple, avem nevoie de conducători care să ne reprezinte interesele de cetățeni în Parlament.

Ce aduce nou i74?

1. Transparență - Voturi la vedere, accesibile tuturor cetățenilor, ca să ştim cum suntem reprezentaţi.

2. Seriozitate – Fiecare absență nemotivată să fie sancționată cu 1% din salariu. Deoarece parlamentarii trebuie să știe că nu se joacă pe timpul nostru.

3. Responsabilitate – Decontări de cheltuieli doar pe bază de documente justificative. Declarația pe proprie răspundere nu va mai fi suficientă, pentru că banul public e banul nostru și nu poate fi cheltuit oricum.  

Ce primiți în schimbul susținerii și donațiilor?  

Tot ceea ce intră în elaborarea unei propuneri legislative - coordonarea voluntarilor, materialele promoționale, dezvoltarea site-ului, fotografiile, clipurile video, aparițiile mass-media și radio/TV - toate aceste etape-cheie necesită timp, bani și multe alte resurse, atât din partea voluntarilor cât și a susținătorilor proiectului. Altfel spus, din punct de vedere financiar, avem nevoie de ajutorul vostru pentru a duce acest proiect la bun sfârșit. În contul acestor contribuții veți primi mai mult decât produse și cadouri inscripționate, veți avea ocazia de a participa în mod activ la consolidarea democrației din România. În numele echipei i74, vă mulțumim!

Inițiativa legislativă a Fundației CAESAR are la bază Articolului 74 din Constituţia României. Prin prevederile acestui articol, cetățenii au dreptul de a introduce legi în Parlament și de a schimba modul în care se iau deciziile la nivel înalt. Conform Art. 74, „(1) Iniţiativa legislativă aparţine, după caz, Guvernului, deputaţilor, senatorilor sau unui număr de cel puţin 100.000 de cetăţeni cu drept de vot.”
Cum ne propunem să reușim?
Prin a strânge, împreună, peste 100.000 de semnături din cel puțin 11 judeţe, fiecare cu cel puțin 5.000 de semnatari. Proiectul de lege va ajunge atunci pe masa Parlamentului, în primăvara anului viitor. Obiectivul este ca legea să fie adoptată înainte de alegerile parlamentare din 2016.
De ce i74?
Pentru că fiecare român își dorește să aibă pe cine să voteze, nu împotriva cui să voteze. Pentru ca acest lucru să se întâmple, avem nevoie de conducători care să ne reprezinte interesele de cetățeni în Parlament.
Ce aduce nou i74?
1. Transparență - Voturi la vedere, accesibile tuturor cetățenilor, ca să ştim cum suntem reprezentaţi.
2. Seriozitate – Fiecare absență nemotivată să fie sancționată cu 1% din salariu. Deoarece parlamentarii trebuie să știe că nu se joacă pe timpul nostru.
3. Responsabilitate – Decontări de cheltuieli doar pe bază de documente justificative. Declarația pe proprie răspundere nu va mai fi suficientă, pentru că banul public e banul nostru și nu poate fi cheltuit oricum.  
Ce primiți în schimbul susținerii și donațiilor?  

Tot ceea ce intră în elaborarea unei propuneri legislative - coordonarea
voluntarilor, materialele promoționale, dezvoltarea site-ului, fotografiile,
clipurile video, aparițiile mass-media și radio/TV - toate aceste etape-cheie
necesită timp, bani și multe alte resurse, atât din partea voluntarilor cât și
a susținătorilor proiectului. Altfel spus, din punct de vedere financiar, avem nevoie de ajutorul vostru pentru
a duce acest proiect la bun sfârșit. În contul acestor contribuții veți primi mai mult decât produse și cadouri inscripționate, veți avea ocazia de a
participa în mod activ la consolidarea democrației din România. În numele echipei i74, vă mulțumim!

story:
Our Project

APEX Movement Fort Collins needs a FOAM PIT for our new gym.  We are moving into a new space that is over double the size of our current location.  The move will take place between February and March of 2016.  Don't worry, it's only three doors down from our current spot.  We have plans to make this facility the best place to practice Parkour in Northern Colorado. We  heard the feedback, you want more awesome features and more space to run free in a place made JUST for Parkour. The day you have been waiting for is close, we  have been working very hard with some special people to get us in a spot that is big enough to host a foam pit, more mats, and a forest of fun wood and metal features.  The time is NOW, this our chance to pull it off and make this epic gym a reality.

We can need your help!  We have thrown everything we have got at getting into the new spot.  In order to deliver these awesome features ASAP we need others who share our goal to promote it and score some special gear to fund the project.


What We Need & What You Get

Our perks include limited edition T-SHIRTS, STICKERS and SPECIAL VIP ACCESS! 
The most expensive new feature in our facility is the foam pit.  Our funding goal consists of colts for the basics of a safe foam pit and include...
  • Quality Foam
  • Wood framing
  • High grade safety padding for edges and walls
If we exceed our funding goal we will continue to add additional features to the foam pit that like...
  • Rails for webster training
  • Beams for cast aways
  • Holds and footing for challenges above the foam pit
  • Trampoline
We would not  ask for help without giving back with dividends.  No only will your support help us achieve our funding goal but you will get some special perks in return.  
***T-Shirt and sticker designs may vary slightly.



The Impact

Contributions to funding go a long way.  Helping us build a facility that can reach more people and get them moving is our ultimate goal.  If you believe in seeing more people moving and having fun in our community then help us promote the project.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenges in the product are funding and time.  Working with a long list of suppliers for different parts of the foam pit to the actual build require coordination and grit.  But it is our goal to deliver the finished product ASAP!  Perks will be delivered in a timely manner once the funding project ends and you are guaranteed to receive your perk. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help  

  • Please share the project on Facebook
  • Tag yourself at the gym to help build awareness 

And that's all there is to it.  With your much appreciated help we can make it happen!

story:
Imagine a society where there is opportunity for all, irrespective of background, sex, or location; where children can go to school, and young women and men can be what they want to be, without bad governance, corruption or their background putting their back on the ground.

The GoodGovernance Hub (GGH) is a further development on the Good Governance Town Hall which was started few years ago with great success and seeks to achieve the above through social entrepreneurship. It will be a center that combines elements of training, networking, and entrepreneurship in promoting good governance, democracy, and the rule of law in Nigeria. GGH will be a mobile tour center that moves across the 36 states in Nigeria with the aim of physically and virtually gathering public and private stakeholders and experts with young women and men in order to  collectively (by inclusion) find solutions that promote good governance, democracy, and the rule of law in the specific states and communities in Nigeria. It is a solution-driven alternative to violent protests and rallies by young people. It would not only serve as a training center for young people to incubate ideas that promote good governance, democracy, and the rule of law, but also a policy think tank for recommending youth-inclusive policies, and a place for supporting ideas into sustainable businesses and nonprofits that promote good governance, democracy, and the rule of law. This ideas could include technology or non-technology related solutions.

The entrepreneurial aspect of the hub will emphasize community based on based projects and solutions, which will contribute to curbing rural urban migration in the long run.

Modus operandi:

i.  Youngwomenand men, from different works of life, and who live inthe communities and states, would be asked to apply and selected to attend the programs  in their states.
ii.  One or two issues within the community or state would identified and discussed extensively with young women and men engaging stakeholders.

iii.  Young people identify and discuss solutions to such issues in the communities.
iv.   The recommendations would be made available to policy makers within the communities and state for implementation, an alternative to violent protests and riots.

v.  As an addition, within program, there will be a competition for pitching sustainable ideas and indigenous solutions that promote good governance, democracy, and the rule of law, where one or more idea(s) would receive training, funding and support, in partnership with our partners.

N.B: The members of the hub who have attended the programs would also serve as a ‘volunteer’ pool for future national, state, and community advocacy and needs, such as advocating policy change,catering for internally displaced people, teaching, and other purposes. As there is no structured platform for young people to volunteer their skills to drive social change in Nigeria.
We hope to raise funds to run and manage the hub's program for two years. After two years, the hub will diversify into providing institutional and corporate training, and programs that provide funding for the hub. In four years, we hope to expand to provide direct involvement, training, and mentorship to other young people across Africa, on how to drive good governance,democracy, and the rule of law through this model, because good governance,democracy, and the rule of law, must prevail in the huts and hamlets of Africa, for economic prosperity and opportunities for all, irrespective of background, sex, and location.

story:
We've got Wheels!

But we need help getting them turning

We are Nicole and Andrew, coffee and tea lovers with an entrepreneurial spirit. I have been dreaming of opening up a coffee shop for years and with Andrew's design skills and my love for DIY adventures, we finally took the plunge and began building Nomad Coffee in late 2015.
Nomad is a mobile coffee shop located in Vermont. We are on a mission to bring good coffee to the bedroom communities of the greater Burlington area. We want to make your morning commute and weekend outings a happier one.  But we are not quite there yet, we could use your help to get us rolling and brewing.
 

What We Need

You can be a part of getting great coffee to your neighborhood!
We need to raise $15,700 to purchase:
  • La Marzocco espresso machine
  • Brew Batch machine, Grinders and accessories
  • Permits & Licenses
  • Refrigerator, water tank, filtration system and sinks
  • Generator
  • Plumbing & Electrical


The Perks

There is a little something something for everyone who donates. We have..
  • Magnets
  • Drink tokens
  • Nomad etched mugs
  • Nomad T-shirts
  • 1/2 bags of Coffee from our friends at Brio Coffeeworks or Tea from Vermont Artisan Coffee & Tea Co
  • And Coffee Events/Parties with Nomad and goodies from Jam Bakery
We've also just introduced (as of July 12) a 'Pitch Your Perk' option.  Don't see what you'd like above? Or want something for a different price?  Send us an email at hello@nomadcoffeevt.com with your desired perk and what you are willing to contribute and we'll get back to you within a day. Maybe you want to be the hero at work and bring Nomad to your office?  Pitch it!
We look forward to hearing from your ideas!
If we don't reach our campaign goal we will still use all the generated funds to help us purchase our equipment. Every little bit helps us get to our launch date sooner. 





The Impact

Behind every great community is a Coffee Shop. Being able to provide a mobile service will give us the freedom to serve the morning commuters during the week while allowing us to fuel outdoor enthusiasts on the weekends. We want to serve you coffee, wherever you are working or playing!

We are working to support our fellow Vermont businesses. Our coffee beans, teas and baked goods are sourced right here in VT. Plus we love doing all the hippy stuff that comes along with being a socially responsible business, like composting our coffee grinds, sourcing local goods and being members of 1% for the Planet. 


Risks and Challenges

We have lovingly built Nomad with our hands, hearts, and friends and navigated the web of regulations, permits, and licenses that come along with mobile food vending.  Now all that's left to do is purchase our equipment and start serving you coffee!  We are almost there and every donation and shared link will help us get to our goal faster.  Please help spread the word and be a part of bringing great coffee and a new business to Vermont.


Other Ways You Can Help
  • Tell your friends about our campaign
  • Share our link
  • Like us on Facebook or follow us on Twitter & Instagram!

story:
Sterlingshire Farm

Hello Everyone, we are the Miles Family ( John and Cheri Miles and our 3 beautiful kids)  and we are the proud owner's of Sterlingshire Farm. We have been married for 24 years and after years of dreaming and planning last year we made this dream a reality.   We have given much thought to creating a sustainable lifestyle raising livestock naturally and providing pasture raised, antibiotic free meat, eggs and down the road- dairy products to our community. 

  So  why farming, why now, why heritage breeds, and why Sterlingshire for a name.  My husband and I both come from farming families- a few generations back- and although it may seem crazy to some people (including a few of our family members) we decided last year that we wanted to break out of the subdivision as our kids are now in their teens and buy a farm.  Not a commercial operation, but a small family farm raising heritage breeds naturally- with lots of forage, sunshine,  fresh water, and chemical free. 

We have chosen to raise heritage breed livestock on our farm, these breeds were once very popular with our ancestors and most were brought over from Ireland, Scotland, England and other countries in Europe.  These breeds hail from a time when animals foraged in pasture and woodlands and are well adapted for small farms.  These breeds do not mature or produce rapidly and therefore were passed over by commercial farmers.  Many of these breeds are now endangered as they lost favor after WWII.  These breeds (pigs, goats, chickens, ducks, turkeys and cows) are hardy animals with a taste that rivals anything you have ever bought from a grocery store.  

Sterlingshire Farm came through our deep connections with family.  I lost my mother as a young girl and  I wanted to learn everything about her family.  After lots of searching and the help of Ancestor.com I came to discover my mother's family (both sides) were from Scotland.  One side came from a village known as Stirlingshire.  It was an ah-hah moment and the farm's name was created.  So join us as try, fail and try again to create a sustainable farm for our family and naturally raised meat for our community. 

Sterlingshire Farm Barn Raising 

As we have built the farm over the last year it became very apparent that a barn is needed.  We currently have 12 goats on the farm, 8 fainting goats and 4 dairy goats, 6 Ameracauna chickens and 6 Rhode Island red chickens. In the spring we would like to add heritage pig breeds especially the mulefoot pig and the old spot pig.  The barn will allow our goats to kid and the pigs to farrow safely during the winter- as we do not prescribe to a breeding program- kids can come during any month.

In days gone by when a neighbor needed a barn built, the community came together to help raise the barn.  Crowdfunding has put a new spin on this task but the outcome is the same- we need your help.   Please consider a donation to our barn raising effort. 

Our barn raising campaign breaks down as follows:

Grading                        $575.00

Barn kit                      $7190.00

Labor to install       $2400.00

Taxes/ Fees               $729.00

Total                        $10,894.00

 

You can Help:

Please use your social media accounts to spread the word for our campaign.  We would sincerely appreciate the help.  To read more about our farm- please visit:

www.sterlingshirefarm.com

Our facebook page-  sterlingshire farm

and our twitter account- sterlingshire farm ( @sterlngshreFarm)

story:
- We want friends and world travelers to get an immersive experience in our culture. We just need a bit of financing to meet a deadline and to take our project to scale. Please take a minute to read about what we are doing. - 


OUR STORY

Terranea is a community that has been growing grapes and olives for more than 4 years in Mendoza, Argentina.

We are running a 30-day crowdfunding campaign to meet a critical deadline. We need to finish paying for our irrigation system by late November 2015.

Our purpose is to protect the vineyards and the olive groves, and to ensure the agricultural jobs of dedicated men and women, currently a total of 30 families.

Our vision and motivation is to share our local knowledge, activities, experience, and skills with friends and world travelers.


THE PROBLEM

Due to a scarcity of irrigation water in the region, in December 2013 we took out a loan in pesos, offered by the government, to buy an irrigation system worth USD 50,000. In February 2014, the economy in Argentina took an unexpected hit, the peso was devalued and hence the value of our loan fell to roughly USD 30,000.  Suddenly we found ourselves USD 19,500 short of what we needed to finish paying for the system.

The government demands that the system be fully installed by the end of 2015.

We have two alternatives. Pay the suppliers USD 19,500 to finish installing the irrigation system. Or sell the land and pay the USD 50,000 back to the government.

Selling the farm would be the easy way out for the Quiros family, who own the land. The farm today is worth considerably more than what they paid for it 4 years ago. That is so because developers may now build residences in our area, and that creates land speculation. These speculators are paying growers far higher prices than the real value of the agricultural land.

But if this happens, the developers that plan to buy the farm will fire all the workers, and rip out the vineyards and the olive trees.


Your support is a tool to change that

Your support will unlock opportunity for the community and have a positive environmental and social impact.

Your support will help Santos, Maria, Jose, Ezequiel, Roberto and other community members, portrayed in the pictures, from having to migrate to the city with their families in search of any kind of job they can find.

They have lived in this region and worked on the land for generations. They belong here.

Your support will also help to prevent the developers from ripping out the olive trees and the vineyards of our farm, which is located in Maipú, Mendoza, a wine region with unique soil and weather conditions.


¨Mendoza is considered the heart of the winemaking industry in Argentina¨ - and - ¨the principal wine producing areas - of Mendoza - fall into two main departments, Maipú and Luján,  which include Argentina's first delineated appellation.


THE COMMUNITY AND THE ENVIRONMENT

Santos is the vineyard master and he is vital to our operations. We all collaborate so he can have housing, utilities, and health care at the farm. He has truly earned it; he is one of the most honest and hardworking individuals I´ve ever known.



Negra is Santos´ life companion. She is a street dog who is eternally grateful to have been saved from starvation by Santos.

The Quirós Family is comprised by Laura, Osvaldo , Paulo and I. We have been involved in every detail right from the birth of the community of Terranea.

Roxana and Julieta are independent winemakers who choose the grapes they like and buy the small batches they need at fair prices. Once a year, we organize a tasting to savor the delicious wines they make.


The rest of the community is comprised of about 30 dedicated local families who work in the vineyard and in the olive groves at different times of the year. They are in charge of irrigation, floor management, pruning, leafing, green thinning, canopy management, regular testing, and fertilization activities.

Looking after the environment is our parents and grandparents legacy. It is how they interpreted life back then. They treated nature with respect and care and in return they lived happier, healthier, simpler and more rewarding lives.


HOW WE PLAN TO MOVE FORWARD

Terranea is based in a 14-acre property where we currently grow grapes and olives in a sustainable manner.

Adam and Laura and their children, León and Lucia live at our farm. They support and work closely together with local growers of organic fresh fruits and vegetables, which they supply to families and restaurants in Mendoza.

The farm is in transition to become full organic with Adam´s professional advice and support.


As a complementary income activity, we´ve been preparing to offer world travelers a place to relax among the vineyards, enjoy mouthwatering homemade dishes and savor delicious wines.

We have decided to embark on this pursuit together with other growers in the area that are all part of colonia El Zorzal, a colony that was founded more than 70 years ago. Our ultimate goal was to gain municipal recognition, which we achieved in August 2014 when colonia El Zorzal was formally presented as a tourism destination.

On our side, we are proud to announce that as of August 2015, Terranea was awarded with a municipal permission for tourism activities on our farm.


Expertise, support and commitment

Santos´ expertise with farm management and his ability to choose the right people for each farming activity has been the key to the amazing progress we have already achieved in the vineyard and the olive groves.

My personal experience helped in gathering the community, dealing with private and government institutions and negotiating with buyers and suppliers.

I will use my marketing background and the support of the Ministry of Tourism of Mendoza to position our farm as a benchmark of the ¨back to the roots experience¨.

We have developed a strategy to offer tourists an alternative to the classic experience they get at wineries and vineyards in the different wine regions they visit around the world.

We are passionate about sharing our local knowledge, activities, experience, and skills to connect directly with friends and world travelers. They get an immersive experience while we gain opportunity to support our community. 

Terranea will offer visitors gourmet products handcrafted by us and by the other members of colonia El Zorzal. Today among other delights we can offer freshly baked bread and empanadas, organic wines, tomato paste and olives, and plum and cherry preserves.


Mendoza a tourism revelation

According to the United Nations World Tourism Organization (UNWTO), ¨In 2014, there were over 181 million international tourist arrivals to the Americas, an increase of 8.0% over 2013.¨ 

In 2014, Argentina was the fifth most visited country in the region with 5.9 million visitors. 

Several other provinces in Argentina, such as Salta, Córdoba and San Juan, produce wine, but Mendoza is the star of the show due to the incredible diversity of its production. Its wines range between world-famous, award-winning malbecs, and simple vino patero (foot-pressed wine). That diversity is also evident in Mendoza’s terroir. The eastern department of Maipú - home to big -name wineries such as Trapiche, Zuccardi and López - reaches 700 metres above sea level. 

According to the British newspaper The Guardian, ¨Mendoza is one of the top 10 bike-friendly wine routes¨ among ¨a selection of routes that take in some of the best wine regions across the planet¨.


The district of Coquimbito, the rural wine area cited in the article above, belongs to the department of Maipú and is situated right next to the district of Russell, where our farm is located.

The Wine Enthusiast, one of leading wine magazines in the globe, chose Mendoza as one of the 10 Best Wine Travel Destinations of 2014. ¨Mendoza is more than just mountains and Malbec. Over the past 15 years, this desert wine region, located some 700 miles west of Buenos Aires, has evolved into a top destination for wine tourism.¨ 


THE ASK!

We need usd 19,500 by late November 2015 to finish paying for a water irrigation system which will ensure agricultural jobs and will sustain the environment. We have a trajectory in sustainable agriculture and are in transition to become full organic.  We have established a network of in-country field partners to reach out to tourists from around the globe.

Terranea is all about community. While a financial contribution has the greatest direct impact, we also need your support in helping us build community and promote our campaign. Please share the following link throughout your networks to help us in getting out the word: http://igg.me/at/terranea/x/12584129

Our community thanks you from the bottom of our hearts for your kind consideration.


Explain where the money is going

At this point, we´ve contracted the engineer, built the reservoir, the water well and a power station. We´ve also purchased the geomembrane, water pumps, the control panel and cabling.


Donations will be used to buy drip irrigation tubing, adapters, fittings, valves, hose and emitters, the nutrient injection tanks and equipment, contract trenching works, laying and welding of the geomembrane on the surface reservoir, materials and labor for the construction of the pumping chamber and sand decanter, and the labor for the installation of the whole system.

To irrigate the farm we currently use an old fashioned gravity system made of dirt trenches which filtrate and waste up to 50 percent of the scarce snowmelt irrigation water we receive.

Once the drip irrigation system is installed we´ll use one single stone-paved ditch to channel all irrigation water into the reservoir. On top of that we´ll be able to supply extra 4500 gallons of water per hour from our water well.

The drip irrigation system will allow us to expand the cultivated area and it will ensure that we hydrate all plants properly and waste no water.


PERKS

Many of you, our friends, have expressed that you would support the cause just because you believe in what we are doing and we will keep your contribution anonymous if you choose so.

Nevertheless, we courteously offer these gifts to you as the fruits of our community work.


THE REWARDS

The best reward of all is the harmonious environment between people and nature that we ALL have created; and with your contribution, you can adopt a vine or an olive tree, have it named after yourself and be an actual part of the community, even when you are miles away from Mendoza!

The experience of creating this community has been extremely exciting!

We invite you to come to Mendoza and share it with us. There will be dinners and picnics on our farm and, of course, there will be lots and lots of Roxana and Julieta’s wine!



We cannot predict where this journey will take us, but we are going to have an amazing time getting there; and we´d really love to have you along for the ride. 

Thanks for your kind consideration!!
story_txt:
- We want friends and world travelers to get an
immersive experience in our culture. We
just need a bit of financing to meet a deadline and to take our project to scale. Please take a minute to read
about what we are doing. - OUR STORY

Terranea is a community that has been growing grapes and olives for more than 4 years in Mendoza, Argentina.
We are running a 30-day crowdfunding campaign to meet a critical deadline. We need to finish paying for our irrigation system by late November 2015.Our purpose is to protect the vineyards and the olive groves, and to ensure the agricultural jobs of dedicated men and women, currently a total of 30 families.Our vision and motivation is to share our local knowledge, activities, experience, and skills with friends and world travelers.
THE PROBLEM
Due to a scarcity of irrigation water in the region, in December 2013 we took out
a loan in pesos, offered by the government, to buy an irrigation system worth
USD 50,000. In February 2014, the economy in Argentina took an unexpected hit,
the peso was devalued and hence the value of our loan fell to roughly USD
30,000.  Suddenly we found ourselves USD 19,500 short of what we needed to
finish paying for the system.

The government demands that the system be fully installed by
the end of 2015. 
We have two alternatives. Pay the suppliers USD 19,500 to finish
installing the irrigation system. Or sell the land and pay the USD 50,000 back
to the government.Selling the farm would be the easy way out for the Quiros family, who own the land. The farm today is worth considerably more than what they paid for it 4 years ago. That is so because developers may now build residences in our area, and that creates land speculation. These speculators are paying growers far higher prices than the real value of the agricultural land.But if this happens, the developers that plan to buy
the farm will fire all the workers, and rip out the vineyards and the olive
trees.
Your support is
a tool to change that
Your
support will unlock opportunity for the community and have a positive
environmental and social impact.

Your support will help Santos, Maria, Jose, Ezequiel, Roberto
and other community members, portrayed in the pictures, from having to migrate
to the city with their families in search of any kind of job they can find.They have lived in this region and worked on the land for
generations. They belong here.
Your support will also help to prevent the developers from ripping
out the olive trees and the vineyards of our farm, which is located in Maipú, Mendoza,
a wine region with unique soil and weather conditions.
¨Mendoza is considered the heart of the winemaking industry in Argentina¨ - and - ¨the principal
wine producing areas - of Mendoza - fall into two main departments, Maipú and
Luján,  which include Argentina's first
delineated appellation.THE COMMUNITY AND THE ENVIRONMENT
Santos is the vineyard master and he is vital to our
operations. We all collaborate so he can have housing, utilities, and health
care at the farm. He has truly earned it; he is one of the most honest and
hardworking individuals I´ve ever known.


Negra is Santos´ life companion. She is a street
dog who is eternally grateful to have been saved from starvation by Santos.

The Quirós Family is comprised by Laura, Osvaldo , Paulo and
I. We have been involved in every detail right from the birth of the community
of Terranea.
Roxana and Julieta are independent winemakers who choose the
grapes they like and buy the small batches they need at fair prices. Once a
year, we organize a tasting to savor the delicious wines they make.
The rest of the community is comprised of about 30 dedicated local
families who work in the vineyard and in the olive groves at different times of
the year. They are in charge of irrigation, floor management, pruning, leafing,
green thinning, canopy management, regular testing, and fertilization
activities.
Looking after the environment is our parents and grandparents
legacy. It is how they interpreted life back then. They treated nature with
respect and care and in return they lived happier, healthier, simpler and more
rewarding lives.HOW WE PLAN TO MOVE FORWARD
Terranea is based in a 14-acre property where we currently
grow grapes and olives in a sustainable
manner.Adam and Laura and their children, León and Lucia live at our
farm. They support and work closely together with local growers of organic
fresh fruits and vegetables, which they supply to families and restaurants in
Mendoza.The farm is in transition to become full organic with Adam´s professional advice and support.As a complementary income activity, we´ve been preparing to
offer world travelers a place to relax among the vineyards, enjoy mouthwatering

founded more than 70 years ago. Our ultimate goal was to gain municipal
recognition, which we achieved in August 2014 when colonia El Zorzal was
formally presented as a tourism destination.
On our side, we are proud to announce that as of August 2015,
Terranea was awarded with a municipal permission for tourism activities on our
farm. 
Expertise,
support and commitment
Santos´ expertise with farm management and his ability to
choose the right people for each farming activity has been the key to the
amazing progress we have already achieved in the vineyard and the olive groves.
My personal experience helped in gathering the community,
dealing with private and government institutions and negotiating with buyers
and suppliers.
I will use my marketing background and the support of the
Ministry of Tourism of Mendoza to position our farm as a benchmark of the ¨back
to the roots experience¨.
We have developed a strategy to offer tourists an alternative
to the classic experience they get at wineries and vineyards in the different
wine regions they visit around the world.

activities, experience, and skills to connect directly with friends and world travelers.
They get an immersive experience while we gain opportunity to support our
community. Terranea will offer visitors gourmet products handcrafted by
us and by the other members of colonia El Zorzal. Today among other delights we
can offer freshly baked bread and empanadas, organic wines, tomato paste and
olives, and plum and cherry preserves.

tourism revelation
According
to the United Nations World Tourism Organization (UNWTO), ¨In 2014, there were
over 181 million international tourist arrivals to the Americas, an increase of
8.0% over 2013.¨ 
In
2014, Argentina was the fifth most visited country in the region with 5.9 million visitors. 
Several

story:
Breve reseña / the Brief

Nuestro sistema de alimentación mundial es ineficiente, está mal diseñado y nos está perjudicando a todos. Nadie está libre

Our world food chain y rot. It is inefficient, badly design and is harming us all. No one is guilt free on this.

Sabemos que el 30% de los alimentos que se producen en el mundo se tiran a la basura. Las grandes producciones horticultoras y las grandes cadenas de supermercado han eliminado a la agricultura local.

We know that 30% of our food produced in a year is discarded as garbage. Large food chain systems for veggies have destroyed local food source, local agriculture & and small scale farming. 

Nosotros como consumidores hemos perdido la libertad de elegir que comer porque solo tenemos accesible lo que es negocio producir y vender.  No lo que es bueno para nosotros comer.

As consumers we have lost our liberty to chose what to eat because our access to food is ruled by business and profit and not by what is good or healthy for us to eat.

Como consumidores no somos conscientes de esta situación porque solo se nos informa el precio del producto pero no el costo social y ambiental de los productos que consumimos.

We may say as consumers we are not conscious of this situation because no one give us information besides the price of the product. We are not fully aware of the environmental and social cost of our food source system. But let’s face it,  this is willful ignorance.

"Si una lechuga enveneno a una comunidad entera, y los trabajadores estuvieron expuestos a productos cancerígenos o hubo trabajo infantil, no tenemos idea de que nos estamos echando a la boca"

"If a lettuce that we by in the grocery poisoned a whole community and workers were exposed to cancerogenous products or there was child labor... We don’t really know what we are putting in our mouth.

No somos conscientes de esto, ese es un problema. Pero somos cómplices  porque es nuestra opción de compra la que mantiene este sistema perverso.

We are not conscious about this problem, but we are accomplice at the time we give our support with our buying decision to maintain this perverse system.

Como una solución a este problema, hemos construido https://app.mihuertoweb.cl/ una plataforma web que permite fomentar una producción agrícola local, sustentable justa e inclusiva.

As a solution for this problem, we have developed http://mihuertoweb.cl/ a web app platform that promotes local agriculture in a frame of sustainability, fair trade and Inclusive business development.

El piloto lo estamos desarrollando en Valdivia para ayudar a la Agricultura Familiar Campesina, pero queremos llegar a todo el Mundo.

Our first prototype is being implemented in Valdivia, Chile to help small local farms that live in a subsistence economy, but we expect to grow to every community in the world.

Queremos que en cualquier comunidad del mundo en que vivas, puedas ser parte de una agricultura local sustentable, justa e inclusiva.

In any community where you live, we want you to be part of a local agriculture, sustainable, fair trade and inclusive.


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes / what we need & what you get.

Queremos crear una nuevos sistema agro alimentario mas sustentable y eficiente. Pero no podemos autofinanciarnos en los primeros años.

We want to build a whole new food chain system more sustainable and more efficient. But we do not brake -even in the first years.

Los fondos de esta campaña son para financiar en parte equipo de trabajo en el siguiente año. Somos un equipo de 12 personas entre los que están los programadores y diseñadores de la plataforma, comunicadores, comerciales, sociólogos, agrónomos y los primeros gestores territoriales. (Sin honorarios aun)

Founding from this campaign will help finance the core team for the next year. We are a 12 member team, from web designers & programmers to engineer’s sociologist journalist, agronomist and territorial managers. (working PRO Bono mainly)

Para instalarnos en cada nueva comunidad hay que hacer una importante inversión en viajes, reuniones y horas hombre del equipo para activar una nueva comunidad local.

To install the program in any new community there is an important investment to do in terms of traveling meetings and time to activate a new community with growers and local managers.

Hemos recibido interés de muchas comunidades en Chile y otros países. España, Colombia, México y EEUU.

We have received interest from communities abroad in countries like Spain, Colombia, Mexico and United States.

Nuestra velocidad para llegar a otros países solo dependerá de los recursos que podamos invertir para trabajar en cada una de las comunidades y hacer crecer el equipo.

Our speed to grow and reach other communities and countries will only depend on the budget we can invest to work with other communities and grow our local teams.


El impacto / the Impact

Para enfrentar los problemas globales, necesitamos de acción locales

To face Global Problems, we need local actions

Mi Huerto web, cambia las reglas del juego para que sea el consumidor quien decide que se produce como se produce y quien lo produce. 

Mi Huerto web, changes the rules of the game, so it can be the consumer what rules and decides what to eat, and how to grow it.

Queremos recuperar la conciencia de los que comemos, cuando lo comemos y quien nos produce esos alimentos con cariño. Estamos construyendo una relación directa entre consumidor y productor.

We want to recover our awareness of what we eat, when we eat, and who produces our food with tender and love. We are building a trustful and direct relation between consumer and producer.

.

story:
Blue Lizard Farm, Project Hoop House, SAVE THE FARM

Hi! We are Rodney & Christine Mehring, and we own Blue Lizard Farm in Lincoln Co. NV, 2 1/2 hours north of Las Vegas, NV.  We grow a wide variety of produce throughout the year, with some varieties year round. We sell produce to several Chefs on the Strip and Downtown Vegas, and what we love most are the  farmer’s markets. There’s nothing like getting to meet the people who will enjoy the fruits of our labors.


Our Goal $67000

My farm is failing not because plants don't grow or I can't sell my goods. I sell out every week and I have run out of hoop house space to grow. It's failing because of transportation costs. I need more hoop houses and produce to make the trip to market more cost effective. We spend $2000.00 each month on transportation and are behind on all our bills. We are tapped out we have put every dollar we have into this farm. We have a clear goal to expand. We can't do this without your help. I know we are asking for a lot from the public, but if you look at what the farm gives back its really worth it. We try to live as green as we can. We are a net help to the environment by sequestering carbon by growing good food and composting. Food that is free of harmful pesticides.

I read all the time, not as much as I would like to, the farm comes second after family so those two keep us busy. I read just the other day that your food travels 3000 miles on average before you get to eat it. That's a long ways. What happens in that time period to the food? My food only has to travel 150 miles.

I need your support so we can continue to do this work of feeding the world good food and responsible food. Las Vegas is a world vacation point, so we really do help feed the world with our little farm.

Please donate to our indigogo campaign and I promise I will do my part to bring great food to the world.

The Plan

A new Government program Rodney helped develop, has been introduced to expand micro farms!

It allows micro farms to purchase up to $50000 each year of equipment that will help the farm conserve water, which translates to 5 Hoop Houses a year, and then reimburses us for a large percentage of our expense.  So once we get the first 5 Hoop Houses, we will be able to purchase 5 more next year, and the year after that, and the year after that!  Simply put, more hoop houses means more produce in the truck.

To support the new hoop houses, we need to upgrade our well and add irrigation lines, $6000
Perks, Video, Marketing and fees  $11000

Your investment in our Indiegogo campaign will allow us to continue to grow our business each year and to provide an ever growing supply of fresh organic produce to the restaurants and people in the Las Vegas Community.

Our Story ( Our Mission, Our Dream)

Blue Lizard Farm is our home. Ten years ago we owned an Africanized Bee Removal company in Las Vegas. When it became obvious that Rodney's health was suffering from the continuous pesticide exposure we knew it was time to leave the city and find a simpler, healthier life for ourselves and our children. Rodney has kept bees since his early twenties, and we thought at first that we would return to full-time beekeeping, as we had done in Southern Arizona. However, his continuing work as the beekeeper for UNLV's biology department kept us within weekly commuting distance, which meant staying in the Great Basin Desert, the stark beauty of which lacks the rich biodiversity of the Sonoran Desert we'd known before. Not an ideal beekeeping area. Still, we were drawn to Lincoln county because of its beauty, the cooler weather, and the very rural atmosphere. We were able to purchase ten acres of utterly unimproved sagebrush desert and we set to work.

Everything you see on the farm today was put there by our own hands. We brought in the electric, put in the well, installed the plumbing and septic, built the buildings, and developed the soil. Our native soil is nearly sterile and low in organic matter, something uncomfortably close to gardening the moon. It took years of trial and error before we could feed ourselves. Without the hoop houses it would be difficult just to do that. Our local NRCS (Natural Resource Conservation Service, a branch of the USDA) agent was walking our place a year or so ago and he said "You know, if you'd asked me before you did this if it could have been done here, on this ground, I'd have told you you were nuts."


When we began working the bugs out of the system, Rodney started taking samples of our produce to chefs in Las Vegas, particularly the chefs who work for Mario Batali at his restaurants in the Venetian and the Palazzo. Their commitment to supporting and encouraging our dreams has gone above and beyond. Many chefs will say they support local and seasonal, but don't really understand what that entails. The chefs of the Batali Group are the real deal.

The period of test marketing was promising enough that three years ago we bit the bullet and took a loan to expand and develop Blue Lizard Farm. We added 12 steel frame 20x96 hoop houses and built a cleaning and packaging facility that is a fully state inspected commercial kitchen. Dealing primarily with leafy greens, we are aware of the potential risks and wanted to be able to ensure our customers, both wholesale and retail, a safe, wholesome, properly handled product that they could serve with confidence. We bought a refrigerated box truck to bring the fruit of our labors to the city. That loan required us to put up every thing we own as collateral.

Three years later we find that the cost of transportation is eating up every penny of profit. Our lender has been patient as we try to find a solution, but we must show that it is possible to increase our production enough to be viable by next spring. To be viable we have grow more vegetables. We have the demand. Every week we have orders we can't fill because there just isn't enough to go around. Every additional pound of spinach, or kale, or beets, or tomatoes we can add to the truck spreads the cost of the trip and increases the profit margin. Hoop houses are the key to our operation. They help us to take the edge off of our four main environmental hurdles: cold winters, hot summers, relentless winds, and wildlife. With them we can grow nearly year round, without them we are limited to our very short, intense, high desert summer.


The good news is that the NRCS is offering a new cost-share program for hoop houses which will, because of the amount of water we conserve using them, reimburse us for nearly the entire cost of this expansion. (This is the same program that encourages alfalfa farmers to convert their irrigation to those enormous circular pivots.)

So, why are we here asking you for help? Because we have to front the money ourselves, and we're tapped out, barely getting by, with nothing left to borrow against. However, it does offer you a unique opportunity to GROW your donation, because what we intend to do is fund this expansion of five new hoop houses, receive the reimbursement, then turn around and do the same thing next year, and the next, and the next until our farm is humming along like a stable, well-oiled machine, supporting itself and providing employment in our tiny community where the un/under-employment rate is near 20%. Your donation will roll forward for years to come, ensuring the ability to Blue Lizard Farm to continue to grow in health and for health.



the Perks

We have provided some perks to get us going, we have some exciting perks which we will be adding along the way.

Honey Perk ( see our bees making your Honey Perk)




Team Members
Blue Lizard Farm


Michael Renken  42 Aspens Productions

We will be providing the Social Media, and Video Support for this campaign, With Your help we can get this project funded.

(see about us for more info at 42aspens.com)

Robin Renken 42 Aspens Productions (4farm2mrkt)

We met Rodney & Christine at the Downtown 3rd Farmers Market in September of 2013.  This Spring Rodney mentioned he was trying to convince the Local Town council to create some Micro Farms by using some of the Water in Lincoln County.  Between 42 Aspens Productions and 4farm2mrkt we thought we could help so we created a video to help his presentation.  And that brought us Here!

( See about us for More at 4farm2mrkt.com)


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • If you are the local Area and want to volunteer, we have several local farms that need help.
  • Send us an Email with how you could help and we will put you in touch with a Farm in need.
  • When we get our new Hoop House we will need help putting them up.

We are in the beginning of an exciting new Food Movement.  Join the "Know your Local Farmer" Movement.  Lets Start with Micro Farms and keep the Local Food Movement Going. Live Love Lizard

Update

With the Effect of Global Warming and California Water Crisis, Nevada will be needing alternative Farms to help fill the need for fresh Produce. Rodney Mehring, with Blue Lizard Farm has been developing his Micro Farm on 10 acres using Hoop Houses. This is an efficient water saving way to grow Produce year round.  Lincoln County has the Water and the land and the interest.  Help support Rodney and Blue Lizard Farm to continue providing fresh Farm to Table Produce for Las Vegas, and Surrounding Areas.  Help the Local Food Movement. Support a Local Farm, Create Jobs, Feed the World.

You can help Blue Lizard Farm buy 5 more hoop houses to increase the amount of produce they can grow and help them save their farm.

If you have been thinking about helping Rodney and Christine. Now is the time.

Not only does it Save One Farm, It can Build MORE.


We will be adding more Perks and Videos along the Way.
Follow us on Facebook for more "Behind the scenes" at Blue Lizard Farm

Facebook Project Hoop House

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Project-Hoop-House/852380328183461
story_txt:
Blue Lizard Farm, Project Hoop House, SAVE THE FARMHi! We are Rodney & Christine Mehring, and we own Blue Lizard Farm in Lincoln Co. NV, 2 1/2 hours north of Las Vegas, NV.  We grow a wide variety of produce
throughout the year, with some varieties year round. We sell produce to several
Chefs on the Strip and Downtown Vegas, and what we love most are the  farmer’s
markets. There’s nothing like getting to meet the people who will enjoy the
fruits of our labors.
Our Goal $67000

My farm is failing not because plants don't
grow or I can't sell my goods. I sell out every week and I have run out of hoop
house space to grow. It's failing because of transportation costs. I need more
hoop houses and produce to make the trip to market more cost effective. We
spend $2000.00 each month on transportation and are behind on all our bills. We
are tapped out we have put every dollar we have into this farm. We have a clear
goal to expand. We can't do this without your help. I know we are asking for a
lot from the public, but if you look at what the farm gives back its really
worth it. We try to live as green as we can. We are a net help to the
environment by sequestering carbon by growing good food and composting. Food
that is free of harmful pesticides.
I read all the time, not as much as I would
like to, the farm comes second after family so those two keep us busy. I read
just the other day that your food travels 3000 miles on average before you get
to eat it. That's a long ways. What happens in that time period to the food? My
food only has to travel 150 miles.
I need your support so we can continue to do
this work of feeding the world good food and responsible food. Las Vegas is a
world vacation point, so we really do help feed the world with our little farm.

Please donate to our indigogo campaign and I
promise I will do my part to bring great food to the world.The Plan

A new Government program Rodney helped develop, has been introduced to expand micro farms!  It
 allows micro farms to purchase up to $50000 each year of equipment that will help the farm conserve water, which translates 
to 5 Hoop Houses a year, and then reimburses us for a large percentage of our expense.  So once we get the 
first 5 Hoop Houses, we will be able to purchase 5 more next year, and 
the year after that, and the year after that!  Simply put, more hoop 
houses means more produce in the truck.To support the new hoop houses, we need to upgrade our well and add irrigation lines, $6000Perks, Video, Marketing and fees  $11000Your investment in our Indiegogo campaign will allow
us to continue to grow our business each year and to provide an ever growing supply of fresh organic produce to the restaurants and people in the Las Vegas Community.

Our Story ( Our Mission, Our Dream)Blue Lizard Farm is our home. Ten years ago we owned an Africanized Bee Removal company in Las Vegas. When it became obvious that Rodney's health was suffering from the continuous pesticide exposure we knew it was time to leave the city and find a simpler, healthier life for ourselves and our children. Rodney has kept bees since his early twenties, and we thought at first that we would return to full-time beekeeping, as we had done in Southern Arizona. However, his continuing work as the beekeeper for UNLV's biology department kept us within weekly commuting distance, which meant staying in the Great Basin Desert, the stark beauty of which lacks the rich biodiversity of the Sonoran Desert we'd known before. Not an ideal beekeeping area. Still, we were drawn to Lincoln county because of its beauty, the cooler weather, and the very rural atmosphere. We were able to purchase ten acres of utterly unimproved sagebrush desert and we set to work. Everything you see on the farm today was put there by our own hands. We brought in the electric, put in the well, installed the plumbing and septic, built the buildings, and developed the soil. Our native soil is nearly sterile and low in organic matter, something uncomfortably close to gardening the moon. It took years of trial and error before we could feed ourselves. Without the hoop houses it would be difficult just to do that. Our local NRCS (Natural Resource Conservation Service, a branch of the USDA) agent was walking our place a year or so ago and he said "You know, if you'd asked me before you did this if it could have been done here, on this ground, I'd have told you you were nuts." When we began working the bugs out of the system, Rodney started taking samples of our produce to chefs in Las Vegas, particularly the chefs who work for Mario Batali at his restaurants in the Venetian and the Palazzo. Their commitment to supporting and encouraging our dreams has gone above and beyond. Many chefs will say they support local and seasonal, but don't really understand what that entails. The chefs of the Batali Group are the real deal.The period of test marketing was promising enough that three years ago we bit the bullet and took a loan to expand and develop Blue Lizard Farm. We added 12 steel frame 20x96 hoop houses and built a cleaning and packaging facility that is a fully state inspected commercial kitchen. Dealing primarily with leafy greens, we are aware of the potential risks and wanted to be able to ensure our customers, both wholesale and retail, a safe, wholesome, properly handled product that they could serve with confidence. We bought a refrigerated box truck to bring the fruit of our labors to the city. That loan required us to put up every thing we own as collateral. Three years later we find that the cost of transportation is eating up every penny of profit. Our lender has been patient as we try to find a solution, but we must show that it is possible to increase our production enough to be viable by next spring. To be viable we have grow more vegetables. We have the demand. Every week we have orders we can't fill because there just isn't enough to go around. Every additional pound of spinach, or kale, or beets, or tomatoes we can add to the truck spreads the cost of the trip and increases the profit margin. Hoop houses are the key to our operation. They help us to take the edge off of our four main environmental hurdles: cold winters, hot summers, relentless winds, and wildlife. With them we can grow nearly year round, without them we are limited to our very short, intense, high desert summer. The good news is that the NRCS is offering a new cost-share program for hoop houses which will, because of the amount of water we conserve using them, reimburse us for nearly the entire cost of this expansion. (This is the same program that encourages alfalfa farmers to convert their irrigation to those enormous circular pivots.) So, why are we here asking you for help? Because we have to front the money ourselves, and we're tapped out, barely getting by, with nothing left to borrow against. However, it does offer you a unique opportunity to GROW your donation, because what we intend to do is fund this expansion of five new hoop houses, receive the reimbursement, then turn around and do the same thing next year, and the next, and the next until our farm is humming along like a stable, well-oiled machine, supporting itself and providing employment in our tiny community where the un/under-employment rate is near 20%. Your donation will roll forward for years to come, ensuring the ability to Blue Lizard Farm to continue to grow in health and for health.

story:
The Story

I am a skater and my passion runs deep for the culture that has helped shaped the positive person I have become today. I love being a part of the skate community and that is why I have helped it from building urban skate spots to helping the youth get sponsors. I want to further help the skate community by offering a personal place for them to buy their skateboard goods. I live near a place where there is not a single skate shop in the local area. This area spans to three towns total. There are many skaters here, from all walks of life, and they all deserve to have a skate shop that they can call their second home.

El Sereno Skaters learning how to build their own ledge. We take part in the effort to build stronger communities.
The Spill

I am 30 years old and have an awesome family and friends. The skate community is one of the best sub cultures to belong to. We are passionate, creative and we all share the enjoyment of skating. I first got into skating when I was 9 years old,  going to the local skate shop to buy my first board was life changing and the impression it left on me still echoes today. I feel like many kids today are missing out on that experience, because they either buy their skateboards online or from a Mall shop that has no personal connection to it's customers.

I want to bring the personal experience back to those connected to skateboarding weather you are a beginner or an old vert dawg. That is why I am asking friends, family, strangers, and the skate community overall to contribute to the opening of Underground Skate Supply. Your time and/or donations will help open the doors to thousands of skaters from South Pasadena/El Sereno/Alhambra area. There currently is not a skate shop in the entire city of Alhambra and South Pasadena, although South Pasadena has a skate park and their thousands of skaters in the surrounding area. This shop will go beyond just selling skateboard equipment and clothes. It will offer workshop classes on how to shoot skateboard photography, how to build your own DIY spot and much more. I will also advocate for a skate park in Alhambra, which currently does not have a skate park. I want to be connected with the skate and residential community and bring positive change to the kids of these areas.

What the Skate Shop Needs & What You Get

At this point I need funding of about $ 8,000 for inventory, leasing options, in-shop equipment, skateboard racks, display cases, cosmetic upgrades to the location, and shop brand apparel and items. This will also allow me to offer free workshops that I mentioned in the above paragraph and to purchase the items I am offering for donations. I will be opening this shop even if I do not get full funding. I will not get as much inventory and buffer zone, but rest a sure that the shop will open by August of 2015! All Perks offered will be given within the first year of operation depending on the item. Thank you for your patience.


    Community Impact

    We all know that it is important for the community to be well connected to each other. It is crucial for our youth to understand the importance of community and the idea that our purchase is our vote. Let's face it, the idea of small business seems like an antiquated idea, but more and more younger people are realizing that connection is much more important than saving a Dollar or two.
    I am very well connected to the skate community as a whole. I have worked with skateboard magazines, skate clothing companies and a skate shoe brand and understand the what is needed to run a successful skate shop.

    Taking part in building a skate spot close to Alhambra with the local skaters.

      Risks & Challenges

      Anytime you are taking a chance, it is a risk. The skateboard scene is over saturated with companies trying to make a quick buck. Skate Shops have to compete with Mall Chains and Online Services. Ah, but there is something they cannot compete with... The passion, connection, and sense of a real community. They do not offer variety and real support for smaller companies. They only offer a line,  homogenizing  the industry (options) to only having certain brands. I will offer smaller and bigger names so the consumer actually has an option. I will have a true connection with my customers, something they can never offer.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        I welcome all donations and I want to thank you SO much for taking the time to watch the video and read these words. If you cannot help financially, I implore you to spread this message and campaign like a virus. Let Skateboarding take you places.

        Contact me with any questions. Thank you.
        Email: undergroundskatesupply@gmai.com

story:
We opened our gym in September 2014. Our motivation was driven by our passion for fitness, nutrition, and health. As our clientele base grew, we found that tying together nutrition and fitness offered a higher success rate for lifestyle changes and goal reaching for our clients... that moment has led us here. 

Each week since, our health family has grown and we have come to realize that people often run into a stand still between having a healthy balance between fitness and nutrition. With busy lives, families, and every day chaos, finding the time to work out and then prepare a balanced meal in a days time just isn't feasible. 

We want to add the ease of health into as many lives and families as possible. With the expansion of our services, we want to not only make our meals more readily available but also offer a delivery to a 75-mile radius, meal planning, nutrition basics, and family workshops. In addition to this we also want to expand our meal options to include a completely organic/grass fed menu as well as a gluten free menu. 

As our focus is on a healthy community, we also plan to work with local gyms to host events for the family… with a meal to follow. 

What We Need & What You Get

$50,000... we know it seems like a lot, but really its the minimum we need to follow through with our expansion. Right now our prices can't be matched or beat. Our main focus is to keep our cost low and our quality high. 

To offer extended services with free community events here’s what we need:

Fully built commercial kitchen - this includes a range, steamer, stainless steal prep tables, cold prep salad bar, refrigerators, and smaller appliances (rice cookers, blenders, food processor, mixing bowls). Did you notice we didn't list a freezer, all of our food is prepped fresh!

Location Location Location - we want to stay in the Cool Springs area as it is a central location.  Moving and finding a larger space cost more. The average price per square foot in this area is $32... we just need to get in a place! Our food will pay for itself.   

Offering a larger delivery radius allows us to impact our community beyond our current capabilities. With this we need cooling bags to transport our meals... we are always keeping safety in mind. 

Recycling program - We want to implement a recycling program for our repeat customers. This program will offer customized, reusable bags for people to store their clean containers and reuse them with their next order. This wouldn't be a mandatory requirement; however would give the option to lessen our footprint on the environment. 

Reaching our goal - with all funds raise, we are going to directly invest the funds into expanding our services to truly support a positive change in the community. 

The Impact

Obesity is on the rise. A lot of emphasis is put on becoming healthier, but now a days it seems as healthy is the most expensive option. We want to bring it all in at The Family F.A.R.M (fitness and ready meals). The F.A.R.M. will offer healthy foods (already prepared) at reasonable prices,  and free classes and events such as: understanding calories, doing your own meal prep, the importance of macronutrients, basics of weight lifting, and family events where you will have the option to build your own meal and eat a healthy meal following a fun, active family event. 

Success in our campaign will offer our community a central location to making healthy lifestyle changes without worrying about a high cost or financial commitment.

Risks & Challenges

Our risks and challenges to our campaign are very low. The biggest challenge we are faced with is the funding and time. That’s why we are here. We need your help and support! 

Other Ways You Can Help

As we understand the challenges of our current economy, we know that some people may not be able to contribute, and that’s ok! If you believe in our cause help get the word out by sharing our campaign. Just a click of the button is all it takes.

story:
Thanks to our First Round of Funding Contributors!

Thanks to everyone who contributed to our project in Round 1. Your contributions helped us get production started and we're on the move!


Own a Pistol and want piece of Mind?

Do you own a pistol for home protection?

Where do you store it? 

Is it concealed and safely out of reach from children, grand kids and or guests?

Moving from Prototype to Production

We have spent the past few months selecting the best wood combinations and perfecting the size, dimensions and mounting hardware.

The transition from prototype to production requires a sizable investment in a large amount of quality wood and rare earth magnetics.  Purchasing these items in small batches would increase the unit cost by 50 to 100% each.


Quality Materials and American Made

Lets be honest - There are similar products on the market but the old adage is true - you get what you pay for.

Our US Flag is 100% American Made - By Americans.

Our US Flag is made from American Hardwoods.  We use Walnut, Ash and Basswood harvested from Florida and Georgia. 

Risks & Challenges

We have three small design changes to make before heading into the full production.  We are ordering materials in anticipation of producing 40 units and shipped them in time for Christmas 2015.  Our real challange will be finding enough time between now and Dec 20th.

The first production batch will not be compatible with pistols that have an RMR sight.

Other Ways You Can Help

If the time isn't right for you to purchase one at this very moment, you can assist us by merely spreading the word.  

If we can assist in keeping a family secure and keep their children safe, we have accomplished out mission!

Thanks to everyone who contributed to our project in Round 1. Your contributions helped us get production started and we're on the move!
