story:
As Peace Corps Volunteers in Panama, we lived alongside rural agricultural producers, working to better plan their farms and develop their businesses.  We saw some positive changes, but as our service came to an end, we asked ourselves and our local counterparts how we could truly make a positive impact in their communities. The answer resonated loud and clear:  access to retail markets.  So, rather than spin our wheels and hunt for small ins, we are opening our own marketplace in the capital, Panama City,  to showcase a truly inclusive, transparent supply chain--a place to connect small, rural producers with the consumers in the city that yearn to support them.

El Motete Marketplace

El Motete Marketplace is a retail store in Panama City aiming to bridge the gap between rural and urban Panama.  With an emphasis on community, culture and food, our's is a space to empower small producers to grow their businesses and strengthen agricultural communities. Through personal relationships with our producers, we use a grassroots supply chain to stock the highest quality produce, staple foods, specialty goods, body care and more.  El Motete Marketplace is our first step and financial engine towards supporting a more inclusive, transparent local food scene in Panama.  To foster a model that truly benefits the campesino farmers with whom we worked in the Peace Corps, we will dedicate a percentage of our profits to programs and trainings to help our producers scale their businesses, and grow their market share.

             

Will Ridlehoover worked for two years alongside coffee farmers in the Province of Veraguas implementing agribusiness trainings and teaching biology and chemistry in the local high school. He also worked in Los Santos in support of sustainable cattle ranching projects through the Smithsonian's Environmental Leadership and Training Initiative. Before Panama, Will worked extensively in agriculture and education at the Program in Ecological Agriculture and Society (PEAS), The Watershed Education Network, and the Outward Bound School. Deeply committed to creating an inclusive agricultural supply chain, he lives for his passion: empowering farmers and producers to protect the biosphere, preserve their rich traditional lifestyles, and make a buck doing it. Will holds a degree from the University of Montana in Environmental Studies with a concentration in Sustainable Food Systems and Agroecology. He resides in Panama City, Panama.

Megan Vose spent the last two years working along side cacao farmers in the region of Bocas del Toro, Panama where she supported disease prevention, farm management and agribusiness assistance. She also led a fundraising project to build a traditional birthing center, with a group of Midwives in her community. Before living in Panamá, among other things, Megan was as a produce buyer for Whole Foods Market where she spent nearly 8 years. She has extensive experience in Latin American and India in commodity agriculture, value added products and supply chain creation. Megan works with California Farm Link as a Loan Analyst and Farmer Advisor, and is finishing a Masters in International Environmental Policy with a focus on Business, Sustainability and Development at the Middlebury Insititute of International Studies. She is taking advantage of opportunities at MIIS to refine El Motete’s model of social impact, but can’t wait to get back to the Isthmus in May 2016.

We need your help to transform our vision into a reality--to remodel our store and stock our shelves. On top of the financial support, we want to share our passion for empowering small producers with our friends, family, and the world! Indiegogo  is our chance to involve a greater network of people invested in refining our vision, and creating a truly positive social and economic impact for campesino farmers.

What You Get

Our perks represent the spirit of business, agriculture, and craftsmanship we support at El Motete Marketplace.  These products are hand-made, from communities that we know well from our time in the Peace Corps and in developing our supply chain for the store.  We hope you get a taste of the amazing products coming from all over Panama.

       

      

           

   

El Motete Marketplace is our first step and financial engine to cultivate a more sustainable, resilient and locally engaging food supply chain in Panama. Through our retail space we will support small hold farmers and producers in Panama in gaining market share in the growing high end and specialty food market in Panama City.  As we scale up, we will gear our growth towards systems that will best benefit local producers, and encourage co-growth. While our long term impact plans are dynamic, we will contribute a percentage of our profits to programs and trainings aimed at building farmer, producer and consumer buy in and capacity.

Our model is inclusive, and our goal is to give every link in the supply chain a voice, a share and stake in El Motete Marketplace. 

We realize that starting a business comes with great risks. With that, we feel confident that the network of both business owners and producers that we have built within Panama will support us as we overcome hurdles, and fine tune our business model towards profitability and a positive social impact.  We have a long ways to go in refining what El Motete Marketplace is and what it stands to be in the future, but are proud of our small first step towards this shift in the food system. By avoiding high initial overhead and a large store, we create opportunities for strategic growth with truly positive social impacts.

 We know that money can be challenging (trust us, we lived as Peace Corps volunteers!)  But there are other ways you can help:

By sharing our Indiegogo campaign via Facebook, Instagram, email, twitter, or giant blimp….you us to spread our message and build our network.  Here are some tips on best ways to maximize our exposure:

By “sharing” our campaign on facebook, instead of copying the link into your status, this helps to connect a chain of people who are all sharing the same things, and bumping us higher on people's feeds.  So when you see our post with our Indiegogo campaign off of our El Motete Marketplace page, click share!

Tagging El Motete Marketplace also helps to maximize our exposure.  Whether it be via instagram or facebook, this allows people to click on our page and also brings us to the top of peoples feeds.

Remember to explain why you find our campaign valuable.  People value the opinions of their family, friends and colleagues, so by sharing why its important to you, could help others see the value in our campaign as well.

The more our friends and family can share with their network, the greater opportunities we have to build our own contacts, and to receive support from those truly interested in our mission.

story:
My name is David Homa, and I own Post Carbon Designs, a Permaculture Design and ecological landscaping business. I  work throughout the Lake Region, Western Foothills and Southern Maine, turning lawns into gardens and educating people on working with nature in their landscapes. Post Carbon Designs has been working with homeowners, businesses, schools, and farms since 2009.


After a busy 2015, my faithful pickup truck, a 1996 Chevy Silverado, is in rough shape. While the repairs have gotten us out the door every morning to spread Permaculture around Maine, business demands a dependable truck to better serve ecological landscaping clients.  


This Indiegogo campaign goal is to help fund a down payment for a new work truck. The costs associated with such purchase is beyond me with the current prices of vehicles. 

Option 1, The  funds raised would help me put more money down, and make the monthly payments manageable for a new truck. Cost $25,000 - 35,000

Option 2, Would be to find good used truck that can handle the demands of the business...  Cost- $8,500 - 15,000

Option 3, Continue to repair the truck, with work needed on exhaust system, fuel system, transmission, and front end. Cost - $1,000

 I am turning to my Permaculture Community from near and far to make this possible. I would really like to see help come in the form of many small donations. Please help to continue my work to spread sound Permaculture installations throughout Northern New England.


For those of you in the Maine and New Hampshire Area, I can offer several tangible perks. They include site walks, small hinged hoop houses, and other consultation services for their homes and community gardens. 

Thank you ahead of time for your contribution and support!

-David

story:
I'm Colin Scarantino  and  I have a plan to start my own business but I need help starting up and paying for all of my required certifications. Music has always been a huge part of my life and I would love to share what I have learned over the years. My plan is to start a local business installing audio and video equipment for low prices. I have never seen an audio/video job where the installer cut some type of corner just to save their own money. Often it's things that only people familiar in the field would notice. This is very dishonest and I plan to be the trusted business and be the local "non-corporate" business who can give people what is wanted. Anything helps and anyone who donates and earns a perk can give it to a friend if you don't need it! Thanks for all your support.

Sincerely,

Colin Scarantino

story:
“In every adversity there lies the seed of an equivalent or greater benefit.” –Napoleon Hill. Poetic justice perhaps?

Are you inspired by second chance at life stories or do you simply enjoy poetic messages? 

Awesome! You're in the right spot.  Keep reading. Look for the link to hear your free, poetry audio entitled "Poetic Justice -Black Life Matters-Perhaps."

Six quick bullet points explaining why you will gladly fund our campaign... I mean besides the fact that March 30th is my 51st birthday!!!   Woot- woot!  Shameless plug huh? 

This is short, simple and to the point. 

Two second chance stories are responsible for the birth of WinSation.com.  I 'm the Founder and I will tell one story here and gladly share the other story on demand with anyone who gives a sugar, honey, iced, tea.

  • “I made the decision that my last job layoff would indeed be my last job layoff." Poetic justice perhaps. 

After a career that spanned almost 20 years in employment staffing, I found myself with a loss of income immediately before undergoing a medical procedure, and simultaneously fighting for healthcare benefits, family medical leave, short term disability and unemployment compensation due to confusion about the benefits that I'd qualify for given the circumstances.  

  • Have you ever been fed up with that false sense of security that comes with merely having a job?  I sure have. 

Walmart (the Walton family) realized that the country didn't need just another supermarket, nor did the country need just another Kmart competitor.  They inventively and courageously stepped outside-of-the-box to offer a combo & convenience that now serves you and me very well.

  • "Build your own dreams or someone will hire you to build theirs." - Farrah Gray."  I am a poetic, motivational speaker trapped in a staffing recruiter's body.  My creative, humanitarian side wants to do more than just staffing. The visionary in me has created a covenience that will serve you and me very well.                                                                                      
We realize that the country certainly does not need just another employment staffing company or just another motivational speaker.  That’s why we have boldly blended nationwide, remote access; employment staffing and life-skills training designed to help ex-offenders with gainful employment. The unique style
of poetic, motivation mixes encouragement, responsibility & accountability to inspire a mindset shift. 
  • Why should you and I care about helping ex-offenders and other members of the under-served population gain employment and life skills?

Would you rather the almost 700,000 ex-offenders released each year from correctional facilities nationwide have no income upon their release? How  do you think that their lack of basic needs might affect your family and you? I  had a lapse in judgement once that could have landed my butt behind bars.  Don't judge me :-). If you've ever been a participant in road rage, or bending the truth on a tax return, etc., then you could have had a very similar story. My infraction included lying for profit. God’s grace and mercy is the only reason I didn't serve any time. My story is now used to inspire and encourage others in areas of transparency, accountability and profit by adversity. I care. So should you.  

"Help others achieve their dreams and you will achieve yours."-Les Brown.

Employers are invited to contact me directly to learn how hiring ex offenders from WinSation.com is a win-win for everyone.

  • Listen to our brand of poetic justice, “Poetic Justice-Black Life Matters – Perhaps” audio (a message to the non-peaceful, Ferguson, MO protestors) at http://www.winsation.com/opportunity-knocks---your-free-audio-guidance.html to lend credibility to my ability to create and deliver powerful, thought-provoking and valuable messages to even the toughest audiences. Circulate the message throughout social media 3 times and fund the campaign to show your love and support.  
If you can't give money right now, help by spreading the word of the campaign and the audio message at the website.  Some of the best things in life are free. 
  • IN OUR PERKS - We give our service and time to you . All of us can always make more money.  None of us can ever make more time.
You can't handle the truth?

Warning: The audio may be considered raw and quite controversial. If you have a truth allergy, you may not want to hear it.  I'm just saying.

A BIG THANK YOU in advance for allowing me to live out my purpose, which is to give, teach, write, speak, inspire and encourage.  

Your funds are used to:

Help me to realize my dream and focus on the writing and speaking, especially to members of the underserved population while my team focuses on employment placement, as well as add key team members and pay current small business overhead.  We are not professionals in social media or technology.  We need all of the help that we can get! 

·  Maintain the website & business utilities, expenses, etc. for the next 6 months =$9,600 (1,600 monthly for 6 months)

·  Pay a Contract Recruiter/Account Manager for the next 6 months at $25 an hour = $24,000.

"Winners are not people who never failed but people who never quit."- Les Brown.

The only risk that I can honestly see is:

If for some odd reason we miss our goal and the mission to help create safer communities while getting ex-offenders to work with accountability, mindset-shift guidance is delayed, we simply live to fight another day. Not at anytime does it occur to me that WinSation.com will not be a huge success.  "A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new." - Albert Einstein.

Additional campaigns, if needed, will launch with an objective to bring on additional key staff and resources:

·  Website Content Developer (the website needs professional help :-).

· Training Program Manager

·  Contract a Business Analyst and/or Business Coach.

·  Writing Editor.

·  Accountant.

·  Legal Representative

·  Executive Assistant

·  Contract a Marketing Representative (Soical Media Expert)

·  Applicant Tracking System and/or Job Board purchase.

BONUS: I have listed the 12 things that make a man(woman) rich according to Napoleon Hill.

1. A positive mental attitude(observe that it heads the list).

2. Sound physical health.

3. Harmony in human relations.

4. Freedom from fear.

5. The hope of future achievement.

6. The capacity for applied faith.

7. Willingness to share one's blessings with others.

8. To be engaged in a labor of love.

9. An open mind on all subjects toward all people.

10. Complete self-discipline.

11. Wisdom with which to understand people.

12. Financial security.

"Observe, if you will, with great benefit, the fact that money comes at the end of the list of the 12 things that make men rich." -Napoleon Hill.

Once we pull the trigger on the campaign, it’s on!

"Winners are not people who never failed but people who never quit."- Les Brown.
The only risk that I can honestly see is:
If for some odd reason we miss our goal and the mission to help create safer communities while getting ex-offenders to work with accountability, mindset-shift guidance is delayed, we simply live to fight another day. Not at anytime does it occur to me that WinSation.com will not be a huge success.  "A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new." - Albert Einstein.
Additional campaigns, if needed, will launch with an objective to bring on additional key staff and resources:
·  Website Content Developer (the website needs
professional help :-).
· Training Program Manager
·  Contract a Business Analyst and/or Business Coach.
·  Writing Editor. 
·  Accountant.
·  Legal Representative
·  Executive Assistant 

·  Contract a Marketing Representative (Soical Media Expert)
·  Applicant Tracking System and/or Job Board purchase.
BONUS: I have listed the 12 things that make a man(woman) rich according to Napoleon Hill.
1. A positive mental attitude(observe that it
heads the list).

2. Sound physical health.
3. Harmony in human relations.
4. Freedom from fear.
5. The hope of future achievement.
6. The capacity for applied faith.
7. Willingness to share one's blessings with others.
8. To be engaged in a labor of love.
9. An open mind on all subjects toward all people.
10. Complete
self-discipline.
11. Wisdom
with which to understand people.
12. Financial security.
"Observe,
if you will, with great benefit, the fact that money comes at the end of the
list of the 12 things that make men rich." -Napoleon Hill.
Once we pull the
trigger on the campaign, it’s on!

story:
For 3 years now we are reporting on Aleppo and general Syrian Armenian topics. Most of the postings are from the members. The admins are doing their best to support during their spare time.
It is important now to have a dedicated person (though with part time work) to take care of the editorial needs.
Support us to make this happen.  Please move on from moral to financial support.
Երեք տարիներէ ի վեր մենք ձեզ տեղեակ կը պահենք Հալէպահայ եւ առհասարակ Սուրիահայ նիւթերու մասին: Գրառումներուն կարեւոր մասը անդամներուն կողմէ տեղի կ'ունենան, իսկ ատմինները իրենց կարելին կ'ընեն օգնութիւն ցուցաբերելու  իրենց ազատ ժամերուն:
Կարեւոր է սակայն որ հիմա քայլ մը անդին երթանք ու ունենանք վճարովի ատմին մը (թէեւ մասնակի աշխատաժամով) որ պիտի կարենայ հետեւիլ խմբագրական կարիքներուն:
Մեզ նեցուկ կանգնեցէք որ այս իրականանայ: Կը խնդրենք որ բարոյական նեցուկի կողքին ցուցաբերէք նաեւ ձեր նիւթական աջակցութիւնը ի շահ բոլորին:

story:
Summary

My name is Shane Mason and I will be opening a Comic Book/Pop Culture store in Wollongong Mall in May this year. Currently there is no local Comic Store at all in this area and people are forced to travel to Sydney or buy online. This is  a family business that will eventually provide employment locally. I have a Diploma of Business Management, currently run a Comic Book/Merchandise market stall and Pop Up Kiosks ins Wollongong Mall.
I have done extensive research into the industry and the need for this shop in the Wollongong area. Just last year there were over 5,000 attendees to the Comic Gong convention held in the area, dressing up and getting involved in the various activities. There was a Comic Shop who came down from Sydney who provided their own Pop Up Store for this occasion and it was extremely busy all day. Proving that there is definitely a market for a store like this in Wollongong.  
We currently have enough money to start small, but we are trying to raise enough funds to get in more stock variety, bigger collectibles and cater to a wider audience. 
I want to create a culture around the shop and eventually build to become a fully fledged sit down Comic Cafe. A place where like minded people can come to hang out and discuss their interests with other like minded people. 
By funding this campaign you will be helping us start our dream and passion project bigger than initially planned. To help fulfill the demand in the Wollongong/Illawarra area by giving Comic Book fans and Pop culture a place to buy Comics and merchandise off the shelf without travelling to Sydney or buying online.

What We Need & What You Get

Stage 1 - $10,000 will help us order in more stock to fulfill a variety of interests in the Comic/Pop Culture genre. More variety means more things to look at, order or buy. It will help us to get in more Collectibles and a bigger range of both Graphic Novels and Comics to satisfy more customer interests and genres. 

Even if we dont reach our goal the money raised will be put towards as much stock as the money will buy. 

Our Perks mean that whatever dollar amount you pledge will be the same amount you will be credited to spent in store. There will be a Poster of recognition in store with your name on it as a big thank you and to let everyone know what a legend you are. Higher pledges get an additional discount on top of this. 

This is going to be a community store and we want more geeks, nerds and Comic Book/Pop Culture fans to have a comfortable place to come and be themselves.

Risks & Challenges

This is the first stage of the Project and once I prove that it is a viable business in the area then I want to move to Stage 2 and become the Illawarra's only Sit Down Comic Cafe with Free video games for customers, a comfortable place to enjoy a coffee/beverage in a Comic themed environment, Free animated comic themed TV shows and a couple of Pinball/Arcade machines.

There are always risks with any start up business and we will be doing everything in our power to try and give this the best start we can, hence why I am here asking for your help. We currently have a Facebook Page called Comic Cafe Wollongong, a Twitter account called @comiccafegong. 

We will be running a Social Media advertising campaign closer to opening and will be handing out brochures around high traffic areas leading up to the opening and regular monthly campaigns. We would like to get to the stage where we are advertising this on TV through things like The Big Bang Theory and other Comic related shows.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant contribute, we completely understand, but we still need your help.

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Like us on Facebook, share us on your Facebook, ask family and friends with interests in this area. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
When I was presented with the opportunity to go on this missions trip I had the exact same initial reaction that I did last year, "I would love to do that... maybe next year when I have more time...". Then I realized that I've had this attitude towards missions for years now. I've always wanted to go do works projects but never had the time. Now I'm making the time.

The Impact

Nicaragua is the poorest country in Central America and the second poorest country in the Western Hemi-sphere. Most of the people there lack basic necessities such as food, clean water, shelter, education, and medical care which attributes to a cycle of poverty. During our time there, we will be coming along side two organizations, Pontis, Inc and The Hope Project, to serve the people of Matagalpa.

The ways we will be serving are:

• Building a chicken coop for a local family. This project will change the lives of a family and eventually a community. Each coop will hold 200 baby chickens that will be raised and then sold for a profit. The average yearly income for a Nicaraguan family is $600. With a chicken coop business they will able to increase their income substantially and within a matter of months be able to pull themselves out of poverty.

• Feeding children who live in a community next to a landfill outside of Matagalpa. The Hope Project started this feeding program with feeding 6 children 3 days a week. It has now increased to feeding 128 children 5 days a week.

• Washing the children’s feet and giving each of them a new pair of shoes. We will also pray over each child individually.

* Street ministry in the city of Matagalpa.

• Working with families on small farm projects that will help change the economy in local villages.

What I need

We all have the ability to do exactly what Jesus has called us to do. To go and make disciples of all nations. At the same time, we will also care for their physical needs. I know you may not be able to go to Nicaragua yourself but I would like to ask that you pray and consider supporting my team and our endeavor. I'm excited about the opportunity and experience that is ahead. I hope you see the value in what we will accomplish.

As you can imagine, a trip like this requires financial support from a number of people. I need to raise $1600. If you can support me in a financial way, I would be very grateful. If you would like to be part of this mission through your financial support, please do! If you would like to make a tax-deductible dontation you can make it to The Abbey Church online at theabbeychurch.com. Simply click on the “Donate” button and state the amount in the “Other” section. Be sure to write “Brian Hartley- Nicaragua” in the space provided to the right. All contributions are tax deductible.

Most importantly, I need your prayer support. Prayer is the fuel that will allow us to be successful as we follow God's leading in ministry in Nicaragua. Please pray specifically for the areas listed above and thank you for considering being apart of this with me.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Who is Alex von Salad and what is Cold Press ? 

I started cooking at a very young age manning the pots and pans in my mother's kitchen preparing lunch after school.  On Week-ends I assisted my dad on the BBQ. Fridays I was a 12 year old trainee at the local italian wood fired pizzeria.  My passion was born. I wanted to cook.  My own Salad dressing line came out in the 90's and was made in Napa Valley.  I sold it for a few years in gourmet shops around the US, but learned quickly that this was a very complicated business.  I built, managed and cooked in restaurants from NYC to Park City, Jackson Hole, Aspen and the Hamptons for many years.  A few years ago I had the urge to move back to Europe to be closer to my parents, but didn't really have a reason or a project that would put me there.  My last chef endevavours taught me about sustainability and local ingredients and I got heavily involved.  A friend of mine turned me on to an outfit in NY called Juicepress and I learned about Cold Press Juicing and all its amazing benefits and all around goodness.  Juicepress went from 1 store to 21 in 3 years.  My passion always has been dressings, sauces, soups and anything else liquid in the kitchen, so juices were a great new area for me to master. Europe is my home and so I decided to move back to my roots and start something culinary that is new and virtually non-existing. Thus far only 2 Cold Press Juice bars exist in Berlin, Germany.  None in Austria.  Now with me being based in Austria we will be the 1st one and we plan on expanding quickly - with 3-5 stores still to open this year.  The Raw food and Cold Press Juice Movement has barely started here in the EU and the market is wide open.

Cold pressed juice isn’t just any juice you can make at home. Fruits, vegetables, and herbs are hydraulically pressed between two steel plates. Because the juice is never heated or oxidized during this special juicing process, the result is a delicious living juice. Cold Pressed juice is nutritionally-dense and alive with enzymes

By contributing to our campaign you help us open our first juice bar in Salzburg, Austria and secure the path to open may more.

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising enough capital to open our first Juice-Bar. It will help buy equipment needed to properly start the bar.  Juicers, Bottles, Caps, Labels and the interior of our bar. Our flagship juice-bar vehicle that will be wrapped with our logo and drive through the city to promote our juice bar. All this will be possible with your contribution. 

What you get is anything from an all expenses trip to Salzburg for the Grand Opening to Juice-cleanses for 1 and 2 weeks and other Juice-Bar perks depending on the level of your contribution.

If we don't reach our goal the funds will be used for the same things except we will step it down a bit and open with a smaller budget.

The Impact

Healthy living is the future. As a chef I have been in many places cooking all kinds of food and met many amazing people.  Over the last few years I have been cooking more and more sustainable and use mostly local ingredients.  For the juice bar we plan  on doing the same. Use local vendors, offer seasonable ingredients and be fully sustainable and 100% organic.  By offering people a healthier way of living I feel I am doing the right thing at the right time. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for your time & we look forward to serving you the best juice known to man !

story:
Athena's Wink needs help! 

Our van died on the way to C2E2 this year, one of our first cons of the season, and we now need to replace it ASAP before Acen.  We really can't travel the country bringing cool anime hats and Flasks to all these different conventions with out reliable transportation and our funds aren't good enough at the moment to just buy something.  Had it held out for 2 more months con season would be in full swing and we'd be out of the red for the year, as it is we're stretched thin just trying to keep afloat after a number of unexpected expenses. 


What We Need & What You Get

We need somewhere in the neighborhood of 8k to purchases a newer van. We're looking to upgrade to a 2009-2011 Honda Odyssey or something comparable. Going larger isn't an option as we have to street park it in NYC and that's hard enough as is with a Mini Van.  

Now we're not looking for something for nothing, we see this as more of a sales drive than asking for handouts, products will not ship out immediately, but you will get your item in a timely manor and we will cover the shipping to the USA and even include a personalized thank-you note with each order. 

We will also be offering products online through this campaign that we normally never sell online so it's an unique opportunity to get some of these items.

Check out the Gallery for images of the items we have to offer!


Risks & Challenges

Any type of Vehicle buying is always a risk but I know what to look for, and to get it inspected. As far as the risk to you, there is none as we will make sure everyone gets their rewards no matter what. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, please spread the word!  Every little bit helps and I'm sure you know someone who would love some of our products!

story:
We are a group of six women from Kenora, Ontario - a small town just outside of Winnipeg, Manitoba. We are going be traveling to Bolivia for two weeks this summer to help in a women's shelter and work with young children. In Bolivia women are not viewed as equals, they have a higher illiteracy rate than men as they have very limited access to education. Women have a lower income generating rate than men as they are predominantly viewed as purely mothers and homemakers, yet they have one of the highest maternal mortality rates in the world. We feel strongly that even a small effort on our part can bring about big change. Due to the fact that we are a small group and we have a large distance to travel, every single donation will be much appreciated and very much needed. Every contribution will help us aid these women and children who are very much in need. 
     We have been able to fundraise about a third of our goal so far but are still $6000 away from being able to travel to this country. The majority of donations will be going towards airfare. However there are also several other expenses that need to be covered such as supplies, hotels, project donation, meals, and departure taxes. If we are unable to reach our total goal all raised funds will be divided amongst the six members and put towards airfare, the rest of the fees will be taken at personal cost - something that we are willing to do because we believe so strongly in the cause, however this would put many of us in a very uncomfortable position financially as many of us are young students or fresh out of grad school. 
     For many of us this is our first mission trip. We are very excited to do our part and make a difference. We just need your help to do so. We are especially excited to do this as we are a very close nit group, coming from a small town half of us are related!
     Due to the fact that women have low social status in Bolivia, being a group of just women, it is a bit risky for us to go. We face to stand discrimination and opposition from local townspeople. The communities we will be traveling to also have strong Mennonite backgrounds, a religion known to be opposed to outsiders and their aid. We have done the research and spoken to others who have traveled to Bolivia and worked with the locals before. We plan to go in and follow local customs and be as respectable as possible. We do not want to force our beliefs or ways of life on others, we simply want to help in any way we can. 
     Even if you yourself cannot donate, please help us by simply spreading the word! Being a small community we need to reach out to others if we hope to reach our goal. We are aware that it is a hefty one, but as we reach out  to help others we have faith that others will reach out to do the same for us. Share this page on any and all social networks you have access to, remember that Indiegogo itself has sharing tools. Thank you so much for your time and consideration.

story:
WHO WE ARE:

We are Gorilla Cheese, Canada's First Grilled Cheese Food Truck!

Gorilla Cheese operates proudly out of Hamilton, Ontario, serving our award-winning grilled cheese sandwiches on the streets and at events from Niagara to Toronto. We're one of the country's most popular food trucks, having been featured in numerous national publications and on television, including memorable segments on the Food Network's Eat Street and CBC's Dragons' Den. In 2014, we won Now Magazine's Best Food Truck Award, and were voted both Best Sandwich and Best Food Truck of 2014 in the Hamilton Spectator. We're proud as heck to use independently-owned local suppliers, and to serve our delicious, unique grilled cheese sandwiches, hot and fresh-to-order with a smile out of our big, black, eye-catching truck.

WHAT WE WANT TO DO:

Now, in our 5th year of operation, the time is right for Gorilla Cheese's next stage of growth: a brick-and-mortar retail location that can sell to the public, act as a commercial kitchen to prepare food for the truck, and can be the official headquarters for our operations. While it's fun to hunt down the Gorilla Cheese Food Truck on social media, or to come across it when we're operating curbside or at a festival, many people wish they could simply go to a consistent location at any time of the day to get one of our delicious cheesers. After all, what's a Hamiltonian (or an out-of-town visitor) to do when he/she wants a griled cheese, and the truck is at a festival in Whitby? A convenient take-out location is the ideal solution to make Gorilla Cheese bigger, better, and far more efficient!

In November of last year, we acquired the perfect location at 131 Ottawa St. North, site of the former Poco Loco Mexican Take-out. Ottawa Street is a progressive, pedestrian-friendly community that is home to dozens of unique, independently-owned businesses, and is surrounded by a huge residential populace. It is home to the Provincial Award-winning Sew Hungry Festival, which sees more than 30 food trucks line the street and attracts more than 35,000 people every year. With numerous new businesses opening this year along the street, the potential is incredible. Our new location is perfect for Gorilla Cheese Headquarters, complete with a nice, big kitchen, seating for 15 people and the means to house Gord, our beloved food truck. Here we can greatly expand our menu, both for the store and for the truck. Now we can finally get truly creative with everybody's favourite sandwich and add lots of other comfort-food staples. The possibilities are endless! We want to create a place like no other, complete with a comfortable, fun atmosphere, and the best food we can possibly offer. In short, we want Gorilla Cheese to be your favourite place to get high-quality fast food.

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP:

We were on track in terms of budget and time to open our new store, but ran into an issue in January that brought all progress to a halt. The location was erroneously designated within the City Building Department for use as a “Hair Salon,” despite running for years as a takeout restaurant. We originally leased the building under the impression that it was a turn-key operation, in which we could simply upgrade some of the equipment, make it pretty with a new decor, put up our sign, and voila!, we'd be open for business. This turned out to not be the case. Where we thought we were taking over an existing restaurant, we now had to meet the codes required to open a brand new one from scratch. New architectural drawings, new ventilation systems, grease traps, etc... we didn't anticipate the cost or the time associated with these unexpected requirements. Construction of the new Gorilla Cheese Headquarters was halted during the time it took to acquire the Building Permit that was needed to facilitate the necessary upgrades. During the standstill, our start-up funds dwindled. An unopened restaurant still has monthly bills and expenses, like rent, insurances and utilities. While we tried to generate the extra revenue ourselves with the food truck, this harsh winter made it an exercise in futility. We were SO close, but these extras and the time it took to get back on track really took us by surprise. Our new storefront now sits with a fresh paint job, new floors, new tables, a kitchen stocked with state-of-the-art equipment and so much more, but we're unable to open until all these upgrades are completed.

HOW CAN WE HELP YOU?

Your funding will help us bring our new storefront up to city code and complete construction to open in April. Beyond the restaurant, we will also be introducing a fresh new logo, a new website, and providing some much-needed repairs to Gord so we can enter the 2015 season with a bang. Not only will you help make a bigger, better Gorilla Cheese, you will also be investing in a better Hamilton! This year will see Gorilla Cheese provide upwards of twenty new jobs and add greatly to the revitalization of Ottawa Street. Also, with our efficient new kitchen and ability to purchase in bulk, we can actually lower the prices of our sandwiches!

But the best part is the PERKS! From sandwiches to t-shirts, to having your own private Gorilla Cheese party, to your name being etched into our 'Wall of Excellence', your donation will not only get us to the finish line, but also acts as an investment for YOU to become part of the Gorilla Cheese Elite! You're basically pre-purchasing AWESOMENESS.

We are passionate about being the best company we can be, one that is a source of pride for Hamilton. We want to give you the best comfort food of the highest quality at a fair price, and serve it proudly with outstanding customer service. We just need your help to make this dream become a reality!

Please click here for some more details about our crowdfunding campaign!

story:
Joy Through Art

Award-winning actor and singer Dominic Chianese -- who is perhaps best known as Uncle Junior on "The Sopranos,"-- is on a mission to create joy for residents of nursing homes. That's why he created Joy Through Art, a nonprofit, 501(c)(3) foundation.

"It's my passion," Dominic says, "to bring music and theater arts to residents who cannot get out very often. I have played in nursing homes for the past 30 years and have seen first-hand what music and theater arts can do for someone who is lonely needs someone to connect to."

If you want to know more please connect with our website.

story:
Campaign Summary

We are opening a Zoom Room indoor dog gym/dog park franchise (in the San Francisco Bay Area’s East Bay) to give active people a fun place to attend obedience and agility training classes with their dogs. Zoom Room provides positive reinforcement dog training where people and their dogs learn together, socialize, and attend workshops, parties, and fundraisers. Zoom Room also sells eco-friendly, Made-in-the-USA retail products. 

Check out the official Zoom Room website

In addition, we will offer therapy pet training classes, so dogs can visit sick children, seniors, and even returning veterans to help brighten their day. We also plan to offer a reading program where kids learning to read can read to dogs!

Animals are playing a larger role in our lives, and busy people want to provide them with an exceptional life. Active families are flocking to an ever-growing number of animal-related facilities across the nation.

Enter Shelley R. Brooks and Jody Linick!  They make a great team to open a dog-related business in pursuit of their passion for helping dog owners improve their pet's lives. The Shelley-Jody team brings over 20 combined years of small-business-owner experience, including marketing and financial/bookkeeping skills. This combination allows each owner to play to her strengths while working as a team to maintain and grow the business.


What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for help in funding our dream. We are kicking in our own money, getting a Small Business Administration (SBA) Loan, and asking for your help in raising $29,000 to make this dream a reality.

Your $29,000 in contributions will go toward:

  • Agility Equipment
  • Indoor and Outdoor Signs
  • Computer hardware/software
  • Point of Sale system
  • Other furniture and equipment

Perks:

We are offering fun, functional perks as token "Thank You's" that will help you and your friends show your dogs how much you love them! These include (depending upon the level of your support):

  • A reflector ID dog tag
  • A Zoom Room dog food can lid 
  • A Zoom Room dog food scoop
  • A Zoom Room portable water bowl
  • A Zoom Room logo Tote Bag with the above goodies
Don't have a dog? You can still make a contribution, and give your Perk(s) to a friend, or donate them to your local animal shelter! Don't want any Perks? Just enter an amount in the "Your Contribution" box and click the "Contribute Now" button.

Risks & Challenges

Starting a new venture is always a challenge. That’s why we decided to go with the franchise model. As Zoom Room franchisees, we will receive extensive instruction in how to become top notch dog trainers; access to the Zoom Room proprietary curriculum; an Operations Manual with hundreds of details on how to run and manage our store; advertising and marketing support; and community support from other Zoom Room owners nationwide.

We have a long road ahead of us, but we’re eager to embrace the challenges as we leverage our years of business experience as aesthetician (Shelley) and bookkeeper (Jody) and bring those skills to our retail store/gym. Our 20 combined years as successful small business owners provides the solid foundation we will need to make our Zoom Room a success!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to give but want to support us, please share the link to our campaign with your dog-loving friends, neighbors, and family!

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Like our page on Facebook and share our story. Our Facebook Page

Tweet or Instagram the link to our Indiegogo video. Our Twitter   Our Instagram

Our goal is to fill the world with happy, tired dogs enjoying an exceptional quality of life as loving companions. Remember, a happy dog is a tired dog!

story:
What Is Box?:
Box is a feminist sex toy shop that offers educational workshops and classes, to start a discussion around healthy sexuality. We focus specifically on folks who are often invisible or fetishized in conversations around sex to make sure that everyone's needs around intimacy and sexual health can be met. 
Though Box is the only store of its kind in the area, we have great relationships with other sex-positive local businesses and community organizations and look forward to collaborating on future projects with them.

Okay, so what kind of inventory are we really going to have? We are committed to offering only body-safe toys, lubricants, and toy cleaning options. We will have high-quality silicone, wood, metal, glass, ceramic, and stone toys of all shapes and sizes. We will also carry harnesses, some kink tools and packers (circumcised and uncircumcised.) We are also excited to offer awesome feminist stickers, patches, and art prints made by local and queer-friendly artists.

Contributions will go towards rent and utilities for our brick and mortar store and a more comprehensive and better variety of our initial inventory. We have enough funding to open with only the bare bones, but each contribution will help us build a space that is more welcoming and better stocked, as well as give us some cushioning in case of kinks that we will need to work out. Pun intended.

Who We Are:
Hi! We are Sarah Michelson and Willow Rosen. Sarah is a midwife who is passionate about gender and queer theory, comprehensive sexuality education, and feminism. Willow is a student midwife, birth and postpartum doula and childbirth educator with a passion for and history in domestic violence and rape crisis work. We are both driven to give sexuality a healthy, normalized place in our community.

We Need:
$14,000 Rent & Estimated Utilities for the next 12 months
$15,000 Initial Inventory

We Have:
Initial Fees for Business Licenses, Tax and Occupancy Permits
First Year Estimate for Legal and Accounting Fees
Funds to Furnish the Space Comfortably
Bare Bones Inventory (This will get us a few basics but our goal is to be as inclusive as possible-that will take a bit more funding.)

*For folks who choose the perks that include utilizing Box as an event space, we would like to clarify what that may look like. We will not provide refreshments, entertainment, supplies, or additional staffing for the event. The space will only be open to attendants from your private event. We will have at least one staff member available for sales and questions. Please message us with any and all questions. 

More Information About Box:
Box was created from a need in St. Louis; to have a safer space to discuss and explore a healthier sexuality. Box helps create normalcy of sexuality in an environment of discovery and education. Box hosts support groups and creates educational workshops to allow greater accessibility to comprehensive sexual health. Box also sells high-quality, non-toxic sex toys with a focus on those who are often invisible to the rest of society, people of color, differently-abled persons, and folks on the LGBTQQI spectrum. Find Us On Facebook Here! Check out our website here!

Please make sure to share this page with your friends! You can use Indiegogo's share tools to add this campaign to your social media pages!

story:
Fallen Heroes Family Camp is hosted by JML Farms near Springfield, Tennessee.  Nestled in a peaceful rural setting just a few scenic miles from Nashville, JML Farms prides itself on offering superb equine boarding and training facilities.

It’s here, on this farm, that military families find each other and engage in equine activities of a therapeutic nature.  They’ll learn to ride, rope, and work around the farm and horses with confidence, while making new friends and having fun.

Through the use of horses and outdoor activities, Fallen Heroes Family Camp strives to help military families shed their feelings of loss and put them on a road to healing.

Imagine being the child of a parent serving our country far from home. It’s a daily sacrifice going without a parent’s presence in your life, and you live with the fear that your loved one may never come home.  Imagine the overwhelming sense of loss and emptiness you have when that fear becomes reality.
story_txt:
Fallen
 Heroes Family Camp is hosted by JML Farms near Springfield, Tennessee. 
 Nestled in a peaceful rural setting just a few scenic miles from 
Nashville, JML Farms prides itself on offering superb equine boarding 
and training facilities.
					
							
		
	
It’s 
here, on this farm, that military families find each other and engage in
 equine activities of a therapeutic nature.  They’ll learn to ride, 
rope, and work around the farm and horses with confidence, while making 
new friends and having fun.

Through the use of horses and outdoor activities, Fallen Heroes Family 
Camp strives to help military families shed their feelings of loss and 
put them on a road to healing.Imagine
 being the child of a parent serving our country far from home. It’s a 
daily sacrifice going without a parent’s presence in your life, and you 
live with the fear that your loved one may never come home.  Imagine the
 overwhelming sense of loss and emptiness you have when that fear 
becomes reality.

story:
Hi, I'm Marita Mirzatuny and I live in Austin, Texas. For the last decade, I've been building a solution to the environmental and social problems caused by our consumer culture. While it's fun to shop, the consequences of consumerism result in habitat destruction, pollution, and inhumane working conditions. That said, our modern reliance on variety and convenience provided by big box stores like Target or Walmart is not going to go away. 

Environmart is a retail store that bridges the modern necessity of one-stop shopping with sustainability and ethics. 

Environmart is an alternative to the typical big box stores. Using economies of scale, technology, and a creative supply chain, Environmart offers customers everyday lifestyle goods - such as clothing, housewares, furniture, and office supply - that adhere to environmental and ethical standards. By combining organic products with a rotating blend of recycled, handmade, and fair trade goods, Environmart provides convenience, style, and variety. Everything from vintage dishware to organic baby clothes, recycled notebooks, and fairtrade jewelry.

Our target customers are socially conscious consumers who already contribute to the multibillion-dollar sustainable marketplace, and yet have no one-stop eco-shop to patronize. Current options consist of expensive boutiques or hunting down products online. Environmart offers an alternative to the status quo, wherein customers can feel good about their purchases without having to sacrifice. 

And even for those who don't have these issues at the forefront of their minds, the hip and fashionable items offered at Environmart are appealing and desirable on their own.

I am seeking $10,000 to support Environmart in its perfect new location. Any and all money raised will be used directly for rent and other overhead expenses such as inventory.

BACKGROUND

My BA in Environmental Studies and an entrepreneurial-focused MBA, combined with my work experience in retail and project management, have allowed me to develop the unique supply chain required to provide everyday products on demand while simultaneously vetting the sustainability requirements. 

Currently, I bootstrap this startup while I manage my 9-5 job as a project manager in environmental advocacy at a large non-profit, focusing on getting consumers to adopt clean energy technologies like wind, solar, and smart devices. I am fueled by my passion knowing that something must - and can - be done to solve complicated environmental problems. And I believe consumers can be that solution.

With a donation, you are not just investing in a stylish retail store, but rather a logisitics and distribution model that is truly innovative and essential to scale these kind of products.

THE TRAILER STORE 

After years of online selling, in 2010 I launched Environmart as a physical pop-up shop at HOPE Farmers Market in East Austin and at the Austin City Limits music festival. 

In 2012, I won an award from legendary local businessman and founder of GSD&M ad agency Roy Spence. That award allowed me to expand into a more permanent shop in a 140 square foot trailer. Those doors opened in 2013. 


THE PICNIC 

Since then, I've been here and there around town. But last December I moved to the best location in Austin at The Picnic food truck park on Barton Springs Road!!! This is the perfect place to prove the market for better products and create the momentum to scale to a warehouse. 

The Picnic has a robust weekend following of swimmers headed to Barton Springs pool and people eating at the amazing food trucks (the best ones in the city hands down). There is also ACL Fest, the Kite Festival, and Trail of Lights. This means tens of thousands of shoppers walking right by the shop, who will love Environmart for its charm, variety of stylish products, and mission. 


For now, the shop is open on weekends with plans to expand hours. Luckily, the Picnic is a permanent fixture and  won't give way to development as many food truck lots have.

Being near the best food trucks in town is not only great for business but also inspiring as the majority, like Hey Cupcake and Kebabalicious, have all followed the trailer to brick-and-mortar path. I plan to do the same for retail. 

WHERE Y'ALL COME IN!

Our economy has to evolve if we are to thrive and survive. environmart provides a model for doing that but must be a part of the community it serves. Help me get to the goal of a large warehouse store, by funding our first-step trailer shop on Barton Spring road. They say it's about location, location, location. And this is true for retail. Let's get together and invest in this innovative and creative shopping experience. 

Having your support would be a grassroots, community endorsement. Allowing Environmart to prove the market and product test, growing into a warehouse store where economies of scale and efficiencies can be realized and costs cut. 

FEATURED 

Environmart has been featured in multiple publications including the Austin American Statesman and Austin Woman magazine and our social media following is expanding on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Now is the time to leverage this momentum! 

                         


VALUE & CONTRIBUTION TO THE WORLD

Environmart's impact on the world goes way beyond an ROI and a single bottom line. We believe in the triple bottom line: people, planet, profit. Shoppers, and investors like YOU, will be a central part in saving the environment, helping people out of poverty globally, and encouraging cottage business and manufacturing here in the USA. With every purchase, from clothing made in Alabama to office supplies made with the plastic clogging our oceans, not only is there a sale but a direct positive impact on the earth and its inhabitants. As we grow, analytics will track just what kind of difference we've made from water pollution avoided to acres of rainforest saved.


Please share with everyone you know far and wide. The shopping experience at environmart is for everyone. All of us can feel good knowing we are making a difference simply by shopping. 

Join me and you can say that you were a part of Environmart from the beginning as an early-stage investor!

PERKS

- Organic lip balm, store coupons, & eco items. 

- Invite to the warehouse launch party when the day comes and even lifetime discounts!


OTHER WAYS TO HELP

It's ok if you can't contribute financially there are others ways to support:

Email your friends, family and work colleagues with the link to this page! 

Like our Facebook page HERE 

Join us on Twitter HERE

Follow us on Instagram HERE

story:
What's the plan?

We want to make the Versapong Party Bus dream a reality!
Help us transform our shuttle bus into a ready-to-go, out of control, completely amazing party bus.

If you've seen any of my past projects (I build just about anything and everything from beer pong tables with TV's and  kegerators to elaborate tailgating party trailers) then you know this bus is gonna be tricked out. Since starting my company, Versapong, a few months back, we've been living and breathing the production and promotion of the product. 

Part of our plan for the fall is a Tailgating Road Trip touring over 15 different college campuses, in addition to bringing the party to every Patriots home game (go Pats!). In order to create the ULTIMATE tailgating experience we will be driving the new Versapong Party Bus and towing the Versapong Tailgating Trailer (sorry to one up you Gronk...). In order to do this, we need to take the current bus we have (shuttle seats and all) and turn it into something worthy of  our fans. 

Where you come in...

The plan is to rip out the entire interior out of the bus and add a bathroom, wrap around seating, mini bar, neon lighting, an explosive sound system, TV's, complete exterior vehicle graphics and just about everything amazing. In order to make this possible I've partnered with the one and only Ronny from Advanced Auto Body, who will be donating shop space, tools and machinery to make this project possible. We're seeking the support we need to make these awesome renovations happen!

To show our thanks for your support, we want to give a little something back (and by a 'little something' we mean a whole lot of awesome prizes).

Have any questions? Give us a call: (401) 243- 3443

Other Ways You Can Help

If you own a company that sells anything you think belongs on our Party Bus we will happily take donations or discounts on anything you have to offer.

story:
We are K21 Kid Strong Foundation, Inc.

The child who squirms about in the grocery store may be viewed as unruly. We however, see so much more. You worry that your son has trouble making friends or fitting in. We look deep inside to understand his perspective. Your grandson doesn’t make eye contact or hits himself repeatedly. We however, see so much more potential. We aim to get beyond his behaviors through individual and group coaching. At K21 Kid Strong Foundation, Inc. (K21 KSF), children are welcomed and allowed to be part of our group in ways that they are most comfortable. A 501(c)(3) not for profit organization, founded in February 2012, our sole purpose and mission is to provide special needs children with the opportunity to develop their physical, behavioral and social capabilities through the use of a year round adaptive International Kyokushinkai Union (IKU) karate program.

We are Changing Lives

 In an open environment and with parental supervision, our expert instruction team patiently and safely works through naturally occurring behaviors. We believe that every child deserves to have a place where they can feel accepted for who they are. K21 Kid Strong Foundation, Inc. creates an environment where children can develop their capabilities and address their weaknesses without judgment from others. We have helped to unwrap the unseen gifts of children with special needs.  We believe that all children possess the potential to be contributive and valued members of society. We are the pioneers of a new approach to special needs children.

Since inception, K21 KSF has provided over 300 classes of adaptive IKU karate instruction to over 20 children of all capabilities ranging from ages 4-18. We have watched the faces of parents beam with delight as their child masters a long awaited skill.  With 100% volunteer participation from our team, K21 KSF's pilot program model is proudly located in Canton, CT. As of now, 1 in 68 eight year olds in the United States are affected with autism spectrum and related disorders. We seek to replicate the success that has been realized with our CT participants through the International Kyokushinkai Union's 20 national and 10 international organizational karate affiliates. This organization, the first of its kind, will help to achieve a global benefit for those with special needs and their families.

 We Need Your Support

Currently, our families are charged a fee for service that allows K21 KSF to maintain a training facility. Additional expenses are met by our board members and select pro-bono consultants. With your kind support, together we can to reach our overall campaign goal of 5,000 dollars. Your donations would help to provide the following: 

1.  One month of participant service to 20 special need children and their families at a reduced fee.  ($2,000)

2.  Participant uniforms  for 20 new participants.($1,000)

3.  Facility training equipment. ($500)

4.  Still and video photographic equipment ($500)

5. Seminar funding support for our instructor development program. ($1,000 per weekend seminar)


Together We can Make a Difference!

The number of those affected by autism spectrum and related special needs disorders is increasingly prevalent. In order to make change and provide generations to come with the tools to be capable, self assured and independent citizens, we must act now. K21 Kid Strong Foundation, Inc. invites you to be part of positive change. Please consider sharing our campaign with others. As you are able, please give generously to our funding appeal. One by one we can kick our collective kindness forward and provide a program where all children can develop their capabilities and thrive. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

2 long time friends,7 weeks, riding bikes against the wind from east to west~3,100 miles of nothing but pavement. We cannot predict what will happen, but that’s the beauty of it. Life’s challenges only multiply as we progress, so why not confide in a place of rhythmic relaxation, where the mind can stop turning and all that is in front of you is miles and miles of road, landscapes, and undiscovered territory. 

This summer marks a time in our lives where we can slow time down and take comfort in that the only things we have are what we carry on our backs and on our bikes. With a 1,250 budget, we will sleep in tents, eat cheaply and take in whatever this country (and a little bit of Canada) has to offer.


What We Need & What You Get

We’re raising money. Not for us, but for Parkinson's Disease. Phil's uncle has been his hero and his constant throughout his life, his motto, “Ya Gotta Have Fun!” has powered not only his life from an early age, but has been a backbone of decisions we have made along the way.  Even though they are simple words to live by if this statement is the pivotal part in life all else will fall into place. Phil’s uncle has the most positive outlook on life while living with this disease and we would like to spread that outlook.  Money is a gracious, but hard thing to ask for; you might be college grads like us or be really interested in another cause that’s great! So, our second option is a shared experience. If you want to follow us on our blog, meet up with us along the way, or create a partnership we would be down with that.  We want to have an interactive experience and can’t wait to hear from you! So, starting today we are off on our adventure and cannot wait to see what adventures await! We’d also love it if you emailed us about sponsorship ideas

story:
About Boston Maccabi Rugby

The Boston Maccabi Rugby Football Club is a 501 c (3) non profit comprised of athletes who come together to play competitive and successful rugby, while also maintaining an abiding commitment to the timeless Jewish values of tikkun olam and tzedakah – repairing the world and giving back. Ultimately, the goal of the Boston Maccabi Rugby Club is to be known as much for its service to the community as for the quality of its rugby play.  With your help, we can grow our impact both on and off the field.

The Impact

Boston Maccabi Rugby has grown to a community of over 60 former and current players, as well as countless friends and loved ones who share our mission of service through sport. 

In the past few years, we have donated thousands of dollars to the community through events such as the annual Boston City Councilor Tito Jackson's Thanksgiving Turkey Giveaway and the Smart from the Start toy drive. We have leveraged the camaraderie of the game of rugby to bring volunteers out in droves to serve and deliver meals at Rosie's Place and Jewish Families and Children Services. And we've sorted and prepared hundreds of school supplies and clothing for children in need through Cradles to Crayons. 

This is just the beginning of the impact that we know we can have. 

What We Need & What You Get

The Slater Foundation has generously and graciously agreed to match gifts to our organization up to $5,000.

These funds will allow us to:

  • Expand our community service impact through volunteer service events for our players and fans throughout the Greater Boston Area.
  • Playing rugby can be an expensive endeavor. These funds will help ensure that money is never a prohibiting factor for players who wish to join our team and take the field with us. 
  • Funds will also be used to assist with field fees, insurance, and other Boston Maccabi Rugby expenses. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are always looking for new recruits -- if you or those you know would like to join our effort, please tell them to reach out to us online at BostonMaccabiRugby.org. And please, help us spread the word.

more details about our business model -

visit - https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Y125WVd...

We are raising funds for more app/web development to support more languages including English and Chinese Mandarin. 


Thank you for your contribution

story:
We are proud and very happy to say that our Silly Goat's Soap Company has out grown our home and we need to build a new soap manufacturing shop.

Since we started we have been making everything out of our kitchen. That is soaps, lotions, all the baby products, bath bombs, lip balms etc.  We have racks on wheels that we use to move throughout the house when we are manufacturing all of the before mentioned goat goodies.

We cut, wrap and label everything at the dining room table.  We have boxes of bottles, oils, butters etc., stacked against the window of the dining room.  We have drying racks in the living room, back office (soap room now) and upstairs in the guest room.  We have put up as much shelving as the laundry room will hold for supplies. And the back room is loaded with racks, containers of finished product next to the shipping table, with the retail section along the other wall.

WE ARE FULL!

One of the biggest concerns for us is the safety of our animals.  We have 3 dogs and 2 cats in the house.  Rileah, Sandy's Australian Shepherd. Sasha, Sandy's lap dog. Maximus Jack (aka Handsome Jack) my 130 lbs., German Shepherd!  And the 2 cats Fishy and his sister Gypsy.

Now we keep a clean house.  I have to sweep and mop every day before I start manufacturing.  Our biggest obstacle is the lye.  You have to use lye when you make soap.  In its raw form, and before it becomes soap, it's dangerous to animals.  I feel bad having to lock up my cats and dog before I make soap in the kitchen.  All of our animals are a part of our family.

After the saponification process of soap making it is chemical changed and non-existent.  You could eat the finished bar of soap afterwards and we have had several of our customer’s children and dogs gnaw on a bar or two. Yes, they did! 

SO YOU SEE OUR DILEMMA.

We have a new barn.  We build it when we bought the farm 7 years ago and we want to add on a soap room on the front half of the that barn it will be a 22'x24 building with a little retail store, the rest of the building will have a kitchen, with manufacturing area, a shipping area, storage racks and drying racks.

We asking help from family, friends, customers, and those that just love the idea to donate to the "Build A Shop Fund", so we can be one step closer to making this dream come true!

Most of the money we make right now from Silly Goats Soap, goes right back into buying more supplies, equipment, material and the like.  We do take a little out for Sarah’s dance lessons and it does help pay some of the bills but we are a new fledgling company just getting our feet under us and there is no money to spare. 

Our goal, is to have a thriving, little, family business where Sandy and I can both work from the farm. Have the kids work with us, if they want .  Be a good employer by creating some good, well paying, jobs for our local community.  Be self-sufficient raising our animals, raise the feed for our animals, raising our food through our gardens and storing away all of our fruit and veggies and raising all of own animals.

We are asking you to be a part of Silly Goat’s Farm and Silly Goat's Soap Company!

Donate whatever you feel comfortable donating.

Our goal is $10,000!

This amount will get us the:

  • Excavating Equipment Rental
  • Concrete
  • Building Material
  • Kitchen Appliances
  • Some Shelving
  • Tables

We will Be Doing All The Building With The Help Of Friends!

Thank You For Supporting This Project & Being A Part Of Our Community Of Silly Friends!

Chris, Sandy, Sarah, & Silly Goats

story:
The Short & Sweet

  • Agave Sun International, a division of Raven Rising LLC. A Colorado company. Formed on 12/25/2015. That is right, formed on Christmas Day 2015.
  • Developed by Steven James Peterson and the Agave Sun International team. Steven James Peterson is 41, a former Private Detective, Bail Bondsman, Bounty Hunter, and Educator with the Boy Scouts. Born in North Dakota, raised in Fargo (Yeah, just like the movie and show, same place), and Ski Geek at Crested Butte Colorado. 

  • When I say “Saving the world from bad tequila one bottle at a time” I mean it. Our goal is to impact change. Making the world a better place through tequila is a thing. Agave Sun International has a "Giving Pledge" to help communities in the USA and Mexico. We are a Green and Sustainable company.
  • We are poised to enter all 50 states! But only with your help.
  • You are changing lives here, and for the better. Helping this campaign means you are helping people in two different countries all along the supply chain. Our goal is to become something that years later you know you personally had a hand in making it great.
  • As a contributor you are helping us build a long term company. And that means everything to us. Our gratitude would be through the roof!
  • And here is a secret, we are going to pick a few of the $20.00 contributors and surprise them with a huge show of thanks! You may want to make sure your passport is current...

What We Need

  • Transparent facts. Our funding will be immediately applied to state level licenses, fees, and associated costs. Our estimate to secure licenses for the entire USA will run at $250,000.00 alone. We can begin operations before that amount, but this would open the door to the entire country. Securing those licenses is vital to our long term viability.
  • Transparent facts. We need office space. And not just any office will do. This will be our headquarters for the entire nation. And you will open the doors with your contributions.  
  • Transparent facts. Everything built here has been a result of lean startup principles and a lot of dedicated team players. The collaboration of that team is what makes Agave Sun International special. And as the founder, I have the utmost respect and debt of gratitude of the team players who helped get us here today.

If we miss the mark?

  • Any funds received will be applied to our securing of state level licenses. No two states are alike, so this requires a lot of attention. Why? Because these state level licenses are the final keys we need to officially open the doors. We need a minimum of $7,500.00 to start the process
  • Knowing we have to reach $250,000.00 alone to secure all 50 state licenses we are simply asking you to pull the string back and watch us fly.

What You Get

We have a lot of options for you!

$1 Good Karma. We recognize you work hard for your money. So you can help by giving a single dollar and gain some good karma. In exchange we will hold you in high esteem. This is less than a Latte at Starbucks!

$5 Goodwill. You are showing us some great Goodwill! In exchange we will send you a Thank You Letter, and share our Thanks for you on our social media. Your support here is the key that unlocks the doors and turns on the lights! You make our world go round. Share your phone number and we will call and Thank You also. Can you even buy a plate of good Wings for this? 

$10 Super Supporter.  Wow, we love you! To show our love we will feature your photo on our office wall! We want our clients to know exactly who helped us get to where we are. You are the foundation we are built on. You will be featured as a Super Supporter. All we need is your photo for us to print. You pick the photo, we will post it. Less than what taking a friend out for lunch.

$20 Launch Party Invite. But be 21 at the time of the event to enter. Avoid the cover charge. Be on the Guest List! Meet the VIP Team! And when we hit our goals, a couple of you will be picked for a special surprise. If I were you, I'd check to make sure my passport was current! 

$30 One bottle of Huizache Blanco Tequila. Must be 21 to purchase voucher. 

$40 One bottle of Huizache Reposado. Must be 21 to purchase voucher.

$50 One bottle of Huizache Origen. Must be 21 to purchase voucher.

$70 Blanco Reposado Pack. One bottle of each Huizache Blanco &  Huizache Reposado. Must be 21 to purchase voucher.

$120 Blanco, Reposado, Origen Pack. One bottle of each, Huizache Blanco, Huizache Reposado, & Huizache Origen. Must be 21 to purchase voucher.

$240 Huizache Double Pack. Two bottles of each, Huizache Blanco, Huizache Reposado & Huizache Origen. Our best small party pack. Must be 21 to purchase voucher.

$500 Huizache Mixed Case. 4 bottles of Huizache Blanco, 4 bottles of Huizache Reposado, and 4 bottles of Huizache Origen. Must be 21 to purchase voucher.


$7500 Huizache Mixed Distributor Pack. 14 cases of Huizache Blanco, 14 cases of Huizache Reposado, and 14 cases of Huizache Origen. 42 cases shipped DAP. Must hold Wholesale Distributor License to purchase this voucher. 

The Impact

  • You are impacting lives here. Your contribution grows exponentially. Each one of you who take part are touching people’s lives in two countries. You literally can know you have eventually impacted thousands of people with your contribution here.
  • For me the saying “Saving the world” and we can get there “one bottle at a time” is a central part of our mindset here at Agave Sun International. Hitting campaign goals here set us on a path of key acquisitions. And this includes hiring a team. From there we can begin impacting the world in ways that make it better. Once we hit positive cash flow Agave Sun is going to help build in our community to make it stronger, and make positive impacts to last generations into the future. But to get there I need you.  
  • Each stage has been checked, each required move on the chessboard is measured. The only hurdle we have left is the state level licenses.  
  • By participating in this campaign you are one of those hands up. Even if you only leverage a single dollar, you are moving us up and a little closer to getting over the hurdle.
  • This has been developed to be a sustainable business. From local community service projects to larger scale ones later, our goal is to leave our world better than we found it.  

Risks & Challenges

  • Currently our risk is Barrier to Entry. It is our estimated cost that it will take $250,000.00 to secure all of our licenses in the United States. But, we have a mitigation plan where at $7,500.00 we can set our lawyer loose. At $11,000.00 we can acquire office space. At $21,000.00 our doors to the office can open. At $42,000.00 all of our internal information technology needs are met. At $72,000.00 funds are aggressively applied to state license acquisitions. At $100,000.00 we can actively participate in the national tradeshows. Our stretch goals would be to hit $250,000.00 as that opens up most of the doors that are currently closed. Beyond this, we would be able to look to make some immediate positions available as those funds would be used to fill key roles in this company.  
  • Our plan is simple. Key acquired licenses are assets as they are the only legal barrier to cash flow. After that we are able to begin sales to Wholesale Distributors, Buying Agents, and Procurement Officers. Revenues will be aggressively reinvested into the company to secure its positioning. Phased growth and acquisition plans allow us to grow quickly in response to our demands on a departmental basis.
  • Want to know more for Due Diligence? Contact us directly.

Other Ways You Can Help? Join the revolution and Demand Huizache!

  • Cannot contribute? That is not true! You can still join this revolution! Spread the Demand for Huizache! Click share and send!
  • Do you have friends or family that work at a Wholesale Liquor Distributor? Send this to them. Bring this to them. We have special offers just for them, so help bring them here.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! You have great power with each share you give us!

Saving the world from bad tequila one bottle at a time!


FAQ's

What is a voucher?

Since Indiegogo and us cannot directly sell to you our tequila, we are offering vouchers. This voucher can be traded for the tequila. We have a few retailers who will be shipping where legal. If we cannot ship directly to you, we will work out an agreement in your area with a liquor store so you can pick this up close to home. 

Must be 21 at time of purchase. 
I cannot be any clearer. You must be 21 at the time of purchase. Be patient. We will still be here waiting for you! 

Shipping costs
Shipping costs are calculated from UPS and we selected a price where we know we can get this to you. Chances are it will be a little less. 

Wholesale Distributors Only?
Yup, for the pallet at those prices you MUST be a Wholesale Distributor with current and active licenses.
 
DAP shipping?
DAP is Delivered At Place. This means we are shipping directly from the dock in Mexico to the dock at your warehouse.  The DAP price shown in shipping is an estimate. Contact us for more details. 

This is dedicated to my father. I love you Dad. I hope I make you smile. SJP
