story:
Our Mission

What do you think if your children could learn about different countries around the world through their new best friend, Teddy? Teddy is a world traveler. He will tell your children about his amazing experiences through picture books of the places that he has been. Teddy hopes to inspire your children to explore and to treasure the beautiful world that we are living in. 

We are Elise and Alex and currently live in Salt Lake City, Utah. This spring, we are launching a unique company that will help educate young children, provide people in developing countries with jobs and, at the same time, help many families around the world. Please join us to make a positive impact on many communities with Teddy the Traveler. 

How It works

Our Teddies will come from many different places and are of different backgrounds and nationalities. We will manufacture teddy bears and their outfits will be designed to resemble the traditional costumes of the countries/places that he/she is from. Then, we will get these bears photographed at famous landmarks around the world. We will also write a short 5-10 page book about the Teddy and his or her adventures and everyday life. We will put the bear including the book on our website for sale. 

Educating Young Children Around the World

The main purpose of Teddy the Traveler is to educate young children around the world.  For example, Mr. Teddy (photographed in all these pictures) is originally from South America but came to America as a little Bear in search of a better life. He now lives in Salt Lake City, Utah and enjoys hiking, the outdoors and attending a local university.

Each Teddy will have a different name and, as mentioned, come with a unique background and story. The bear ultimately will educate children about culture, history and geography. 

Providing Employment in Developing Countries

As a part of our mission to positively impact communities around the world, Teddy the Traveler will help provide jobs in many developing countries. In addition to manufacturing teddy bears, we will need traditional clothes to fit each bear, photographers and story writers. We will put a big importance on finding local people to help us make each Teddy the Traveler unique. 

Helping Children and Families Around the World

With each sale of Teddy, we will donate 10% to help children and families. Donations will be made to UNICEF to support the survival, health and development of children and families around the world. We would like to ultimately see the donations go to the country of which the Teddy is from. For example, if a Utah Teddy is purchased, we would like to see the funds being used on communities in USA. On the other hand, if an Indian or African Teddy is ordered, the donations would go to India or Africa .

Where the Money Goes

  • Manufacturing - we will use $2,000 to manufacture and design first 400 Teddy Bears including their clothes. There will be four types of bears - two for United States (New York and Utah), one for India (Mumbai) and one for Africa. 
For example, the New York City Teddy will be wearing a suit and come with a unique story about his exciting life in the Big Apple and on Wall Street. On the other hand, the Teddy from India grew up in a small village and moved with his family to Mumbai to start a family business. He will be wearing traditional Indian clothes (Kurta) and will educate about the culture and local traditions.

  • Books -$2,750 will be used to print 500 books (4 different sets of books with a different story line and photographs). The cost includes hiring local photographers and story writers.
  • Regulatory Testing - $1,500 will go towards various toy safety testing by third party companies as required by the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission. While the manufacturer will be in compliance of all U.S. and Europe toy safety standards, the Teddies still are required to be tested.
  • Website - $750 will be used to put up a website to be able to sell the Teddies to people around the world. Anyone in the world will be able to enjoy Teddy the Traveler.

We will also write a short 5-10 page book about the Teddy and his or her adventures and everyday life. We will put the bear including the book on our website for sale. 




Educating Young Children Around the World

The main purpose of Teddy the Traveler is to educate young children around the world.  For example, Mr. Teddy (photographed in all these pictures) is originally from South America but came to America as a little Bear in search of a better life. He now lives in Salt Lake City, Utah and enjoys hiking, the outdoors and attending a local university.
Each Teddy will have a different name and, as mentioned, come with a unique background and story. The bear ultimately will educate children about culture, history and geography. 


Providing Employment in Developing Countries

As a part of our mission to positively impact communities around the world, Teddy the Traveler will help provide jobs in many developing countries. In addition to manufacturing teddy bears, we will need traditional clothes to fit each bear, photographers and story writers. We will put a big importance on finding local people to help us make each Teddy the Traveler unique. 



Helping Children and Families Around the World

With each sale of Teddy, we will donate 10% to help children and families. Donations will be made to UNICEF to support the survival, health and development of children and families around the world. We would like to ultimately see the donations go to the country of which the Teddy is from. For example, if a Utah Teddy is purchased, we would like to see the funds being used on communities in USA. On the other hand, if an Indian or African Teddy is ordered, the donations would go to India or Africa .
 




Where the Money Goes 


Manufacturing - we will use $2,000 to manufacture and design first 400 Teddy Bears including their clothes. There will be four types of bears - two for United States (New York and Utah), one for India (Mumbai) and one for Africa. 

For example, the New York City Teddy will be wearing a suit and come with a unique story about his exciting life in the Big Apple and on Wall Street. On the other hand, the Teddy from India grew up in a small village and moved with his family to Mumbai to start a family business. He will be wearing traditional Indian clothes (Kurta) and will educate about the culture and local traditions.



Books -$2,750 will be used to print 500 books (4 different sets of books with a different story line and photographs). The cost includes hiring local photographers and story writers.



Regulatory Testing - $1,500 will go towards various toy safety testing by third party companies as required by the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission. While the manufacturer will be in compliance of all U.S. and Europe toy safety standards, the Teddies still are required to be tested.


Website - $750 will be used to put up a website to be able to sell the Teddies to people around the world. Anyone in the world will be able to enjoy Teddy the Traveler.

story:
Hi there!

Hello thanks for taking the time to check out our campaign.  My name is Mandy and in partnership with my husband Richard, and his brother Shannon, we have an ambitious plan to keep a great Australian country pub alive.  Welcome to the small country town of Bolgart in Western Australia, about 130km from Perth in wheatbelt country north of Toodyay.

The owners of the Bolgart Hotel are ready to retire and move on.  We want to purchase the Bolgart Hotel and create a modern business that is professionally operated,  generous to the local community, and a great place to come for a meal.  We will be a welcoming hotel that is an enjoyable place to bring your family and a proud member of the Bolgart community.   Whether you are a local, day tripper from Perth or an interstate/overseas visitor you'll find that something special about us and the Bolgart Hotel.  An exciting part of our plan is to put Dick and Shannon's beer making skills to good use and produce craft beer using wheat locally grown by farmers in the region.

The three of us currently run small businesses and can see the amazing potential of this idea.  Dick and Shannon are HD mechanics and have worked in the area since 2008 providing mechanical services to farmers.  We now have a long term presence in the town and would love to be the ones who bring the Bolgart Hotel back to life and see her prosper for the town.

Our stumbling block right now are the stringent lending requirements of traditional financial institutions.  With your help we'll be able to raise the funds to purchase and restore the 100 year old Bolgart Hotel. 

Our goals are to:

  • cater for a wide range of hotel patrons from young adults through to families, seniors, visitors, tourists and special guests;
  • be a contributor to the Bolgart community;
  • produce Bolgart’s first ever commercial craft beer using our local farmers' grains;
  • rejuvenate the building by investing in repairs and improvements; and
  • celebrate the Hotel’s centenary this year in style with a weekend party and entertainment.

This is not the first time such an ambitious fundraising event has taken place, an excerpt from Rica Erickson's book The Victoria Plains, she describes how in 1915 the town raised over 200 pounds (an enormous sum for the day) through a number of humorous and burlesque events as part of a gala day of of sports and bazaars. 
 Come with us now on an equally ambitious task of raising funds to keep the town's hotel alive.

Read more about the Bolgart and the hotel on our website www.reviveacountrypub.com


What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise $500,000 to be used in three key areas:
  1. top up our deposit;
  2. restore the building; and
  3. implement our business plan actions.

Part of the money raised will be used to help us achieve the 50% deposit required for commercial loans with banks.  The cash will supplement the security that we are personally providing. 

Secondly, we need to invest in restoring the building so that she can see out another 100 years.  The current state of the building requires work to improve the street appeal and preserve an important part of the Bolgart town site history.  We need to upgrade the electrical system and install air-conditioning, as well as undertake plumbing repairs throughout the building.  A play area that is safe and attractive for children also needs to be created so that families can enjoy time at the Hotel.

The third area in which funds will be used will be an investment into the management of the Hotel so that actions from marketing plan, expanding the product and service range, and relationship building can be undertaken.  A grand centenary celebration is planned  which we hope will include a weekend street party, entertainment and an exhibition of the local history over the past 100 years.  We would like to collect oral and pictorial contributions from community members to share which will be collated and made available electronically.

To thank you for your your contribution we've created a series of enticing Perks.  We've got two opportunities for you to be held in the highest esteem and have a bar named in your honor.  Or you may prefer to have the dining room named after you. There is also the opportunity to be the Hotel's Centenarian, with a plaque to be unveiled during the centenary celebrations in recognition of your contribution.   Maybe you'd like that elusive gold card for hotel visits - we've got that for you for when ever you are in town.  For those of you overseas who may not get the chance to visit the Bolgart Hotel we can work something out, like sending you our craft beer to enjoy whilst you beam into the bar via Skype!

You also have the option of making a contribution without claiming a perk, and can remain anonymous if you want.

The Impact

Your contribution will help us to ensure a piece of Western Australia's history is not lost.   The Bolgart Hotel was one of only 6 State Hotels built in the early 1900s and still has the characteristic double brick construction with the iconic Jarrah wood floors and staircase.

The isolation of rural living and the impact this has on mental health and community connection is well documented.  By keeping the Bolgart Hotel alive we are providing a meeting place for socialising, whilst also being an active contributor to local sporting and community groups through our relationship initiatives in our business plan.

Our aim is for the Bolgart Hotel to become recognised as a country pub of choice for great value food and an enjoyable place to be.  We want to involve farmers in  brewing craft beer made with local grains, an activity that the town can be recognised for and proud of.  For the Bolgart farmers just imagine drinking a beer that has been produced with the wheat that you sowed and harvested!

Some of the ideas we have to be a contributor to the community include:

  • Monthly fundraiser BBQs.  Gold coin donations will be collected and donated to the organisations that keep a country town vibrant, such as the school P&C, sporting clubs, volunteer fire brigade and the progress association;
  • Free room hire for community groups to meet and conduct their business and workshops;
  • Operation of a community bus to provide a safe travel alternative and to be available for hire;
  • Regular men's and women's health nights (alternate weeks of course!); and
  • Functions and themed menu nights.

Other items we have provided for in our business plan include:

  • An expanded menu, food available all day (dine in hours and take away hours);
  • Air conditioning;
  • Sports bar with wide screen TVs for the cricket and football;
  • Weekly specials;
  • Marketing to clubs (cars, bikes, photography etc); and
  • Connecting with organisations such as Tourism WA during wildflower season.
What we are passionate about is creating a place that is attractive to all groups of customers, great service, cold beer and delicious food.

A message from a community member

Throughout the past 100 years the historic Bolgart Hotel has been the gathering  place for locals and  for people from surrounding districts.  It has been the social hub for the townspeople of all ages and the venue for a variety of  functions and activities.

A meeting place after sporting fixtures, home to the former Bolgart Men’s and Ladies’ Darts Teams,  birthday celebrations,  seminars,  club meetings  and special occasion dinners and luncheons,  the hotel can cater for a crowd or a small group.  The reputation of the quality steaks served for dinner is known far and wide  and attracts diners from other towns as well.

In winter open log fires warm the bar and games room and are appreciated by the patrons on cold nights.  A handsome old jarrah staircase  which has been expertly restored and polished has proved to be the perfect backdrop for wedding photos and group snapshots.

The hotel provides accommodation for travellers and visitors to the area and is one of the few Victoria Plains towns where there is a place to stay.  It's always booked out for big sporting events in Bolgart such as the annual Bowling Club Two Day  Classic  when lots of bowlers arrive in town.

At times the hotel has provided the venue for romance when backpackers from all over the world come to sample the country life in Australia and while working in the hotel meet their life’s partner. And long-term friendships are formed with the locals, often resulting in continuing contacts after they have returned home.

So many stories, so many memories, and with a sympathetic nip and tuck from expert tradespeople the Bolgart Hotel will re-emerge as the country icon it has been in the past.

Never again will the phrase “Bolgart? Where the Hell is that?” be heard because this pub is about to become very well known and a sought out destination in WA, and you can be part of the excitement and help it happen.


Risks & Challenges

Every business presents its own set of risks and challenges.  We have spent the last eight months writing a business plan on which to launch the success of the revived hotel.  A risk assessment helped us to identify what could go wrong and we've thought about the ways we can avoid those things as well as how to manage them if they do occur.  

We've undertaken a comprehensive analysis of our market segments and identified how to cater for each of them so that our service and products align with their needs and wants.  

The biggest challenge we are facing is meeting the rigid lending requirements of banks who don't seem interested in understanding the value of the Bolgart Hotel to the community.  This enterprise is a labour of love for us and it's extremely difficult to convert the context of the current situation into a viable proposition for lenders.  We know that once we have made the improvements, implemented the business plan actions and managed the finances then the Bolgart Hotel will look a lot better on paper. 

Our crowd funding target is extremely ambitious, if we achieve this goal then we can have the hotel in a state ready to celebrate it's centenary.  If we don't reach the target and are not in a position to be able to purchase the hotel then all contributors will be given the option of receiving a refund or agreeing to add their contribution to a community fund to repair what we can with the money raised.   All the perks provided are contingent on us being able to purchase the hotel.

Bolgart is made up of some very passionate and motivated people, with their help we are confident we can overcome these challenges. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute and that's OK, we understand that.   You can still be a great help to us though.   If you are a believer in our project and can see the benefits of keeping a country pub alive then please use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out!  

Email this link to your address book, paste and share this page to your Facebook page - we know we can get the word out with your help.

story:
Short Summary

Why a Swimsuit That Fits Like Underwear?
  • Trying on Swimsuits at the store is a hassle and unpleasant. Hygienic strips, harsh lighting and over eager sales people, oh my!
  • Buying swimsuits online isn't much better. You lose the bad lighting and sales people but you still have to try several brands, sizes and styles to get the one that works the best for you. Your mail person may began to give you side eye for all the package deliveries and returns. 
  • You already have a pair of underwear that is the unsung hero of your wardrobe! That comfy pair that hugs you in all the right places and flatters your figure making you look and feel great. We want your swimsuit to feel the same way so we built it to fit like your favorite pair of undies and built an online shopping experience that takes all the guesswork and unpleasantness out of finding your best fitting swimsuit. 
  • Answer a few simple questions about the sizes you wear in underwear and clothes, your body type and your style preferences and we'll put together your personal swimwear boutique. 
We have been self-funded to this point but we are asking for $25,000 to make our vision a reality. We get to keep 100% of the donations (minus  a small amount of merchant and Indiegogo fees) and will get traditional funding for whatever we don't get crowdfunding. 

What We Need & What You Get

Website: We want this to be simple. You answer a few questions about your size in your favorite underwear and pants, lifestyle and color/style choices and we give you a personalized boutique with all the perfect swimsuits in your size. 

Design: During our market research we kept hearing that women want to buy swimwear that fits like their favorite underwear. We are working with a designer to build a collection using the latest lightweight stretch fabric technology to create the same fit as your favorite underwear- self-lined, no hooks, snaps or ties and no underwire. 

What do you get for supporting us?

§  An exclusive 5 supporters will get the opportunity to design their dream suit by working with our designer/patternmaker to develop their own suit named after them and added to our collection.

§  25 supporters will get exclusive VIP pricing on swimsuits for life! Our collection will include bikini, tankini and one-piece. 

§  Other supporters can choose from getting 1 VIP priced swimsuit, a monogrammed wet/dry swimsuit bag or Black Pearl branded beach towel.

If we don’t get fully funded we will prioritize the website and just launch our initial limited collection of swimsuits using our manufacturer in LA.

The Impact

We understand that an improved swimwear buying experience may not change the world but it can provide women with a positive, confidence boosting experience that may change the way she feels about herself. As our company grows we will partner with existing non-profits to help bring education and awareness to improve Girl's Self-Esteem.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not able to contribute cash? That’s ok- we still need your help! Please share our campaign with your network by putting on your social media channels and encouraging your friends and family to support us. Do you run a blog? Please share our story and what we are trying to do with your community and encourage them to support us. Use the hashtags:  #SwimInYourUndies #FundBlackPearl

story:
Hello everyone!

We are the only Day Care Center for Elderly people in a remote small city of Balykchy, Kyrgyzstan. The harsh economic situation has forced many young people to leave our town in search of better life opportunities. This is having a devastating effect on the elderly, who are now lonely and more vulnerable to illnesses.

Our center has been opened to tackle this huge problem, by promoting a favorable environment for elderly people to communicate with one another, make friends and most importantly feel that they are not alone. 

Due to harsh winter in our town, when the temperature can hit minus 20 degrees, we cannot host the guests, for a simple reason that there is no appropriate heating system, neither the glassed windows nor the doors. We have tried to fix this problem ourselves, by jointly producing and selling egg noodles, crafts, various national souvenirs, but the money generated was not enough to cover all the expenses and this is where we need your help.

If you step in and donate to our campaign, we will be able to host our elderly people throughout the entire year and engage 119 more people who are in our waiting list and in a desperate need of our help.

We now need to raise some 9,000 US Dollars to change windows and doors and install solar panel, which would give hot water to our Center.

More specifically, we need the following:

§  3,500 USD for 26 triple glassed windows, which will keep the warmth

§  2,250 USD – to change 14 old doors to new ones

§  2,455 USD will provide 200 liters solar device for heating water

§  795 USD will help us to safe the electricity, by installing energy efficient/saving bulbs.

By donating to this campaign, you are helping the elderly people, who have worked hard their entire lives and truly deserve our support!

Let’s not forget that our generous contribution is not only bringing warmth and coziness to older generation in need, but far more importantly, it is helping us by boosting our self-esteem and sense of shared responsibility!

Meet our Kyrgyzstan crowdfunding team!


This campaign is launched within the framework of the UNDP AltFinance Lab and Crowdfunding Academy and is supported by the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Slovakia  


Here are our dear friends - partners:

is not only bringing warmth and coziness to older generation in need, but far
more importantly, it is helping us by boosting our self-esteem and sense of shared
responsibility!Meet our Kyrgyzstan crowdfunding team!This campaign is launched within the
framework of the UNDP AltFinance Lab and Crowdfunding Academy and is supported
by the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Slovakia  Here are our dear friends - partners:

story:
Faraday Grid Ltd are developing an entirely new technology, the Faraday Exchanger, to address short term volatility and frequency, which when deployed across the electricity grid will create a Faraday Grid, enabling significantly greater integration of renewable energy; increased grid stability; as well as contributing to reduced cost of energy for consumers.

On 12th December 2017, we demonstrated live our prototype of the Faraday Exchanger.

 

 

 

 

 

We all need access to affordable and consistent power sources to live our lives. Renewable energy sources being introduced are creating technical issues for our grid affecting power stability and efficiency. The best solution is to update our grid technology to adapt to this change. We have designed a new hardware device for use in our electricity grid to do this.

Help us build our first full prototype of what we've named 'The Faraday Exchanger'

Intro

We all need access to affordable and consistent power sources to live our lives. Policy makers worldwide have mandated to increase levels of renewable energy generation to minimise global environmental impact, however these “clean” energy sources are not controllable in the same way as traditional (i.e. fossil fuel) sources for delivering power.

Maintaining consistent electricity supply relies critically on a stable frequency in the electricity network. Traditional fossil fuels, nuclear and even hydro power are all synchronous generators which create inertia to help maintain this frequency, and are controllable providing frequency response and maintained stability.

 

New generation from wind and solar is asynchronous and does not have the same inertia, making frequency response difficult. Due to its volatility there is a limit to the amount of this type of energy we can integrate to grids without causing significant instability. Injection of power throughout the grid from renewables can lead to localized voltage and frequency issues. Current grids cannot adequately compensate and are not able to distribute the power elsewhere in the network to be used where it is needed.

The consequences of too much instability are energy loss, added cost, and network failure. It is the issue of volatility the Faraday Exchanger solves for.

 

Our design - Concept

We’ve designed a hardware device that replaces transformers in existing electricity grids and enables the more volatile and distributed energy sources to generate and dispatch electricity without disrupting the operation of the grid in delivering electricity to the user - you.

We have proved the design concept, and are now seeking to develop our first full prototype for testing. If successful this technology can potentially be used throughout electricity grids worldwide.

The Benefits of the Faraday Exchanger

  • Greater integration of renewable energy sources
  • Greater network efficiency and reduction of loss between points
  • Potential for peer to peer energy sharing

 

Other grid Solutions are available but not ideal -

  1. Solution: Store and use renewable energy like conventional generation using batteries
    Flaw: Battery technology is still too expensive for the wider population and not efficient enough for large networks
  2. Solution: Curtail renewable energy generation and integration and continue to rely on coal power
    Flaw: We will never meet targets for reduction in carbon emissions
  3. Solution: Adapt our electricity grid design for renewable energy – this is where we come in.

 

 

 

 

 

 

More about the Faraday Exchanger

A Faraday Exchanger is intended to be one of many throughout an electricity network to manage and balance the volatility of e.g. solar and wind energy sources.  When distributed throughout a grid, the ‘Faraday Grid’ will act to provide the inertial response and primary frequency response to maintain stability.

The Faraday Exchanger directly replaces transformers in the existing electricity grid, changing the constraints of our existing grid. It utilizes all the existing poles and wires in our grid. It also removes the need for additional expensive equipment or systems, which makes the grid more fragile.

The implementation of our Faraday Exchanger will create a self-managing power grid. Deployment of Faraday Exchangers into our energy networks will turn our current under-performing grid into a more efficient and responsive "Faraday Grid".

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Our Campaign Goals

The next stage of our project is simulation and prototyping. Taking the lessons learnt from our proof of concept prototypes, a dynamic model of our original design will be created in advanced simulation packages. This will allow us to test a number of applications and design versions through design optimization in order to make improvements in both response and efficiency much faster and safely than doing it physically.

Once the design has been completed, the components for our first prototype will be manufactured by local suppliers and assembled for testing and analysis in our lab. With this prototype we will be able to use the results to put together a comprehensive proposal to help us fund the full design and commercialization process.

This process will take us 4 months and cost $250,000. If we do not reach our funding goal, all funds raised will still go directly toward the simulation and prototyping. The remaining funds required will be invested by our team over time as we can afford, which may draw out our development process timeline.

 

 

 

How You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute directly please help us get the word out! We would love it if you could share our story with all your friends and family through your favorite communication style. Whether that be Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube or even good old fashioned talking over a coffee, we all need to work towards reducing fossil-fueled power - for our planet, ourselves, and our children.

 

 

 

We have put together some great perks to say thank you for contributing to our project. Whilst we can't give you all a Faraday Exchanger directly as a perk, we certainly hope that one day you will have one in your house connecting your rooftop solar system to the grid. 

- Matt Williams

story:
Short Summary:

 

CO2 as a greenhouse gas. The atmosphere overheats, so we need to cut CO2 emissions down. But how, if the needs are growing? In our opinion, recovering the energy just used and we're still to pay for it is the shortest and most reliable way so, we developed our little but powerful, cheap but, tough renewable energy source - the HydroThermal Economizer , the #HTEconomizer.

Why the campaign is that important to us? Well, we love life, we love Earth, we love our children and we want to bequeath it to them clean & safe, forever. Thus it appears, that's important for every one.

To help us now, it means to preserve more of the Nature for your children & generations to come.

That's really awesome, isn't it?

 

What We Need & What You Get:

 

The funds we rise now (in common, 42500 USD) have a strictly aimed purpose: To produce specific instrumentation equipment in order to achieve high performance,  systems for assembly, test and environmental protection equipment and for raw materials, energy, machinery and clothing as well. There is also needs of personal protective equipment etc.

  • As a result, You're about to get a nature-friendly device to save hundreds or even thousands kwh/year...well, if used. The more the better. It already  has some accessory like the configurable deflective water mixer (we call it "CDWM", seen on the rear plan of pitch video) thus we've started to add these "smart appliances" that make it easier to connect & run. It's just a baby-product but, we already work also on the next generation modules. It is very development&growth-friendly "toy", guys. You'll see.
  • What You see on the photo is the test site with all these cables & pipes necessary for tests. The HTEconomizer is that blue device under the sink.
  • All these perks we feature to Your attention mean at least that, buying the HTEconomizer, You acquire it on prime cost, no additional mark-ups.

 

The Impact:

 

We do our best to clean and renew the world. We do it for our children and that inspires us. Hope it inspires You too.

  • People produce and sell anything - unfortunately, increasingly dangerous, harmful or simply unnecessary complicated things. And, because of our ignorance and not enough thoughtful mind we don't know where to focus our efforts & simply misused high technology, making the same as do the others. The result is competition and oversaturation of the market niches with frank nonsense. Well, we chose another way: Let's do something simple, fast and - notice! - In its own way beautiful. Something that makes life better and richer: Few elements of plastic, some of rubber & metal and, You have 30 to 50% more energy for washing for less price. All it's life cycle long.
  • In addition widespread, the HTEconomizer is equal to the power of more than ten's of nuclear reactors worldwide with no radiation contamination. Wonderful, isn't it?

 

Risks & Challenges:

 

  • No one and nothing is perfect. Risks exist everywhere and the worst risk is to do nothing, while nature's collapses.
  • Financially, when they begin to copy us - because the product is worth copying - there is a risk to be displaced or absorbed by the market, that's a fact. Well, the competitors will try anyway. 
  • That's the Challenge: To do or not to do.
  • The good news is that, we are already at some steps ahead because we've already developed an entire product line. So, we chose to do.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Dear friends, If money really makes things happen, the Spirit is the one that moves people. If You like this project but You are not able to support us financially, do not fall into despondency ;-). All Your assistance we consider as a kind of contribution.
  •  We are grateful for every single action that promotes this cause. Do trust Yourself: You still do Your best in this particular case. Be inspired and let nothing stop you: Share worldwide ;-) . 
  • Although You may used different ways for that, use the Indiegogo share tools too.

So don't miss the moment. Contribute now.

That's the Challenge: To do or not to do.
The good news is that, we are already at some steps ahead because we've already developed an entire product line. So, we chose to do.


 
Other Ways You Can Help
 

Dear friends, If money really makes things happen, the Spirit is the one that moves people. If You like this project but You are not able to support us financially, do not fall into despondency ;-). All Your assistance we consider as a kind of contribution.
 We are grateful for every single action that promotes this cause. Do trust Yourself: You still do Your best in this particular case. Be inspired and let nothing stop you: Share worldwide ;-) . 
Although You may used different ways for that, use the Indiegogo share tools too.
So don't miss the moment. Contribute now.

story:
After experiencing job loss due to lack of affordable transportation or available public transportation, Jada Atkins mother of four decided to take action and develop a community base carpool service. One woman one car. 

Upstate Carpool Group have been in service for two years and helping the invincible communities get back to work. This service enable the rural community residents and the needest population in the city to obtain sustainable employment; great empowering tool. Spartanburg SC jobs are plenty but with poor public transportation that travel no where, short hours (6am-6:30pm),people have no other choices but to live in poverty and lack basic needs.

 Upstate Carpool group will also be Carpooling to the election poles and is free for the community. We are in high demand and need your help to supply vans so we can help many more. Another great thing about us, we are a green community! We take cars off the road and leave less of a carbon foot print. 

Think of how many people our carpool community helps. Our service is the equivalent to putting a meal on the table or not. Please consider Upstate Carpool Group for a donation for the purchase of vans. Upstate Carpool Group and I would like to thank you.

story:
#DesignForChange

Imagine if you could, as a client, build a school for the underprivileged, or maybe feed a hundred hungry stomachs. Perhaps you are interested in contributing towards the research of new medicines. Imagine accomplishing them while getting branded or marketed.

We at eleven percent combined our love for design with our mission to give back to the world. We’re an online creative agency that allows anyone to buy a creative/design/branding service from our website with a click of a button. Every service purchased is managed by our exceptional creative team that handle each order with meticulous planning and execution; and 11% of every sale goes towards a humanitarian cause of your choice.


Get your creative service with just a click of a few buttons:


How it works:


Help us make a difference:

While our business model strives to make an impact, we need your support to make a real difference in the world. Backing us will get you the exemplary creative skills you need to make your business stand out from the rest while you make a meaningful contribution to the world.


The need for funding:

For eleven percent to be open to the entire market, we'll need $100,000 in funding. This amount will help us:
  • Employ a Customer Support team so we make sure customers have all their questions answered quickly.
  • Hire a Business Development team so we can reach out to more people just like you.
  • Bring in more creative talent to help us handle bigger volumes of our services.
  • Form key partnerships with humanitarian causes to provide continuous support and change more lives.
  • Add the following options on our website to give our customers a smoother and better experience: 

    - A more detailed brief for each service that helps us get to know more about the customers and their preference.

    - Payment gateway portals

    - A CRM system that allows each customer to track the status of their order and allows them also to chat with the designer / art director who's working on their service.


As a way to say thank you, we thought we'd give you back something you may like and / or need:


We aim to reach our funding goal so we can grow and be available for everyone that needs our services. Nonetheless, if we didn't reach our goal, then the amount we make will go primarily to further improve the customer experience on our website and make the donation part easier for customers to choose from. Contributors will still get their rewards as mentioned above and on the dates set.

The Impact

Since launching eleven percent we have signed with 12 accounts, 5 of which on retainer basis. The model has proven to be in demand by the market and we have reached a point where we are getting more and more orders so we need to grow bigger in order to keep handling each order with the same attention and care.


Risks & Challenges

Along the way, we may stumble upon a few risks on challenges such as: 

  • Having a high amount of orders before finding the right creative people to hire.
  • System implementation glitches.
  • Not having enough orders to survive for further more 8 months on the funding made

We have thought the potential risks through and we have a plan to reduce any obstacles that may come our way. We will only start hiring creative heads and designers just when we have higher amounts of orders coming in. We have already started screening potential candidates so the interview process will start only when a higher volume of orders start coming in.

As for the website, we will keep the current website running and we'll only launch the new improved version after running thorough checks for 2 weeks to ensure no glitches occur. 

To avoid running out of liquidity to cover the hiring and salary fees, the priority is to build the sales and business development department in order to secure several new accounts. We can always go slow on hiring until we are in a good position financially to hire. In the worst case scenarios we will sub-contract art directors and graphic designers for the big orders (packages).


How you can help

There are many ways you can help us other than contributing. You can:

- Share this campaign on your social media profiles and tell your friends and family about it. 

- Share our Thunderclap. This will give a chance to have a bigger reach on social media so we can get to as many people as possible.

Each person who gets to know about eleven percent can be of great help so please spread the word. This is another form of help that is greatly needed and which will make a huge impact on our campaign too.

story:
Ze great tool to learn Wine tasting !

1 Kit ZE TASTE OF TIME French Oak - 99 USD worldwide delivery included



To celebrate the launch of ZE TASTE OF TIME and as a special thank you to our first INDIEGOGO contributors the first 500 kits will be delivered with no additional postage supplement, worldwide!

Everyone loves...

  • music, 
  • painting, 
  • great food, 
  • good coffee, 
  • or a glass of fine wine.

The colors are taught to toddlers from their childhood, and middle school students have music lessons that introduce them to the notes and chords. 

Understanding alchemy between barrel and wine....


Learning the tastes of grape varieties is relatively easy with advice from one’s favorite wine shop, but nothing existed until today to LEARN ABOUT THE WOOD WE ALL DRINK, and understand the alchemy between the barrel and the wine or spirit inside it!

We made it simple, educational and fun for you :

The barrel oak tasting kit ZE TASTE OF TIME is a simple and educational way to experience at home, with friends or alone, without stress, with interactive educational content and explanations from renowned oak experts (available online on our dedicated website).


Created by two enological wood experts


François PARTHON de VON and Alban PETITEAUX are the Wood guys serving the Wine and Spirit guys.

While Francois PARTHON de VON walks the prestigious French national forests to select the best old oaks for the greatest vintages of wines and spirits, Alban PETITEAUX often gives lectures on enological oak.


Birth of ze idea

Alban always ends his presentations with a tasting of several oak profiles in a wine or spirit. 

Participants learn to discern :

  • the tannins, 
  • the structure
  • the flavor 

Throughout the tasting, they discover the roles of oak during the ageing, and its contributions in terms of :

  • flavor,
  • intensity, 
  • finish.

 This is an original sensory experience, both very personal and participatory. Novice amateurs or confirmed tasters alike do enjoy this fun exercise, and some finally understand why they like a "woody" style over another.

Often at the end of these conferences, participants ask Alban how they can reproduce this great experience at home, with their friends or family.


That's why we created Ze Taste of Time tasting kit

Ready-to-fill and easy to use, rich in educational content and practical tips to organize and lead the tasting


ZE TASTE OF TIME is a pretty box containing:

  • 6 white 37.5cl glass bottles identified by codes, 
  • 6 closures also coded, 
  • 1 anti-drip disc to simplify the wine service, 
  • 1 pipette for those who want to do their final blend,
  •  and an access code for a lot of educational content online.

The first bottle is empty. It will be the control “unoaked” bottle. 

The following four bottles contain one oak stick and the sixth bottle is preloaded with two sticks.

Wooden sticks made of authentic ultrapremium barrelgrade oak


Behind their apparent simplicity our wooden sticks are made of AUTHENTIC ULTRAPREMIUM slow-growth barrelgrade, oak 150 to 250 years old, harvested by us at the heart of the most prestigious French national forests, 

100% sustainably managed and P.E.F.C. certified.

Split by hand in prime stavewood, air-stacked and left to season outdoor for at least 2 years, the oak is precision-toasted before being cut into sticks by our French craftsmen.

More than wood, these oak sticks are concentrated time! ...

By adding wine in bottles (unoaked or as little oaked as possible - seek advice from your favorite wine shop), and letting infuse a few days, the user truly experiences the TASTE OF TIME.

Each piece of toasted oak tells a different story, with main and secondary aromas, tannic or sweet impressions, etc.

With this tasting kit, the user discovers the tastes of oak, and learns in a fun and friendly way the different qualities wood brings to wines and spirits: color, tannins, aromas, structure...

Red, white, dry, sweet, each wine variety reacts differently. The kit is reusable. It is easy to repeat the experience by buying an oak sticks refill box.


DELIVERY GUARANTEED FOR XMAS 2016

Shipment last week of November 2016



 About Oenowood


OENOWOOD INTERNATIONAL is a privately owned company founded in 2011 by François PARTHON VON and Alban PETITEAUX in Cognac, the world capital of fine brandy, high-end cooperage, and the leading exporting French region of spirits, in the heart of the European "Spirit Valley".

The company's main objectives are to meet the expectations of stakeholders in the timber industry and the wine sector looking for commercial and technical expertise, strategic advice and solutions related to the use of wood in all its enological forms.


FAQ

Why do I have to fill the bottles myself ?

For two reasons : first, we let you choose the alcohol you prefer to try with the oak. Second, if we pre-fill the bottles with wine for example, it will slowly oxydize by the time you receive your kit and vinegar is not what we want to taste!

Which wine should I use ?

You can use any red, white, rosé wine (unoaked or as little oaked as possible - seek advice from your favorite wine shop ) , but it also works with beer or liquors such as Rhum for example. Pick the one you prefer or try it with each of them if you can't choose.

How to organize a tasting ?

You will find all the details or our Youtube channel.

How many times can I use the sticks ?

It is better to use them only two times, because during the infusion, the alcool goes through the wood and takes the tannins and aromas. After two uses, the wood has nothing left to infuse.

How can I get more woodsticks ?

Ask your wine retailer for the refills. If he does not have some, send us your details and we will give you the nearest refill retailer's adress.

Is it possible to do it with big bottles ?

Yes, you will just have to double the dose of oak wood sticks.

I prefer one particular toast, is it possible to get a special refill ?

Yes, there are special boxes with one particular toast  and boxes with a blend of different toasts.

What is the perfect recipe ?

It is the one you will create with your kit, that you and your friends like and which matches your favorite dishes.

UNIQUE - FUN -EDUCATIONAL - FRIENDLY - MADE IN FRANCE


Follow us

Website : www.zetasteoftime.com
Facebook : www.facebook.com/zetasteoftime
Facebook France: www.facebook.com/ze-taste-of-time-kit-degustation-de-vin
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFN4O5nU5Qwsw7f_aNxukNA
Twitter : https://twitter.com/zetasteoftime
story_txt:
Ze great tool to learn Wine tasting !


1 Kit ZE TASTE OF TIME French Oak - 99 USD worldwide delivery included








To celebrate the launch of ZE TASTE OF TIME and as a special thank you to our first INDIEGOGO contributors the first 500 kits will be delivered with no additional postage supplement, worldwide!


Everyone loves...



music, 


painting, 


great food, 


good coffee, 


or a glass of fine wine.


The colors are taught to toddlers from their childhood, and middle school students have music lessons that introduce them to the notes and chords. 
Understanding alchemy between barrel and wine....



Learning the tastes of grape varieties is relatively easy with advice from one’s favorite wine shop, but nothing existed until today to LEARN ABOUT THE WOOD WE ALL DRINK, and understand the alchemy between the barrel and the wine or spirit inside it!
We made it simple, educational and fun for you :
The barrel oak tasting kit ZE TASTE OF TIME is a simple and educational way to experience at home, with friends or alone, without stress, with interactive educational content and explanations from renowned oak experts (available online on our dedicated website).


Created by two enological wood experts







François PARTHON de VON and Alban PETITEAUX are the Wood guys serving the Wine and Spirit guys.
While Francois PARTHON de VON walks the prestigious French national forests to select the best old oaks for the greatest vintages of wines and spirits, Alban PETITEAUX often gives lectures on enological oak.

Birth of ze idea
Alban always ends his presentations with a tasting of several oak profiles in a wine or spirit. 
Participants learn to discern :



the tannins, 


the structure


the flavor 


Throughout the tasting, they discover the roles of oak during the ageing, and its contributions in terms of :



flavor,


intensity, 


finish.


 This is an original sensory experience, both very personal and participatory. Novice amateurs or confirmed tasters alike do enjoy this fun exercise, and some finally understand why they like a "woody" style over another.
Often at the end of these conferences, participants ask Alban how they can reproduce this great experience at home, with their friends or family.


That's why we created Ze Taste of Time tasting kit


Ready-to-fill and easy to use, rich in educational content and practical tips to organize and lead the tasting



ZE TASTE OF TIME is a pretty box containing:



6 white 37.5cl glass bottles identified by codes, 


6 closures also coded, 


1 anti-drip disc to simplify the wine service, 


1 pipette for those who want to do their final blend,


 and an access code for a lot of educational content online.


The first bottle is empty. It will be the control “unoaked” bottle. 
The following four bottles contain one oak stick and the sixth bottle is preloaded with two sticks.
Wooden sticks made of authentic ultrapremium barrelgrade oak



Behind their apparent simplicity our wooden sticks are made of AUTHENTIC ULTRAPREMIUM slow-growth barrelgrade, oak 150 to 250 years old, harvested by us at the heart of the most prestigious French national forests, 

100% sustainably managed and P.E.F.C. certified.
Split by hand in prime stavewood, air-stacked and left to season outdoor for at least 2 years, the oak is precision-toasted before being cut into sticks by our French craftsmen.
More than wood, these oak sticks are concentrated time! ...
By adding wine in bottles (unoaked or as little oaked as possible - seek advice from your favorite wine shop), and letting infuse a few days, the user truly experiences the TASTE OF TIME.

With this tasting kit, the user discovers the tastes of oak, and learns in a fun and friendly way the different qualities wood brings to wines and spirits: color, tannins, aromas, structure...
Red, white, dry, sweet, each wine variety reacts differently. The kit is reusable. It is easy to repeat the experience by buying an oak sticks refill box.


DELIVERY GUARANTEED FOR XMAS 2016


Shipment last week of November 2016







 About Oenowood








OENOWOOD INTERNATIONAL is a privately owned company founded in 2011 by François PARTHON VON and Alban PETITEAUX in Cognac, the world capital of fine brandy, high-end cooperage, and the leading exporting French region of spirits, in the heart of the European "Spirit Valley".

story:
Hi! I’m Robin Marie, and I’m a full time jewelry designer, creator, small business owner and founder of Soasa Designs. I would like to invite you to join me in creating an inspiring, functional studio space in beautiful Berkshire County! 

Your contribution not only means great deals for you, but it will help me grow my work and continue to participate in our local economy. My long term visions include open studio events, small classes, and a dream of hiring an assistant! Having this dedicated space will make those goals possible.

Last fall my husband and I bought our first home, complete with an outbuilding just waiting to be converted into studio space. “Converted” sounds so simple but it needs a new roof, insulation, drywall, window repair, heat and lighting. It is worth the effort! After ten years, 18 moves, 2 countries and countless events all over New England, Soasa Designs has finally found a permanent home in Pittsfield, Massachusetts. 

Now we are turning to you, our extended community, to help us make this dream a reality!

You and Us 

We need your participation to fund this project! In exchange I am offering a broad range of perks and products that are completely unprecedented in Soasa history! You can see photos HERE or in the Gallery.

This is a flexible funding campaign because at this point, every dollar helps. 

$15 pays for joint compound, ALL of it!

$20 is a gallon of paint, and we all know how much impact that has!

$100? That's the lumber for framing walls!

The point is, your contribution, no matter the size, will go a long way to making our dream a reality.

 I will be doing the majority of the work myself, with some help from my husband and my best friend. This means that our sweat equity is high, but we can work as long as we have materials. For the sake of our home life and marriage we really need to have this done before the cold sets in again in October or November.

Budget & Plan

I am including a breakdown of how funds will be used, and planning a bare bones renovation. I already have the majority of the tools we will need, as well as some materials. For now I plan to use the workbenches and storage that I already have and expand when I am able. If we manage to surpass our initial funding goal, that could be sooner than  I planned!

$1100 Lumber, Insulation, Drywall + Materials, Paint

$1200 Electrical, Lights, Heating, Internet

$500 Floor Repair, Window Repair, Roofing Supplies (this is one area where I have a lot of materials)

$400 Tool Rentals

$200 Furniture

$450 Contingency

$350 Funding campaign costs (Fees and packaging, this amount is actually contingent on the amount raised)


Risks & Challenges

As far as your perks go, there is no risk that they won't go out. I have the product, packaging, 10 years experience and I will deliver! Store credit is given immediately and physical perks will ship out in early July 2016. If you have questions please don't hesitate to reach out!
Challenges to our project are primarily time and weather. End of August is the dream deadline, end of October is more realistic. 

Other Ways You Can Participate

If you can't afford to join in funding our project financially, don't worry! We totally understand! If you're into what we are doing and still want to be a part of Soasa Designs' history, please share this campaign. Do you write? Tweet? Do you have any photos from one of our booths? Share them! If you live in the area and want to help, reach out! We could always use a hand with something, and if you think of another way to be involved, let us know! We would love to hear from you, and Freya would love a belly rub!

story:
Galactic Garbanzo: A Taste of the Truth

Greetings fellow souls of the Universe,

The stars have aligned, such that we are able to bring to you a taste of truth through the gift of food. We’ve scowered the galaxy, far and wide, for nourishment that feeds the healthiest and most vibrant beings. Mission successful.

Galactic Garbanzo is here to bring you a taste of vegan delight you will never forget. Run by three close friends with a unique passion for food, each with years of experience in the restaurant industry. Together we will work harmoniously to deliver the absolute best vegan treats that Hartford has to offer.

After discovering our love for falafel from a favorite spot nearby, our lives changed forever. Falafel is a universal food that puts smiles on the faces of vegans and meat eaters alike. With a blend of crispy falafel, fresh veggies, a spicy spread and a layer of creamy tahini to top it all off, you will leave with a full belly and happy body.

The Team

Michael Myrbeck- The face you will get to know and love. Mike is taught in the art of non-aggression from the voice of Truth itself. You can be sure that he will lead you to the right choice when you meet him at the register

Justin DiLuiso- A skilled food artist with experience in cuisine from many different cultures. As a certified Reiki Master Practitioner, Justin will heal your energetic fields with each delicious dish. His deep care for Truth is foremost in all his actions.

Jacob Downey- Jake’s studies into the deep crevices of Truth by exploring geometry in relation to the construct of this very cosmos. His experience as a chef started at twelve years of age and has molded him into the masterful culinary wizard that he is today.

Fundraising Goal- $20,000

After months of research into food trucks, we thought that this would be a fair amount of money we could use to get our business up and running. Every penny will go to ensuring that we can start the business successfully and smoothly.

Breakdown:

Food Trailer-A mobile food trailer is not an inexpensive piece of equipment. A used trailer, with all necessary equipment and in good working order typically falls in the price range of $15,000. This includes a trailer big enough to fit us, a good-sized grill, refrigerators, all necessary food safety equipment, generator and anything else a small kitchen might need.

Start-up Inventory- To start our first day on the food truck, we will need money to buy our first groceries and all other supplies we will need to work inside the food truck. A good estimation for this would be somewhere around $1500.

Licenses- In order to start a small business, such as a food truck, there is a number of different licenses and permits that need to be acquired before opening day. Each individual license/permit has their own individual fee. An estimation to cover such fees will likely run somewhere around $1500.

Branding- A business needs a brand in order to be marketed to people. This includes graphic design work for the menu and logo, t-shirts and hats for uniforms, take-away menus for people to have, stickers and a social media presence. The price of all these things would be somewhere around $2000 in total.

Wiggle Room- Food trucks often need other money set away in order to leave safety for any blips in the road. This money will be funded through our own savings in order to show we are fully committed to investing and believing in our idea, as much as you are by making any size contribution. For this, we will raise $5,000 independently.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Saskia Coenen, also known as Panda/Aysel/Taoru, and am the owner/builder/allover creative mind of FuddlyStore! I am a graphic designer of trade and just cant sit still!
My campagne is to both broaden my skillset as make Fuddly store bigger; I wanted to have my own designs printed on T-shirts and such, but... Everywhere i went I'd either had to buy 1000+ shirts (1color, 1 design) or 1 shirt would be 25 euro without shipping. Fuddly is about fun, making people happy with affordable gear!
Thus I remembered something ive done once in my life; Screen printing: It's cheap, can be used on almost every material and I can do it close to my hometown! But I need to go through 3 training courses which will cost me over 300 euro excl. print-costs; I have 200 euro set aside for t-shirts, screenprint paint and other stuff, but I dont have the 300,- for the courses!
So YOU will be able to let Fuddly grow, YOU will be able to show your love and keep my business be affordable and YOU will be loved by me for ever!

What We Need & What You Get

Thus I need 500USD (roughly 350 euros) to fund my dream to get another skill to my skillset and make new products for you guys for an affordable price! 

The perks will be pretty sweet; running from your own design printed on a bag/shirt to a handmade plushie! 

If I dont reach my goal the money will go into a fund for me to get sewing lessons so I atleast can make my pillows and tails as cheap as possible for you guys! <o> Its Something

The Impact

It will be an easier (and cheaper) way to get your furry and pony gear; Ill be able to screenprint almost anything; From wood to fabric, from cartboard to skateboards! You name it! But it will also be cheaper than to have it done by a business as they have hour wages, start up prices and all the other stuff!
Good thing: I don't really do hour wages; I just add up like an euro or 4 up to my basic price and TADAAA! ;)

Other Ways You Can Help

So please! Even if you dont have money to spare, PLEASE get the word out; You will have my ever gratitude and I will give u some % off a quote if you ever find it in your heart to become part of the Fuddly Family <3

story:
Bonjour!!! Parlez-vous Francais?

                                           


WHO WE ARE

Crepes a Go-Go founder, Chef Serge-Patrick was raised in Belgium and is a graduate of Johnson & Wales University in Denver, Colorado. He's passionate about food! Chef Serge is an aficionado of the French crepes and Liege waffles, a delectable food he was accustomed to eating back home.This chef's passion is to share his love for crepes with its Crepes a GO-GO customers. Every individual crepe is a masterpiece in itself, from simple Nutella/banana to mouth watering sausage and wild mushrooms. 

Chef Serge-Patrick diligently works on finding the best seasonal ingredients locally grown in a sustainable way. Crepes a GO-GO delivers a cuisine rooted in French culinary traditions  with local fruits and vegetables at their seasonal peak, thus creating food that tells their story with a contemporary twist.

             The Crepes a GO-GO Team Welcomes Chef Christopher Bennett!

Chef Christopher, a Denver native, hails from Vermont's prestigious New England Culinary Institute. He is a seasoned culinary professional with over 12 years in the industry. This included stints with downtown Denver's Rioja and Bistro Vendome. He also ventured to Las Vegas where he worked under Michelin rated Chef Daniel Boulud.

In November 2014, Chef Christopher represented Denver in a Chef Exchange to Brest France, where he received one-on-one instructions on the intricacies of preparing the traditional French macaron and other French regional dishes under the tutelage of Executive Chef Alain Plassard.

Chef Christopher draws his culinary inspirations from personal experiences while traveling  throughout  Europe as well as time spent working with the best chefs in the industry.

Now, he is ready to take the next step in his culinary adventure, and looks forward to bringing you along for the ride.

Our chefs combine the freshest local products with precise culinary techniques to create the finest authentic gourmet sweet and savory crepes outside of France! We think you’ll agree that they are the most delicious crepes this side of the Atlantic!”

OUR HUMBLE BEGINNING:

During the past few years Crepes a Go-Go Creperie has frequented Farmers markets and cultural festivals throughout the mountains and plains of Colorado.

Because of the overwhelming support of our customer base we deemed it necessary to expand our successful creperie to a bistro in Golden, Colorado.

WHY GOLDEN?

Picturesque Golden, Colorado, nestled at the base of the Rocky Mountains was established as a gold rush town in 1859. In those days it was known as “The Gateway to the West,” and today it remains a popular gateway to outdoor adventures: biking, fly fishing, hiking, kayaking and paragliding. Home to Colorado School of Mines, the 2014 top engineering school in the country, Golden is also the home of MillerCoors Brewery, plus a number of small craft brewers such as Mountain Toad Brewing, Golden City Brewery, and the award-winning Cannonball Creek Brewing Company. Golden is also one of the Denver metro area’s best-kept dining secrets, with a main street lined with a variety of great restaurants catering to all tastes and pocketbooks … and soon it will be the home of Crepes a GO-GO!

THE GOLDEN COMMUNITY:

 The reason we decided to open Crepes a GO-GO in Golden was it’s sense of community, walkable environment, getaway destination, close proximity to outdoor activities, and young, educated demographic.

 

               Our Great fans: Soccer team Colorado School of Mines

"We are two chefs passionate about food and without large investors. This new restaurant is the biggest investment and risk we have ever undertaken. We can only do so much on our own. That's why we are asking for your help."

                                 BRICK AND MORTAR LOCATION

After few amazing years on the farmers market circuit, it was necessary for Crepes a GO-GO to look for a new home. We want to be able to continue sharing our passion for food, to serve our clients and our new Golden community.

Here are some of the reasons we are so excited to move to a brick and mortar in downtown Golden:

  • We want to keep making crepes all year around for our regular and guests.
  • Time and time again you have asked “Where can we find you?”  Now, whenever you have a craving for some amazing French crepes you'll know where to find us
  • With a well-equipped contemporary kitchen, we can upgrade the Crepes a GO-GO menu; thus affording Chefs Serge and Chris an opportunity to express themselves with amazing new options, which will include brunch on our romantic mosaic terrace on Saturdays and Sundays.
  • Crepes a GO-GO will offer a vast assortment of international wines as well as the renowned craft beer brewed right here in Golden, Colorado.
  • Crepes a Go-Go will host a myriad of events showcasing chefs, artists, and musicians from around the globe. 

  • Patrons will occasionally be invited to enjoy a French dining experience showcasing cuisine created by visiting chefs.”

                                   BE PART OF THE DREAM

Wonderful things are happening in Golden and we need your support to bring our dream to fruition. Crepes a Go-Go requires approximately $300,000 to open the doors of its new home in Golden, Colorado's historic Downtown district.  2/3 of required capital is been secured through savings, loans, and angel investors. We request your support to raise the remaining amount required to add the following finishing touches to this classy upscale French bistro:
  • State-of- the- art- kitchen equipment so Chef Christopher and Chef Serge can  offer amazing crepes discovered during their escapades around the world.
  • Beautiful lighting  for a touch of Parisian flare with intriguing interior designs.
  • A modern sound system so you can enjoy being serenaded by contemporary French artists, including classic songs from Montand, Piaf and more.
  • Patio furnishings for comfortable dining on our 30-seat terrace.
  • An elegant lounge in which to sit back, relax, and enjoy a cup of our out- of- this- world Cafe Liegeois.

                       Our new home under construction in downtown Golden, CO

            FOOD IS WHO WE ARE 

       & 

         FOOD IS WHAT WE LOVE:

                    Strawberry banana with Nutella    

                                       Chef Christopher's creative touch on a consume


   Contribute to our campaign and enjoy the perks! Help us get the word out and share this with your friends !

 

                                      Sharing the love for Crepes a GO-GO
story_txt:
Bonjour!!! Parlez-vous Francais?                                           WHO WE ARECrepes a Go-Go founder, Chef Serge-Patrick was raised in Belgium and is a graduate of Johnson & Wales University in Denver, Colorado. He's passionate about food! Chef Serge is an aficionado of the French crepes and Liege waffles, a delectable food he was accustomed to eating back home.This chef's passion is to share his love for crepes with its Crepes a GO-GO customers. Every individual crepe is a masterpiece in itself, from simple Nutella/banana to mouth watering sausage and wild mushrooms. Chef Serge-Patrick diligently works on finding the best
seasonal ingredients locally grown in a sustainable way. Crepes a GO-GO
delivers a cuisine rooted in French culinary traditions  with local fruits and
vegetables at their seasonal peak, thus creating food that tells their story with a
contemporary twist.             The Crepes a GO-GO Team Welcomes Chef Christopher Bennett!Chef Christopher, a Denver native, hails from Vermont's prestigious New England Culinary Institute. He is a seasoned culinary professional with over 12 years in the industry. This included stints with downtown Denver's Rioja and Bistro Vendome. He also ventured to Las Vegas where he worked under Michelin rated Chef Daniel Boulud.In November 2014, Chef Christopher represented Denver in a Chef Exchange to Brest France, where he received one-on-one instructions on the intricacies of preparing the traditional French macaron and other French regional dishes under the tutelage of Executive Chef Alain Plassard.Chef Christopher draws his culinary inspirations from personal experiences while traveling  throughout  Europe as well as time spent working with the best chefs in the industry.
Now, he is
ready to take the next step in his culinary adventure, and looks forward to
bringing you along for the ride.

Our chefs combine the freshest local products with precise culinary techniques to create the finest authentic gourmet sweet and savory crepes outside of France! We think you’ll agree that they are the most delicious crepes this side of the Atlantic!”OUR HUMBLE BEGINNING:During the past few years Crepes a Go-Go Creperie has frequented Farmers markets and cultural festivals throughout the mountains and plains of Colorado.Because of the overwhelming support of our customer base we deemed it necessary to expand our successful creperie to a bistro in Golden, Colorado.WHY GOLDEN?Picturesque Golden, Colorado, nestled at the base of the Rocky Mountains was established as a gold rush town in 1859. In those days it was known as “The Gateway to the West,” and today it remains a popular gateway to outdoor adventures: biking, fly fishing, hiking, kayaking and paragliding. Home to Colorado School of Mines, the 2014 top engineering school in the country, Golden is also the home of MillerCoors Brewery, plus a number of small craft brewers such as Mountain Toad Brewing, Golden City Brewery, and the award-winning Cannonball Creek Brewing Company. Golden is also one of the Denver metro area’s best-kept dining secrets, with a main street lined with a variety of great restaurants catering to all tastes and pocketbooks … and soon it will be the home of Crepes a GO-GO!THE GOLDEN COMMUNITY: The reason we decided to open Crepes a GO-GO in Golden was it’s sense of community, walkable environment, getaway destination, close proximity to outdoor activities, and young, educated demographic.                Our Great fans: Soccer team Colorado School of Mines"We are two chefs passionate about food and without large investors. This new restaurant is the biggest investment and risk we have ever undertaken. We can only do so much on our own. That's why we are asking for your help."                                 BRICK AND MORTAR LOCATIONAfter few amazing years on the
farmers market circuit, it was necessary for Crepes a GO-GO to look for a new
home. We want to be able to continue sharing our passion for food, to serve our
clients and our new Golden community.
Here are some of the reasons we are
so excited to move to a brick and mortar in downtown Golden:

We want to keep making crepes all year around for our regular and guests.
Time and time again you have asked “Where can we find you?”  Now, whenever you have a craving for some amazing French crepes you'll know where to find us

With a well-equipped contemporary kitchen, we can upgrade the Crepes a GO-GO menu; thus affording Chefs Serge and Chris an opportunity to express themselves with amazing new options, which will include brunch on our romantic mosaic terrace on Saturdays and Sundays.

Crepes a Go-Go will host a myriad of events showcasing

Patrons will occasionally be invited to enjoy a French dining experience showcasing cuisine created by visiting chefs.”

State-of- the- art- kitchen equipment so Chef Christopher and Chef Serge can  offer amazing crepes discovered during their escapades around the world.

 modern sound system so you can enjoy being serenaded by contemporary

Patio furnishings for comfortable dining on our 30-seat terrace.
