story:
Request and Forget is a tasks fulfillment app and website that seeks to bring people together, to get their projects done at the earliest time possible at the highest quality.

It aims to revolutionize the service industry allowing Requester (individuals, corporations and non-profit organizations) a platform to request help to complete their projects and daily tasks.

Requesters and Providers will be able to help one another collaborate on a single task or entire projects no matter where they are in the world, and can track each project’s progress through the website or via the mobile app. Unlike other outsourcing services in the market which cater only to digital outsourcing services, Request and Forget also opens the door to new local opportunities, such as maid and nanny services, gardening, home renovation, etc. using GPS support.

Either party can offer and/or accept tasks for an agreed price or complete tasks for free and help people, charities and new projects. 

All financial aspects and auditing of the tasks will be handle seamlessly by the Request and Forget system.

Traveling and doing business abroad
Visiting or settling in a new country is not easy, but with Request and Forget, you would be able to Request an interpreter or a guide as you arrive at the airport, or even before you arrive by requesting the task at your destination, and Providers will respond to you.

House chores
I need help with house chores, how can I find someone quickly?  With my Request & Forget app, I could simply add a Request for one and a suitable Provider in my area will come to me.

Non-Profit Organization and Projects
I need help with my project but can’t afford to pay for it, I could use Request and Forget app to get help for free. The Providers who like my project can join me voluntarily, the experience itself can be rewarding, and they also gain other things from Request and Forget rewarding system.


IMPORTANT NOTE:To make sure that you benefit fully from these perks, you will have two years to take advantage of them.  That way you can wait to be established before availing yourself of this portion of the perk and save even more money with the transaction fees and increase your revenue by getting ahead of the pack when it matters.

The outsourcing will be contracted to Provider Backers in priority, than active Providers (if needed).  If we don’t have anyone to fulfill your request at the beginning, our team will do it for you.

These amounts can be use for online services such as: data entry, proofreading, ghost writing, website design, graphic and artwork, online marketing campaigns, social media management, programming, app design and similar services.  It can also be use for telemarketing, accounting and many other such services.

The outsourcing will be provided by our house team of dedicated employees to insure work flow. For assistance, we will use Provider Backers in priority, than active Providers (if needed).

The employees will be supervised at our offices and you will have access to them directly.  The Request and Forget system of team  work will be used.  Unless you want a focal point single employee. We’ll discuss it after the campaign is completed

We are supplying all the equipment; computers, cameras, software and monthly subscription to the Internet and hundreds of dollars in SEO, graphic and office software.

You will get your reward as soon as we confirm the pledge payment.

The employees and offices are located in Manila. Philippines.  But, you will be able to contact both the staff in the Philippines and in the United States at anytime via Skype, email or conventional telephone.

 

   Automatic mode
Just submit a task in automatic mode and forget about it until it is completed.  A Monitor will insure that the task is distributed to the right Provider.  When completed, the Monitor will review the task, make sure it is done according to your guidelines and send it to you.  If it is to your liking, no further actions are necessary.
 


   Manual mode
The manual mode doesn’t mean that you will have to do everything by yourself.  All you need to do in that mode is to list the tasks you want done and let the system find the right Providers for you.  All you will need to do is select the Provider from a list of best candidates and confirm that the work is done to your liking ones completed.
    Gamification

If generosity is not enough to entice people to complete tasks for free, we have wrote a gamification program using achievements, badges and rewards.  The rewards will help Providers to increase their levels, which in term will allow them to be selected first for paid tasks.  Security mode are coded to prevent “farming” and cheating.
 

   Task Monitoring

In the automatic mode the monitoring will be done by Providers that will earn a percentage of each paid tasks or they will be able to do it for free and earn credits, badges and help the causes they like.
 

   Task Cycling

Work abandonment is a common concern with online outsourcing.  If it happens, the app would cycle the task to the next professional on queue to see it done.  This happens automatically after a lull-activity period (defined as zero progress at all for your project) for two consecutive days, or earlier if the Provider formally issued a job cessation notice.  In either case, the Provider in question may not receive the agreed payment for the task and/or be penalized with a demerit in the reputation system.





Who are the Requesters?

Requesters generally fall into three categories:

1)  Individuals that are looking for local tasks,

2)  Internet entrepreneurs that want instant outsourcing at an affordable price, and

3)  Corporations that need a rapid influx of outsourcing staff for projects and virtual assistant with management.

Who are the Providers?

Providers are highly competent service professionals who use Request and Forget as their platform to reach out to potential clients that can benefit from their chosen field of expertise.  These can be local Providers, such as a gardeners, maids, babysitters in your area, or international virtual Providers, such as programmers, virtual assistance, website designs etc…  They can also be people that want to connect and help others succeed their projects, volunteer to help organizations and individuals in need.

Why become a Provider?

Providers can make money by helping Requesters complete their tasks for a set amount.  It’s also a great avenue to display one’s portfolio, particularly if a Provider is in the field of design or graphic arts.  If a Provider wishes, he can also opt to offer his services for free[MNM1] .

How to profit as a Provider?

There are several ways to make extra income as a Provider:

1.  Make yourself available to accept local tasks

2.  Accept the tasks that the system will attribute to you

3.  Look on the Board for request that have no categories

How is the selection of Providers accomplished?

Anyone can become a Provider.  However, to increase in level and to ensure that you are consistently prioritized for requested tasks, we have established a system of achievements, rewards, badges and auditing in terms of monitoring of the quality of services rendered.  The higher your Provider Level, the higher you will be placed in the job priority queue and the more people will trust you.

Can we negotiate the price?

Yes you can, particularly if you’re a local Provider.  For outsourced Providers, the prices are based on the national average of each country to give you a baseline when selecting your Provider.  You can find more details in the videos (title)

Can I request a task even if there are no Service Providers in that category?

Yes, there will be a separate wall that will be populated by tasks that have no Providers or Categories at the moment of the request.

How are the jobs distributed?

The priority will be given by the CAR rating of the Provider, which utilizes an algorithm that analyzes achievements, badges, special Backers rewards and the quality of the service provided.

What if I want to wait for certain service Providers to do my work?

The system is designed to give both the Requesters and the Providers the freedom to accept and refuse to work with one another.  You can add people to your favorite list or blocked list.  The algorithm is design to match up Requesters and Providers that have worked together in the past.  That will help increase job efficiency as people start to know each other.

How can I increase my limit of work and level?

The higher your level, the more jobs you will get.  Do free work when you have time, and increase your achievements and earn badges.  It may sound like a game, because it is.  Gamification is the way of the future and Request and Forget is taking this route as well.  After the launch, we will have a complete video series on how to increase your revenues using R&F.

What are the payment methods in R&F?

Credit card, PayPal and Wire transfer

I’m having an issue with a request I have made, what should I do?

First, message the Provider and see if he can fix it.  If you still have problems, you can open a ticket by pressing the Resolution button.  Your case will be analyzed and a solution will be mediated on a case by case basis.

My order is delivered but it’s not what I wanted or I’m not satisfied with the quality of the work.

First, message the Provider and see if he can fix it.  If you still have problems, you can open a ticket by pressing the Resolution button.  Your case will be analyzed and a solution will be mediated on a case by case basis.

I like what the Provider sent me and I want to complete the order and pay the seller, how is that done?

At the bottom of the message you have received informing you that the job was completed, there is a button titled “Order completed.”  Tap or click on it to begin the payment process and the reward distribution, as well as the feedback process.

I made a request by mistake?

If the work has not been accepted by a provider yet, you can request a cancellation at any time.  As a safeguard against accidental work assignments or job postings, you need to have approved the request two times:  Once when you post the request and a second time when you agreed on the selection of the Provider (manual mode).  If you made a mistake of this nature nevertheless (you requested your task in Automatic mode or had the confirmation feature disabled), you may request a one-time refund.

How do I cancel a request?

All you have to do is to press Cancel on the other page.  If the task has not begun, it will be canceled without any problems.

What if I have issues with more than one request?

If the problem is technical, please open a ticket.  If it is with a Provider, each request needs to be handled separately using the Resolution function.

How do I create a work ad?

Request and Forget does not use work ads unlike other sites.  Tasks are distributed using a proprietary algorithm.  Requesters will be able to see your profile, achievements, badges and levels.  That will help them determine if they want you to be their Provider.

Do I have to complete the profile page?

No.  However, you can add information to your profile if you desire.  Complete profile pages would rank higher in the priority queue, however, in contrast to incomplete ones.  Completing the profile page also sends a message to both Requesters and Providers that you can be trusted.

I just got a request and I did it, how do I get paid?

Once you have pressed the Complete button, the Requester will receive the notification.  If you have a high-enough level, the payment will be made immediately.


With a great app comes great responsibility.  The risks for the backers will be limited as the app is relatively straightforward to program.  All the elements are available and our team has years of experience in programming and in the outsourcing sector.  Regardless, we have contingency plans in place in case of any untoward delays or force majeure scenarios that may affect the campaign.  We’d have to collectively agree that none of us want to spend time receiving emails about updates and delays.  Hence, if we discover that a particular issue will result in a significant delay, our team will start fulfilling your incentive by allowing you to use our website as a launch pad for your project until the app is ready.  Support our campaign and we will make sure that you will get your incentive as fast as possible using any methods of communications at our disposal. 

When we started developing the App for Request and Forget, we knew immediately that we would be launching on Indiegogo.  Our vision is to help every person on the planet get their tasks and help their need quickly and in an all new way – and we want to share Request and Forget with all of you.

So back Request and Forget today and turn your dreams into reality!

  second time when you agreed on the selection of the Provider (manual
  mode).  If you made a mistake of this
  nature nevertheless (you requested your task in Automatic mode or had the
  confirmation feature disabled), you may request a one-time refund.




How
  do I cancel a request?


All you have to do is to press Cancel
  on the other page.  If the task has not
  begun, it will be canceled without any problems.




What
  if I have issues with more than one request?


If the problem is technical, please open
  a ticket.  If it is with a Provider,
  each request needs to be handled separately using the Resolution function.




How
  do I create a work ad?


Request and Forget does not use work ads unlike
  other sites.  Tasks are distributed
  using a proprietary algorithm. 
  Requesters will be able to see your profile, achievements, badges and
  levels.  That will help them determine
  if they want you to be their Provider.




Do
  I have to complete the profile page?


No. 
  However, you can add information to your profile if you desire.  Complete profile pages would rank higher in
  the priority queue, however, in contrast to incomplete ones.  Completing the profile page also sends a
  message to both Requesters and Providers that you can be trusted.




I
  just got a request and I did it, how do I get paid?


Once you have pressed the Complete
  button, the Requester will receive the notification.  If you have a high-enough level, the
  payment will be made immediately.





With a great app comes great
responsibility.  The risks for the
backers will be limited as the app is relatively straightforward to program.  All the elements are available and our team
has years of experience in programming and in the outsourcing sector.  Regardless, we have contingency plans in
place in case of any untoward delays or force majeure scenarios that may affect
the campaign.  We’d have to collectively
agree that none of us want to spend time receiving emails about updates and
delays.  Hence, if we discover that a
particular issue will result in a significant delay, our team will start
fulfilling your incentive by allowing you to use our website as a launch pad for
your project until the app is ready.  Support
our campaign and we will make sure that you will get your incentive as fast as
possible using any methods of communications at our disposal. When we started developing the App for Request and Forget, we knew
immediately that we would be launching on Indiegogo.  Our vision is to help every person on the
planet get their tasks and help their need quickly and in an all new way – and
we want to share Request and Forget with all of you.
So back Request and Forget today and turn your dreams into reality!

story:
The Idea:

Take an award-winning journalist from Minnesota, a successful businessman from North Carolina, and a free spirit from... well, everywhere, and put them in a ridiculously unsuitable car for a 10,000-mile journey across countries you haven't even heard of. What could go wrong?

What is the Mongol Rally:

Remember when maps had edges? When there wasn't a way to instantly get a photo of some remote location? The Adventurists Group does. So, in 2004, they founded what seems to be a stupid idea - drive from London to Ulaan Baataar, Mongolia, in a car your 16 year old can afford to buy on their own. The object isn't to finish first (you will be mocked!), but to finish with the best stories. 

Teams depart from London on July 19 and, barring breakdowns and catastrophes, are expected to arrive in Ulaan Uud by mid-to-late August. The Adventurists proclaim only three very simple rules for the Mongol Rally:

  1. Teams must only drive a comically inappropriate car with an engine smaller than 1 liter.
  2. Teams are completely and utterly on their own on the road without any backup.
  3. Each team must raise at least £1000 for charity.

The Impact and Cause:

The Baked Potatoes are driving across two continents to raise awareness for the Nampa Family Justice Center. The center is a partnership of agencies dedicated to ending family violence and sexual assault through prevention and response by providing comprehensive, client-centered services in a single location.

The Baked Potatoes are proud to have them as our fundraising partner. A portion of the money donated will be presented as direct funding to the Family Justice Center (FJC) and the remaining will be used to fund the trip, which will help raise awareness both locally and internationally

Cool Earth is the official charity of the Mongol Rally. A portion of our donated funds will go to this charity, which works alongside indigenous villages to
halt rainforest destruction. See more about Cool Earth here

Who We Are:

Jennifer: "Navigator"


John: "Communications Officer"


Brad: "Hospitality Director"


What We Need & What You Get 

We need to raise $15,000 for our team to make this trek. A portion of that will donated to our two charities, plus we will work to create awareness for the Family Justice Center both in advertising as well as global awareness.

Do you want to participate? Donate a little money and get a perk! 

Questions?

email jennifer@paintnsip.com

story:
Scientists tell us that WE, of planet Earth, have 10 years to change the way we live.  

The Wisdom Preserve is building a solution on a small slice of heaven on earth in Jamaica. 

*Certified by the Rural Agricultural Development Authority of Jamaica

Our Mission

To strengthen and transform community by empowering local families to revitalize their farming and well being practices with a strong emphasis on inspiring youth.

Ancestral land


The project has 3 phases…

_____________________________________________

This campaign is Phase 1:  Goal $25,000


Phase 1. Get established on the land and open for business and introducing educational programs in...  

> sustainable off-grid living                                                             

> organic farming                                                                         > wholistic living                                                                            > music (music helps plants grow)

What will we accomplish in Phase 1

> Clear and level the land - creates immediate jobs

> Set up temporary headquarters to implement youth programs and building planning

> Continue tilling the land

________________________________________________

Phase 2. Construct a Biotecture*  Earthship: building for the Cultural Center Should We Reach Our Stretch Goal of $150,000.

                                                   

Actual Phase 2 Earthship model   

*biotecture - earthship: the epitome of a sustainable, hurricane & earthquake proof, off grid construction using recycled materials

_______________________________________________

Phase 3. Develop eco-tourism and expand program facilities can happen if we hit our $200,000 stretch goal.                


Long term projections:

> Build an earthship on the property 

> Yield consistent wholesome organic crops

> Open a fair trade Farmer's Market

> Raise the frequency of the community creating wholeness and balance  

> Use wholistic resources to address current health issues on the island                                                                    

> Start a student exchange program                                    

> Preserve the rich Jamaican culture.                                  

> Cultural Center - Lectures, concerts and workshops  

> Wholistic Retreats                                                                            

 _________________________________________________

The Wisdom Preserve Stewardship

Stephen Katriel & Empress Thandi Wise


Queen Mother Diddi Colquhoune

story:
Who we are

What do a retired soldier, a fashion designer and a very creative idea man have in common?  Well, beer naturally!  Sacramento has the reputation for being the farm to table capital of the United States, and we want to carry on that idea with awesome local, West Coast craft beers.  Act global, drink local!

We are opening a taproom in Midtown Sacramento featuring 16 carefully selected craft beers from the West Coast, including at least two EXCLUSIVE brews that can only be found in our bar.  One of those beers boasts a two time first place prize from the California State Fair.  Not bad huh?

Beyond the taproom, we will have upwards of 300 different craft beers for sale.  We find it ridiculous that with so many amazing craft beers out there, that when we go to other liquor stores they always have the same selection.  The people deserve better!

I have personally served my country and now want to settle down and start my own business.  It's something I am passionate about, and have always wanted to do.  My father ran a very successful bar while I was growing up and now I'd like to take what I learned from him and create a taproom where people can come in, relax, and sample the best the West Coast has to offer, without the snobbery.  As a Veteran owned and operated business, we hope to have events that raise money and awareness to help out other vets in need.  

We need your help to accomplish our dream because licenses, fees, legal stuff and equipment don't come cheap.  We have put together a nice little list of perks that we feel you will enjoy. 


What We Need & What You Get

So as we said before, things don't come cheap.  Red tape is expensive and that's where we need your help.  We are in the midst of filling out paperwork all over the place, creating a website, and beginning to acquire equipment.  The funds that you contribute will go directly to these things.  If we exceed our target goal, then we will use those funds to really make the place nice!  We are very hands-on people, and we plan on doing the bulk of the work ourselves.  We like to consider ourselves creative and so we plan on creating a really comfortable, relaxing and friendly atmosphere for you and your friends to hang out at and socialize over some very tasty beers.

But you don't want to hear about what we need.  What's in it for you???

We have come up with some fun and interesting perks that we feel you will be into. 

The first few involve shout outs.  You are important to us, no matter how small the contribution.  We want you to know that, and we want the world to know it as well.  We will express our gratitude by mentioning you on our website, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. 

Next we have our Brü Co limited edition Founder's pint glass.  They will feature the Brü Co logo and the word "Founder" on them.



**JUST ADDED** 
Your very own brü co bottle opener made from once fired .50 caliber bullets!  Look like a bad ass popping your beers open with this bad boy!  Perfect gift for the military friend in your life!




Founder's bricks will have your name engraved into them, and then will be stacked up and topped with our bar top.  Thats right, you can come hang out at the taproom and show off your name etched in right there at the bar.

Next up, for those who like to party, and be a part of something exclusive, we will host a pre-opening party where you can come with a friend and enjoy live music, food, door prizes and of course delicious craft beer.  Must be 21 or over to attend, because we don't want to start our adventure off by being arrested…

You really want to be a boss?  Ok, then we will offer five bar stools up to be engraved with your name.  Whenever you come see us, that stool is your right.  Someone sitting in it?  No problem, we'll ask them to relocate.  Must be 21 or over for this bad-ass opportunity.

Ok, ok.  We've talked about stuff, but what is this really about?  BEER!  How about beer for life?  Yes!  Our level 1 beer for life program offers you one free beer per month FOR LIFE!  We'll have your name programmed into our computer.  You show up with your ID and ask the bartender for a beer, and it's yours!  Must be 21 or over - obviously - and the free beer is non transferrable.  For on-site consumption only, and they are not bankable.  If you miss a month, that's a bummer, but no worries, there will always be the next month.  Tips to our bartenders are not included with the free beer.  Level 2 is the same, but you get one beer per week.

Level Boss is for the serious beer drinker.  One free beer per day, FOR LIFE!  Same conditions apply as with levels 1 & 2, except you can come in EVERY SINGLE DAY we are open and have a different craft beer.  Not that you have to have a different one.  If you're a creature of habit and want the same thing every day forever, well then you are absolutely welcome to.  

Lastly, we are offering up the chance for you to have a private party in our taproom for you and 50 of your closest friends.  We will provide the music, food, and beer of course; you provide the guest list.  All party goers must be 21 or over.  We will coordinate the details with you should you be one of the very generous and lucky individuals to get this perk.

We hope that these perks make you nod your head, say hell yeah, and maybe even let a loud 'Murica escape your lips.  If a bald eagle happens to fly real close to you, go ahead and give that bad boy a patriotic high five!  

In all seriousness, we wholeheartedly are grateful to all of you, and we can't wait to share our dream with you and keep you updated on our progress.  If you can't donate, you can always help us out by getting the word out there and sharing this campaign with your friends.  

If you're not from around here, but like the idea, please feel free to help us out as well.  We can always take a picture of your brick or barstool and send it to you.  If you are in the area, come on down, say hi, and have a beer with us. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with your entourage.  We will be forever grateful to you.  If beer is not your thing, then maybe make a small contribution to a Veteran's organization:

www.woundedwarriorproject.org

www.alphaK9.org


Cheers friends!

Justin

story:
Our dream started out as a market farming project in the beautiful rolling hills of the Laurel Highlands in south western Pennsylvania and has blossomed into  Appalachian Juice Co. and The Mountain Family Farm.  We are currently operating a raw organic juice bar out of the lovely Pittsburgh borough of Shadyside, and are working on plans to develop our own farm land.  Our dream encompasses many different projects that are reliant on each other to create a company that helps many individuals as well as creates a positive change in many farming and business practices.  The different branches of our company support each other and grow as the business as a whole grows.

With this project we are aiming to expand our juice from retail to wholesale, as well as develop our own sustainable chemical free farm. We started the juice company after noticing many shortcomings to the current methods of production and distribution in our region and abroad. Surrounded by farmland we found it frustrating that our access to affordable produce grown sustainably and chemical free was little to none. Trying to convince farmers to change practices is no easy task. We decided we needed to provide an economic incentive to encourage conversion to sustainable practices.  Rather than wait for one to appear we chose to create it ourselves. This is where our raw organic cold-pressed juice was created.

Cold pressed juice is one of the best nutrient delivery systems devised by man as well as adding a level of convenience and accessibility to produce and fruit, in turn making it more consumable and marketable. This presented itself to us as an amazing opportunity to develop our own farming further, while also providing us with the needed resources and outlets to support other local farmers, in particular veterans.

One key aspect of our juice company and its farm, The Mountain Family Farm, is that we will use our proceeds after operation to further two very necessary agriculture projects.

Project One will be to cultivate our network of local veterans and organizations and create a multi-purpose veteran outreach program primarily focusing on training veterans in sustainable chemical free farming. This will range from small weekend workshops in gardening and farming, to fully integrated job training and placement. Ultimately the goal of the company is to train local vets in our method of farming, assist them in acquiring land to farm and providing them with purchasing agreements through the juice company. In doing this we believe it will spur the next generation of farming in our region. Currently there are over 300 million people in our country today and only 150,000 of the farmers who feed them are under the age of 35. The average age of the US farmer is nearly 60 years old. With population increasing at it's current rate we are going to need some fresh blood in there soon or things will start to look dicey here in a few years. As our program develops we hope to interact with local schools to develop on site 4 season greenhouses that the children can work out of and learn the basics of gardening and food production as well as provide them with a reliable affordable source of healthy food. 

Project Two is our season extension research. We have been researching and developing a wide variety practices and implementations to allow local producers to extend their growing season well into the harsher portions of our seasons. Our designs are crafted to not only be as cheap as possible to construct but also to allow for maximum production out of a relatively small space. We have combined the theories of passive an active solar heating with raised bed, square foot, and straw mulch methods. We will also be developing an array of composting methods to sustainably feed our soil and plants. These will include local community composting, composting with local businesses, vermiculture, and both hot and cold methods of composting. We believe this system of growing will allow for a longer season of production with higher yields for less cost. We believe this will invariably lead to cheaper prices to the consumer and well as a strengthened industry that can meet the needs of consumers year round.  

Why Local?

Most food travels several thousand miles before it reaches your plate. This not only leaves consumers vulnerable to price inflation due to other economic factors such as the price of oil, but it also places an undo amount of stress on our ecosystems to produce and distribute food in this manner. By localizing food supplies(250 miles) you reduce the overall impact we have as a society on the rest of the world.

Why Chemical Free?

While some proponents of big agri-business will argue that chemical pesticide, herbicide, and fertilizer use is safe, we at Appalachian Juice Co. have developed the opinion that they are harmful to not only our bodies, but also the environment, from which we so greatly rely on to grow our food. We also feel that by utilizing some old and new age techniques of chemical free, sustainable farming  we can grow a better product for less. 

Why Vets?

I became a veteran because an unnerving sense of duty that was passed on to me from several generations of soldiers before me bearing my last name. This trait is one of the most common among the veteran community. Selfless service, duty, and honor and just a few of the ethos a soldier swears to embody. Many vets returning home from war are bearing a variety of injuries, some more visible than others. These challenges can become overwhelming when coupled with economic factors like a lack of employment, but more so a lack of fulfilling employment. A secure food supply being the need it is to a community offers the returning veteran an amazing opportunity to continue to serve their community even after their official service has ended. All of these factors make developing this subset of the community into our next generation of farmers the most viable option we have while also maximizing the positive effect we hope to have on our community.

By developing our wholesale expansion in conjunction with our farm we can have an immediate impact on our communities food supply, workforce, and overall well being. For this crowd-funding project we have allotted money for both our wholesale expansion as well as our farm. 

Budget: 

Wholesale Licensing-                          $15,000.00

Four Row Seeder-                                $4,000.00 

Three Point Tiller-                                 $2,000.00

Raised Bed Disc Hiller-                            $500.00

Spreaders(seed/manure)-                     $1,500.00

Compost House Lumber-                      $1,000.00

Seed-                                                     $5,000.00

Greenhouse-                                          $6,000.00

Irrigation                                                 $2,000.00

Other                                                      $3,000.00

Total                                                      $40,000.00 

This encompasses only our bare necessities. There are still many tens of thousands that will need to be spent in developing this project to fruition. These resources will give us the essential tools to complete our wholesale transition and develop our farm and veterans outreach programs. All business plans have been completed by an MBA and are awaiting implementation.

Our Promise:

We promise to continue our business's development with the health of our environment locally and abroad, as well as the health of our product and how it relates to the health of our customers, as our number one priority. 

In summation...  Juice Induced Harmony.
story_txt: Our dream started out as a market farming project in the beautiful rolling hills of the Laurel Highlands in south western Pennsylvania and has blossomed into  Appalachian Juice Co. and The Mountain Family Farm.  We are currently operating a raw organic juice bar out of the lovely Pittsburgh borough of Shadyside, and are working on plans to develop our own farm land.  Our dream encompasses many different projects that are reliant on each other to create a company that helps many individuals as well as creates a positive change in many farming and business practices.  The different branches of our company support each other and grow as the business as a whole grows.With this project we are aiming to expand our juice from retail to wholesale, as well as develop our own sustainable chemical free farm. We started the juice company after noticing many shortcomings to the current methods of production and distribution in our region and abroad. Surrounded by farmland we found it frustrating that our access to affordable produce grown sustainably and chemical free was little to none. Trying to convince farmers to change practices is no easy task. We decided we needed to provide an economic incentive to encourage conversion to sustainable practices.  Rather than wait for one to appear we chose to create it ourselves. This is where our raw organic cold-pressed juice was created.Cold pressed juice is one of the best nutrient delivery systems devised by man as well as adding a level of convenience and accessibility to produce and fruit, in turn making it more consumable and marketable. This presented itself to us as an amazing opportunity to develop our own farming further, while also providing us with the needed resources and outlets to support other local farmers, in particular veterans.One key aspect of our juice company and its farm, The Mountain Family Farm, is that we will use our proceeds after operation to further two very necessary agriculture projects.Project One will be to cultivate our network of local veterans and organizations and create a multi-purpose veteran outreach program primarily focusing on training veterans in sustainable chemical free farming. This will range from small weekend workshops in gardening and farming, to fully integrated job training and placement. Ultimately the goal of the company is to train local vets in our method of farming, assist them in acquiring land to farm and providing them with purchasing agreements through the juice company. In doing this we believe it will spur the next generation of farming in our region. Currently there are over 300 million people in our country today and only 150,000 of the farmers who feed them are under the age of 35. The average age of the US farmer is nearly 60 years old. With population increasing at it's current rate we are going to need some fresh blood in there soon or things will start to look dicey here in a few years. As our program develops we hope to interact with local schools to develop on site 4 season greenhouses that the children can work out of and learn the basics of gardening and food production as well as provide them with a reliable affordable source of healthy food. Project Two is our season extension research. We have been researching and developing a wide variety practices and implementations to allow local producers to extend their growing season well into the harsher portions of our seasons. Our designs are crafted to not only be as cheap as possible to construct but also to allow for maximum production out of a relatively small space. We have combined the theories of passive an active solar heating with raised bed, square foot, and straw mulch methods. We will also be developing an array of composting methods to sustainably feed our soil and plants. These will include local community composting, composting with local businesses, vermiculture, and both hot and cold methods of composting. We believe this system of growing will allow for a longer season of production with higher yields for less cost. We believe this will invariably lead to cheaper prices to the consumer and well as a strengthened industry that can meet the needs of consumers year round.  Why Local?Most food travels several thousand miles before it reaches your plate. This not only leaves consumers vulnerable to price inflation due to other economic factors such as the price of oil, but it also places an undo amount of stress on our ecosystems to produce and distribute food in this manner. By localizing food supplies(250 miles) you reduce the overall impact we have as a society on the rest of the world.Why Chemical Free?While some proponents of big agri-business will argue that chemical pesticide, herbicide, and fertilizer use is safe, we at Appalachian Juice Co. have developed the opinion that they are harmful to not only our bodies, but also the environment, from which we so greatly rely on to grow our food. We also feel that by utilizing some old and new age techniques of chemical free, sustainable farming  we can grow a better product for less. Why Vets?I became a veteran because an unnerving sense of duty that was passed on to me from several generations of soldiers before me bearing my last name. This trait is one of the most common among the veteran community. Selfless service, duty, and honor and just a few of the ethos a soldier swears to embody. Many vets returning home from war are bearing a variety of injuries, some more visible than others. These challenges can become overwhelming when coupled with economic factors like a lack of employment, but more so a lack of fulfilling employment. A secure food supply being the need it is to a community offers the returning veteran an amazing opportunity to continue to serve their community even after their official service has ended. All of these factors make developing this subset of the community into our next generation of farmers the most viable option we have while also maximizing the positive effect we hope to have on our community.By developing our wholesale expansion in conjunction with our farm we can have an immediate impact on our communities food supply, workforce, and overall well being. For this crowd-funding project we have allotted money for both our wholesale expansion as well as our farm. Budget: Wholesale Licensing-                          $15,000.00Four Row Seeder-                                $4,000.00 Three Point Tiller-                                 $2,000.00Raised Bed Disc Hiller-                            $500.00Spreaders(seed/manure)-                     $1,500.00Compost House Lumber-                      $1,000.00Seed-                                                     $5,000.00Greenhouse-                                          $6,000.00Irrigation                                                 $2,000.00Other                                                      $3,000.00Total                                                      $40,000.00 This encompasses only our bare necessities. There are still many tens of thousands that will need to be spent in developing this project to fruition. These resources will give us the essential tools to complete our wholesale transition and develop our farm and veterans outreach programs. All business plans have been completed by an MBA and are awaiting implementation.Our Promise:We promise to continue our business's development with the health of our environment locally and abroad, as well as the health of our product and how it relates to the health of our customers, as our number one priority. In summation...  Juice Induced Harmony.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Shaundra Stallworth, and I am a small business owner with a background in Tax preparation and planning, and public speaking. For as long as I could remember, I have had a passion for encouraging women who are in business or even have a thought of wanting to start a business, be the very best that they could possibly be. It is with that passion and desire to see other women succeed in business, that I am founding and currently in the process of forming a 501(c)3 organization named Woman of Worth Business Empowerment, Inc.

Several months ago, out of pure frustration with the direction of my own business and in what I considered was a lack of growth, It was divinely inspired that I plan a conference to help other women who may be struggling in their own businesses. Nervous and unsure of my capabilities of embarking on such a big event, I know that this is something that I MUST do and it is needed. It inspires and motivates me to see other women succeed in their businesses, and this event  will be the very platform to help women go from struggling in their business to becoming successful in their business.

    What We Need

    We need your help!! right now, this conference is being privately funded (out of my own pocket), But we need your assistance. I am requesting $25000 to get this conference going and every single donation will be used specifically for that purpose.  Hopefully, there will be money coming in from ticket sales, but every event planner knows that there are expenses that need to be paid prior to the event, so the money will be used for the venue, catering, the entertainment, advertising and marketing of the conference and other conference expenses as they occur.

    If I'm not able to reach my entire goal, I will continue to plan the conference because I believe that there is a purpose higher than myself and any contribution will definitely help relieve the stress and fear of not having enough money.

    Risks & Challenges

    When planning an event like this, there will always be some challenges along the way, even on the day of the event. The challenges that I face will be overcome by a plan B. My plan "B" will involve ensuring that plan "A" works. How will we do that? With a TEAM. The largest event I have ever planned was a family reunion, and the one thing I have learned while planning that event, was to have a team of people working with you. Every person that I will have working with me, has gifts and talents in different areas and together, we can all overcome any challenge faced.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

      Tell your friends about us! There is power in the virtual world of word of mouth. When you tell your community, and your friends tell their community, make sure to tell them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

      A personal thank you in advance to each and every contributor.

story:
Who are we?

We are Shopping Miracles, ltd., a bunch of like-minded individuals, who banded together to create something new, something that can make the lives of people more enjoyable. We are extremely happy for the opportunity to share our vision that Indiegogo offers because in order to see everything through we need your help. We need your financial support to cover the remaining development costs and make sure that the final product turns out exactly as envisioned and is not missing any features.

Our objectives

We are aiming to, with time, to improve the quality of life of society as a whole. We want to eliminate as much hassle associated with as possible – any person will be able to search for and buy whatever they want so much easier and completely for free and any seller will be able to quickly display his products and show how they look.  For this we are creating a smartphone app, the main point of which is to become the first step towards eliminating annoying and expensive advertisements that are plastered all over every corner of the street. It can be said that in the modern world advertising partially controls our lives – well it’s time for us to take control back in our own hands and decide what, where and when we want to see. Moreover, it will be much cheaper for all involved and the customization it offers will give both buyers and sellers the opportunity to buy and sell exactly what they want at the moment.  

                          Example of annoying and expensive advertisements

Our way is making advertising more personal and friendly

Our app functions as a map that displays discounted products. If a seller wants to sell something quick, he just needs to take a picture, enter some information and now his product is on the map, for all the users to see. Now a buyer just needs to look at the map and find something he wants to buy. He can click on a product to display additional information, like its usual and discounter price, direction to the shop, similar items and other things.

Who can benefit from it

It can really help you no matter who you are. If you are out shopping you can use it to see the deals you want to see and instantly know where to go. If you are selling something – running your own business or maybe even a small shop where you sell homemade products – you can make it known to the public around you. Plus, you can change the products on display almost instantly any time you want. The purpose of this app is to let sellers and buyers find each other. And it will be completely free for the customers and even the sellers will be able to sell their products WITHOUT PAYING A DIME.

Our actions:

а) For shoppers


b) To businesses

Package with a monthly subscription. Depending on the business’ needs and goals
we tailor our services to them. We can include an automatic change of product
on display depending on time or weather conditions, timed discounts, creation
of a landing page, an online shop, collection of statistics, such as number of
views and customer interest analysis. Furthermore, we physically advertise our
application near our client’s store. We offer people to download and try out
our app and at the same time to visit our client’s store and take advantage of
their promotions. We also offer free and discounted services so that every
store owner would be able to afford it. We are going for a low price and a
large number of users.

c) For creative people with different hobbies, who make non-commercial sales of handmade craft
For the people who create something in their free time as a hobby, we are offering our product for free. If in your spare time you make beautiful paintings, homemade crafts or other similar things, you will be able to show them to the people nearby. Shopping Miracles can become a valuable method of exposure among creative people by giving them the ability to earn some extra income by doing the things they love, and perhaps even motivating them to create something even more beautiful. Nearby shoppers will be able to instantly see their creations, come to their house, have a closer look and buy them. The purchasing process is different from online shopping, because while a person is shopping he can easily see other available products and does not need to go anywhere far to buy them. The interaction with the seller is much closer and personal.


Cashflow

Our unique selling points


i. An individual approach. We analyze businesses and tailor our packages directly for them with plenty of possibilities to customize them to suit their needs.

ii. Close connection between sellers and buyers. If a business suddenly runs out of shelf space for new goods, or has a large amount of perishable goods unsold, or, for example, has an almost full tour bus, it can easily change the price and announce it to everyone nearby. Information will instantly become visible to all users of the app within a pretty large distance from the point of sale.

iii. Money saving. Compared to other methods of adverting, ours is much cheaper, more automatic and technologically simple. 


People will be able to easily find bargains all around them, shops will be able to effectively sell the last remaining batch of clothes, perishable food or plane tickets and creative people will be able to advertise their art for free.


We feel that the world needs a better kind of advertising. 

The kind that doesn’t annoy the viewer with repeated pictures and constant phone calls. The kind that can disappear from sight at your command. The kind that doesn’t require thousands of pounds in investment so even a hobbyist who crafts sculptures out of wood at his home can use it to sell some of his creations if he wants. The kind that doesn’t use paper or other materials and can help make our world cleaner. Advertising is considered something that is used to persuade people to give up their money for something they don’t need. We want to change that, so that instead of persuading it just shows you what you need to know, and instead of buying the products you don’t need you buy something that you really need.

No need for sellers to put ads all over the place to attract customers!

What people think about us?

People want our idea to become a reality. We have spoken to our friends, family, neighbors, coworkers, university students, onlookers from our filming site, some random people from the streets and a business advisor about whether or not they would like to see our app in their lives. We have received very supporting answers from all but one person, who does not use smartphones. Everyone told us that they would definitely use such an application, considering that it will be free.

Why London?

We have decided that London would make an excellent starting point of introducing the application to the market – around 90% Londoners under the age of 30 regularly use smartphones and over half have used applications for the purpose of making purchases in recent years.

What do we hope from Indiegogo?

Our goal is set, but there is still work to be done. Currently we have a working prototype of our application. With your contributions we are hoping to turn it from this:

To something like this:

We will make sure that it is as convenient and user-friendly as possible and possibly add some additional helpful features. In addition after development has finished we will run promotional campaigns and give it out for free to all shoppers in order to make sure that buyers and sellers will find each other. Help us pave the road to a more enjoyable, hassle-free and money-saving way to shop.

story:
Who and Why?

Hi everybody, my name is Denis Sobnakov. I'm from Russia... actually the middle of Siberia... well the region around Lake Baikal to be exact, the oldest and the deepest freshwater lake in the world (it contains 20% of the world’s fresh water). I've been working with tourists from around the world as a tour guide for almost 10 years now. I show people the famous Trans-Siberian railway and the Trans-Mongolian route, Eastern Russia, China and of course my home region near Lake Baikal. 

In 2011 my wife and I opened a small indie hostel in the city of Ulan-Ude (centre of Russian Buddhism, 150 km from Lake Baikal). We called it Ulan Ude Travelers House and it’s aimed at adventurous travellers, backpackers who travel and explore and those who inspire others – and we have fun there, too. We've had great time with our guests (mostly English-speaking) these four seasons – we’ve  accommodated about 4000 travellers during this time. A high feedback rate on all booking sites (93%) indicates we’re doing something right.

Now...

...we have an idea to open another great indie hostel right on the shore of Lake Baikal. The great vibe and fun will be even better with the magic of the lake added into the mix. Tourists will have an amazing time exploring local area, taking hot springs and boat trips on the lake, hiking in the local forests and walking on the ice of the lake in winter time.

 


Where?

52°57'45.5"N 108°13'46.2"E

We've chosen a small fishing village called Turka located on the eastern shore of Lake Baikal. It is only 160km from Ulan-Ude  where all Trans-Siberian trains stop and easily accessible by public transport (two hours drive).

It is half way to famous the Barguzin Valley and Lake Baikal’s best bays, so people can go either direction. It is a tranquil and non-touristy place even in summer. You can experience real local life there.



What?

The main feature of the hostel is that we plan to build it out of a real used passenger train carriage.

 ->
(the picture to the right is actually taken from the internet)

Why not give it a new lease of life rather than just let it decay. It is recycling, reusing, giving a second life to something useful -  it's a green idea. And it would look just great.

The hostel will be environmentally friendly using green materials and heated in an efficient way. The train carriage will be fully refurbished inside to make it more comfortable.

Interior reconstruction 

Here is a 3D model showing how the inside will look.

The hostel will be able to accommodate up to 20 people. 8- and 12-bed dormitories will be created. 

Pricelist 
  • $10 per person per night for 12 bed dorm
  • $12,5 per person per night for 8 bed dorm
The hostel will have 
  • cold and hot running water, 
  • showers, 
  • western style toilets, 
  • comfy mattresses, 
  • fully equipped kitchen, 
  • barbecue area, 
  • terrace with a view of lake Baikal,
  • plenty of information on what to do in the surrounding area. 

What We Need

Last year we bought a piece of land for $28,000 with our own money on the shore of Lake Baikal. It measures 1000 sq m and has a great view and good accessibility. We've found and reserved an old passenger train carriage already. Now I am turning to crowd funding in order to make our cool indie hostel dream come true. 

So we need ~$53000 to build a train carriage hostel:

  • $1000 - to buy an old carriage.
  • $12000 - for delivery to the actual sight, it's 160 km, plus cutting the carriage in halves due to the road issues, etc.
  • $5000 - for preparing the land, fencing, etc.
  • $27000 - for reconstructing the interior/exterior and facilities.
  • $3000 - for hostel equipment - comfortable mattresses, kitchen stuff, showers, etc.
  • $1000 - for architect’s services.
  • 4-9% commission of IndieGoGo

What You Get

When you donate any funds you become our friend. Some donations will give you t-shirt, a dvd or any other merchandise. And of course if you are around this part of the world you are always welcome to stay with us and you’ll get a big discount or your stay will be free of charge. We can even organize a tour of Lake Baikal for free for anyone who makes a substantial donation. 

If we don't reach the goal, all raised funds will still go for development. 

The Impact

By donating some funds into this project you:

  • Keep lake Baikal cleaner. We will be reusing the old structures and minimizing the usage of wood.
  • Support local community. We will use only local services, hiring local people to create the hostel. But the most important thing is when the hostel is up and running there will be opportunity for locals to communicate with people from around the world which doesn't normally happen. We plan to arrange local meetings where all the people would meet and share experiences. This is particularly important in today’s Russia.
  • Allow international backpackers to meet, experience the local culture and enjoy beauty and tranquility of the Siberian landscape.
  • Support local orphanages. We donate % of our business income to local children orphanages.
  • Create a sustainable business operated by a local guy in order to make our planet little less lonely.

Other Ways You Can Help

So please help us to make the dream come true and build a cool Train Hostel on the shores of wonderful Lake Baikal. If you can’t make a contribution, please share the link to this project on your social networks or email it to friends who may be interested.

There is a button IndieGoGo share, click on it.
story_txt:
Who and Why?



Hi everybody, my name is Denis Sobnakov. I'm from Russia... actually the middle of Siberia... well the region around Lake Baikal to be exact, the oldest and the deepest freshwater lake in the world (it contains 20% of the world’s fresh water). I've been working with tourists from around the world as a tour guide for almost 10 years now. I show people the famous Trans-Siberian railway and the Trans-Mongolian route, Eastern Russia, China and of course my home region near Lake Baikal. 


In 2011 my wife and I opened a small indie hostel in the city of Ulan-Ude (centre of Russian Buddhism, 150 km from Lake Baikal). We called it Ulan Ude Travelers House and it’s aimed at adventurous travellers, backpackers who travel and explore and those who inspire others – and we have fun there, too. We've had great time with our guests (mostly English-speaking) these four seasons – we’ve  accommodated about 4000 travellers during this time. A high feedback rate on all booking sites (93%) indicates we’re doing something right.

Now...

...we have an idea to open another great indie hostel right on the shore of Lake Baikal. The great vibe and fun will be even better with the magic of the lake added into the mix. Tourists will have an amazing time exploring local area, taking hot springs and boat trips on the lake, hiking in the local forests and walking on the ice of the lake in winter time.




 

Where?

52°57'45.5"N 108°13'46.2"E
We've chosen a small fishing village called Turka located on the eastern shore of Lake Baikal. It is only 160km from Ulan-Ude  where all Trans-Siberian trains stop and easily accessible by public transport (two hours drive).

It is half way to famous the Barguzin Valley and Lake Baikal’s best bays, so people can go either direction. It is a tranquil and non-touristy place even in summer. You can experience real local life there.





What?

The main feature of the hostel is that we plan to build it out of a real used passenger train carriage.


 ->


(the picture to the right is actually taken from the internet)

Why not give it a new lease of life rather than just let it decay. It is recycling, reusing, giving a second life to something useful -  it's a green idea. And it would look just great.
The hostel will be environmentally friendly using green materials and heated in an efficient way. The train carriage will be fully refurbished inside to make it more comfortable.



Interior reconstruction 



Here is a 3D model showing how the inside will look.



The hostel will be able to accommodate up to 20 people. 8- and 12-bed dormitories will be created. 
Pricelist 


$10 per person per night for 12 bed dorm
$12,5 per person per night for 8 bed dorm

The hostel will have 

cold and hot running water, 
showers, 
western style toilets, 
comfy mattresses, 
fully equipped kitchen, 
barbecue area, 
terrace with a view of lake Baikal,
plenty of information on what to do in the surrounding area. 


   What We Need 
Last year we bought a piece of land for $28,000 with our own money on the shore of Lake Baikal. It measures 1000 sq m and has a great view and good accessibility. We've found and reserved an old passenger train carriage already. Now I am turning to crowd funding in order to make our cool indie hostel dream come true. 

So we need ~$53000 to build a train carriage hostel:

$1000 - to buy an old carriage.
$12000 - for delivery to the actual sight, it's 160 km, plus cutting the carriage in halves due to the road issues, etc.
$5000 - for preparing the land, fencing, etc.
$27000 - for reconstructing the interior/exterior and facilities.

$3000 - for hostel equipment - comfortable mattresses, kitchen stuff, showers, etc.
$1000 - for architect’s services.

4-9% commission of IndieGoGo

What You Get
When you donate any funds you become our friend. Some donations will give you t-shirt, a dvd or any other merchandise. And of course if you are around this part of the world you are always welcome to stay with us and you’ll get a big discount or your stay will be free of charge. We can even organize a tour of Lake Baikal for free for anyone who makes a substantial donation. 


If we don't reach the goal, all raised funds will still go for development. 


The Impact

 By donating some funds into this project you:


Keep lake Baikal cleaner. We will be reusing the old structures and minimizing the usage of wood.

Support local community. We will use only local services, hiring local people to create the hostel. But the most important thing is when the hostel is up and running there will be opportunity for locals to communicate with people from around the world which doesn't normally happen. We plan to arrange local meetings where all the people would meet and share experiences. This is particularly important in today’s Russia.


Allow international backpackers to meet, experience the local culture and enjoy beauty and tranquility of the Siberian landscape.

Support local orphanages. We donate % of our business income to local children orphanages.

Create a sustainable business operated by a local guy in order to make our planet little less lonely.

  Other Ways You Can Help 
So please help us to make the dream come true and build a cool Train Hostel on the shores of wonderful Lake Baikal. If you can’t make a contribution, please share the link to this project on your social networks or email it to friends who may be interested.

There is a button IndieGoGo share, click on it.

story:
Short Summary

San Fernando Brewing Company is a family run craft brewery found in the heart of the San Fernando Valley.  We aim to be part of this wonderful community that we have called home throughout our lives, and provide a quality product to both casual and seasoned beer drinkers.  Our 15-barrel system lets us serve a large area while allowing our brewers to give each batch the care and quality it deserves.  Our in-brewery, open-concept taproom, will give anyone the chance to come grab a pint and sit right next to the brewing system all while exchanging ideas with our brewers.  This campaign will help us with the final push we need to complete our taproom and start serving our signature beer.  We are on the home stretch and your essential contribution will help this fifteen-year dream become a reality and possibly give you BEER FOR LIFE!

What We Need & What You Get

Your contributions totaling $20,000 or more will help us obtain our glassware and hardware for the taproom, finalize construction throughout the brewery, and buy much needed parts for the brew system including stainless steel pipes and an aeration system.  Any and all contributions are greatly appreciated and valued, but we have some wonderful perks to help guide you in deciding how much to donate.  The following are some perks you get for your contribution in specific amounts.

For a $25 donation, you will receive a pint glass with our logo.

For a $50 donation, you will receive a growler featuring our logo.

For a $100 donation, you will receive a pint of beer each week for one year.  You can come in each week for a year and grab a well deserved pint of beer.  (In taproom only, specialty beers excluded, non-transferrable, one beer per week per patron.)

For a $300 donation, you will receive a pint of beer each week for life.  You can come in each week for your entire life and grab a well deserved pint of beer.  (In taproom only, specialty beers excluded, non-transferrable, one beer per week per patron.)

For a $2500 donation, you will receive an exclusive 3-hour private beer and food pairing for 12.  A total of 12 guests will be surrounded by our stainless steel tanks, while seated in our brewing area. You will experience a one of a kind tasting event where our beers will be matched with food from a local chef while chatting with one of our brewers.  You will be given an intimate tour of the brewery and each guest will receive a special parting gift. 


The Impact

Your contribution will allow us to open our doors and serve a community that has given us tremendous support. We owe it to you and our community. We want to proudly serve our product and also give back in return. While undergoing construction, we have participated in charity events to support our community of San Fernando and Los Angeles. We plan on distributing to the L.A area not only at our tasting room in the brewery, but also in local restaurants and bars. With an open to the public tasting room, we plan on making a comfortable environment where people can not only tour the brewery and see where the beer they're drinking comes from, but can also stay, relax, and enjoy our signature brews. 

Risks & Challenges

Any large endeavor has risks and challenges; unfortunately we are not immune to them.  Some risks include delays in our construction and having to revise final plans after state inspections.  We have great contractors working with us to overcome any hurdles and get us brewing as soon as possible. 

Hop shortages are another hurdle affecting many craft breweries, but we have a list of vendors ready to help us obtain the needed hops for our signature brews. But as of yet, we have been very keen and have taken all the right steps and measurements to ensure that nothing jumps in the way.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know anyone that loves craft beer, appreciates the process of brewing and wants to help support a local business, please forward our campaign. Follow us on Twitter and Facebook and spread the word.  Let everyone know who we are, what we are passionate about, and where they can find us. We can’t wait to meet you, greet you and serve you with our signature brews.

story:
This is a call to Etsy Independent Artisans, Suppliers, and Vintage Sellers to look upon the dramatic changes of Etsy's policies over the last year as an incredible opportunity.

Etsy is/has been made up of independent Artisans, Suppliers, and Vintage Sellers which have made it the beautiful market place that it is. Not only are we Artisans, but business owners as well.

It has been largely rumoured over the last several days that Etsy is going public. This is imminent. BUT! Do not despair. This is an opportunity for you to become a voice which is heard.

Over the last several decades many companies have switched to "employee owned." Hmmm...An interesting thought. 

Honestly, I am not advocating anything here other than the ability to be a voice heard. The fact that Etsy has chosen to go public is offering you the Handmade Artist just this opportunity.

It is not that far out of reach. I have followed the Etsy forums closely since the announcement that Etsy would allow manufacturers into the market place. On that day I had a very sick feeling in the pit of my stomach, and I immediately knew that things were about to change quite drastically.

My Vision?

I am a veteran of cooperative living, and have always firmly believed in living cooperatively. With that said I am not considering myself a leader...At all. Rather, a person with a vision who believes that within our group we will have individuals with a wide variety of talents who be a vital component for 'crafting' a fully functional group of Etsy Artisans with a strong voice.

So, here is my list of items for your consideration.

1. The goal is for our group to obtain enough Etsy stock so that we can be one voice for the independent artisan.

A big portion of us are 'starving artists,' and cannot afford a huge investment. With that in mind I am asking that all donations be $10.00US. This will enable most of us to take part, and be equal shareholders.

2. Everyone has something to offer. We will need team leaders, and likely an Etsy Team so that we can communicate. We will need people with legal backgrounds that can do any legal paperwork that needs to be drawn up. We will need people with strong communication skills. We will need people with a good business sense, PR people, writers, of course someone with stock market skills...and the list goes on.

3. We have recently moved from gofund me to indiegogo, which charges a fee each time a donation is made. It is small, on average 9%, but varies from country to county. The information is on the website.

I am a small independent artisan. Like you, I have no money. With that said, if I am unable to get the ball rolling on this, your money will be refunded less the fee which Indiegogo has charged. Please be sure to keep the receipt sent to you upon donation.

4. Participants:
When making your donation it is imperative that you do NOT make an anonymous donation, and please note your skills and role you would like to play.
     
Non-Participants:
 It is becoming clearly apparent to me that we are in immediate need of some start-up operating capital, and will humbly accept any anonymous or otherwise donations which can accelerate this process.
 Perks?  Well, glad you asked!  We are a committed group of artisans who have devoted our souls to bringing a little more beauty in to your world.  With that said, I am in the process of adding unique handmade items  as perks, which have been handcrafted by the members of this group.
So here we are, let the dialog begin.
Cherri

Current Perks

One of a Kind                                                                                                                                 Crochet Poncho Handmade by Cherri                                                                                 Barefoot Garb and Hippy Franks                                                                                           $500 Donation


Who We Are


 Julie Burkett                                                                                                                                Baked Alaskan Designs                                                                                                               

Sumanasa Pixie                                                                                                                         Fairies Welcome and Grateful Beads 

Veronica Rausch                                                                                                                      Copper Hammer Studio


Our Campaign in the News

Published on Feb 5, 2015

Feb. 5 (Bloomberg) -- Wall Street may be salivating over Etsy's IPO. But for some artisan sellers... not so much. After Bloomberg broke the news that the e-commerce site for handmade goods was going public, Etsy merchants expressed their outrage on blogs, forums and in gatherings. Bloomberg's Leslie Picker went to San Francisco to talk to some Etsy sellers.

Rasta-Hat Maker Dreads Etsy Will Be As Big As EBay

Wall Street may be salivating over Etsy Inc.’s coming IPO. Cherri Rodriguez is dreading it.

Rodriguez, 54, sells crochet rasta hats for the Burning Man festival on Etsy. She recently scaled back her operation after a decade on the site because it changed a longstanding handmade-only policy and welcomed manufacturers. Like many Etsy veterans, Rodriguez frets that once Etsy goes public, investors’ appetite for growth will erase the artisanal ethos altogether.  Read the full story
Leslie Picker                                                                                                                       Bloomberg News


#etsyipo #etsysellers #BloombergNews #GuardianNews
