story:
My native language is Serbian ... text in Serbian is in the bottom of the page.

* tekst na srpskom jeziku je na dnu strane

Who we are / our idea

Hello everyone ;)

My name is Sanja, I'm married to Dragan, better known by his nickname - Komarac, which means Mosquito. We are in ours 50s and this year we are celebrating 30 years of our marriage. Our three grown children no longer live with us...and here our story begins :)

We are situated in Stari Ledinci, suburbs of Novi Sad, the second largest city in Serbia (Europe), famous by the Exit Music Festival. Our small town is a quiet place only 10km away from the city. It lies in the National Park Fruska Gora, which is a beautiful mountain that, once upon a time, was an island in the Pannonian Sea...


Our life style is turned to nature: eating consisted of food produced in our own organic garden, recycling and composting organic waste, economical use of water and electricity, spending time outside...



We adopted four cats and a dog, and we also have four horses.

Volunteering in a local NGO, which deals with ecology and promotion of recreational activities on Fruska Gora (Dragan leads equestrian club and horse riding school and I'm in charge of a hiking club), gives us an opportunity to meet tourists from various countries. They leave us delighted by the nature, with a desire to stay longer.

This knowledge and the fact that currently only my husband and I live in our big house, brought us to our idea, to found a rural tourism household and camping rest areas, where we could host all travelers eager to stay in nature.

Those who choose to stay with us, can expect clean air, sleeping in silence, waking up with the birds chirping, watching the starry skies at night, enjoying the homemade food (if desired - vegetarian, vegan or raw), petting our pets, hiking and horseback riding in nature, collecting edible and healing herbs and mushrooms....but also closeness to a large city with many cultural and historical sights.

What We Need

The money collected this way will be used to renovate and equip our rural tourism household (which will be call Dobro prase / The Good Piglet) and camping rest areas.

2,800 USD - for renovation

5,700 USD - for equipment of bedrooms, kitchen and dinning room

3,500 USD - for equipment of camping rest areas and external area

Renovation works are scheduled for April 15th, until when, we hope, your help will arrive :)

What You Get

We will express our gratitude for your help through the perks that are listed on the right. Anyone can choose a perk that he likes. All perks are guaranteed regardless of whether we reach the target amount of donations through this campaign.

The progress of the renovation work will be able to follow through Facebook page that will be open.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help spread the word about our idea - via Facebook, Twitter or by sending emails to your friends and family (use the Indiegogo share tools).

Thank you

Thank you for your time spent reading this text. It means a lot to me.

Best regards,                                                                                                                                 Sanja

P.S.                                                                                                                                                           See you at Fruska Gora ;)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

text in Serbian...

* tekst na srpskom jeziku

Pretpostavljam da svi vi koji koristite Indiegogo razumete i tekst na engleskom jeziku, ali ipak ću napisati i na srpskom :)
Dakle...
Ja sam Sanja, udata sam za Dragana (svi prijatelji ga zovu po nadimku Komarac). Mi smo pedesetogodišnjaci i ove godine proslavljamo 30 godina braka. Naše troje odrasle dece više ne žive sa nama...i tu počinje naša priča :)
Živimo u Starim Ledincima, predgrađu Novog Sada, drugog po veličini grada u Srbiji, poznatog i po održavanju EXIT muzičkog festivala. Naše malo mirno mesto je samo 10km udaljeno od grada, na samom obodu NP Fruška gora.
Naš stil života je okrenut prirodi: ishrana pretežno hranom proizvedenom u našoj organskoj bašti, reciklaža i kompostiranje organskog otpada, ekonomično korištenje vode i struje, boravak na otvorenom... Udomili smo 4 mačke i psa, a imamo i 4 konja.
Volontiramo u lokalnoj NVO koja se bavi ekologijom i promocijom rekreativnih aktivnosti na Fruškoj gori (Dragan vodi konjički klub i školu jahanja, a ja pešački klub). Tu se srećemo sa turistima iz raznih zemalja. Svi oni odlaze oduševljeni prirodom i željni dužeg boravka kod nas.
To saznanje i činjenica da trenutno u našoj velikoj kući živimo samo Dragan i ja, dovode nas do naše ideje, a to je osnivanje seoskog turističkog domaćinstva i mini-kamping odmorišta, gde bismo mogli da ugostimo sve putnike željne boravka u prirodi.
Oni koji se opredele da borave kod nas, mogu očekivati čist vazduh, spavanje u tišini, buđenje uz cvrkut ptica, posmatranje zvezdanog neba noću, domaću hranu (po želji vegetarijansku, vegansku ili sirovu), maženje naših kućnih ljubimaca, planinarenje ili jahanje u prirodi, sakupljanje jestivog i lekovitog bilja i gljiva...ali i blizinu velikog grada sa brojnim kulturnim i istorijskim znamenitostima.
Novac koji prikupimo ovim putem će biti upotrebljen za renoviranje i opremanje budućeg seoskog turističkog domaćinstva (koje će se zvati Dobro prase) i kamping odmorišta.
2.800 USD - za renoviranje
5.700 USD - za opremanje spavaćih soba, kuhinje i trpezarije
3.500 USD - za opremanje kamping odmorišta i spoljašnjeg prostora
*cene su izražene u USD radi jednostavnije bankarske transakcije
Radovi na renoviranju su zakazani za 15. april, do kada će, nadamo se, stići vaša pomoć :)
Zahvalnost za vašu pomoć ćemo izraziti putem nagrada koje su navedene desno (dostupan je tekst samo na engleskom jeziku - zbog tehničkih mogućnosti na Indiegogo). Svako može odabrati onu nagradu koja mu se najviše sviđa. Sve nagrade su zagarantovane bez obzira da li dostignemo ciljani iznos donacija putem ove kampanje. Napredovanje radova na renoviranju ćete moći da pratite putem Fejsbuk stranice koja će biti otvorena.
Takođe, možete pomoći i širenjem priče o našoj ideji - putem Fejsbuka, Tvitera ili slanjem e-mailova vašim prijateljima i porodici (koristite alate koji su postavljeni na Indiegogo).
Hvala vam na vašem vremenu koje ste proveli čitajući ovaj tekst. To mi puno znači.

Srdačan pozdrav,
Sanja

P.S.
Vidimo se na Fruškoj gori ;)
story_txt:
My native language is Serbian ... text in Serbian is in the bottom of the page. 
 * tekst na srpskom jeziku je na dnu strane
Who we are / our idea
Hello everyone ;)
My name is Sanja, I'm married to Dragan, better known by his nickname - Komarac, which means Mosquito. We are in ours 50s and this year we are celebrating 30 years of our marriage. Our three grown children no longer live with us...and here our story begins :)

We are situated in Stari Ledinci, suburbs of Novi Sad, the second largest city in Serbia (Europe), famous by the Exit Music Festival. Our small town is a quiet place only 10km away from the city. It lies in the National Park Fruska Gora, which is a beautiful mountain that, once upon a time, was an island in the Pannonian Sea...
Our life style is turned to nature: eating consisted of food produced in our own organic garden, recycling and composting organic waste, economical use of water and electricity, spending time outside... 
We adopted four cats and a dog, and we also have four horses.Volunteering in a local NGO, which deals with ecology and promotion of recreational activities on Fruska Gora (Dragan leads equestrian club and horse riding school and I'm in charge of a hiking club), gives us an opportunity to meet tourists from various countries. They leave us delighted by the nature, with a desire to stay longer.This knowledge and the fact that currently only my husband and I live in our big house, brought us to our idea, to found a rural tourism household and camping rest areas, where we could host all travelers eager to stay in nature.
Those who choose to stay with us, can expect clean air, sleeping in silence, waking up with the birds chirping, watching the starry skies at night, enjoying the homemade food (if desired - vegetarian, vegan or raw), petting our pets, hiking and horseback riding in nature, collecting edible and healing herbs and mushrooms....but also closeness to a large city with many cultural and historical sights.
  What We Need The money collected this way will be used to renovate and equip our rural tourism household (which will be call Dobro prase / The Good Piglet) and camping rest areas.
2,800 USD - for renovation
5,700 USD - for equipment of bedrooms, kitchen and dinning room
3,500 USD - for equipment of camping rest areas and external area
Renovation works are scheduled for April 15th, until when, we hope, your help will arrive :)
What You Get
We will express our gratitude for your help through the perks that are listed on the right. Anyone can choose a perk that he likes. All perks are guaranteed regardless of whether we reach the target amount of donations through this campaign.
The progress of the renovation work will be able to follow through Facebook page that will be open.
  Other Ways You Can Help You can also help spread the word about our idea - via Facebook, Twitter or by sending emails to your friends and family (use  the Indiegogo share tools).
Thank you
Thank you for your time spent reading this text. It means a lot to me.
Best regards,                                                                                                                                 Sanja
P.S.                                                                                                                                                           See you at Fruska Gora ;)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
text in Serbian...
 * tekst na srpskom jezikuPretpostavljam da svi vi koji koristite Indiegogo razumete i tekst na engleskom jeziku, ali ipak ću napisati i na srpskom :)Dakle...Ja sam Sanja, udata sam za Dragana (svi prijatelji ga zovu po nadimku Komarac). Mi smo pedesetogodišnjaci i ove godine proslavljamo 30 godina braka. Naše troje odrasle dece više ne žive sa nama...i tu počinje naša priča :)Živimo u Starim Ledincima, predgrađu Novog Sada, drugog po veličini grada u Srbiji, poznatog i po održavanju EXIT muzičkog festivala. Naše malo mirno mesto je samo 10km udaljeno od grada, na samom obodu NP Fruška gora.Naš stil života je okrenut prirodi: ishrana pretežno hranom proizvedenom u našoj organskoj bašti, reciklaža i kompostiranje organskog otpada, ekonomično korištenje vode i struje, boravak na otvorenom... Udomili smo 4 mačke i psa, a imamo i 4 konja.Volontiramo u lokalnoj NVO koja se bavi ekologijom i promocijom rekreativnih aktivnosti na Fruškoj gori (Dragan vodi konjički klub i školu jahanja, a ja pešački klub). Tu se srećemo sa turistima iz raznih zemalja. Svi oni odlaze oduševljeni prirodom i željni dužeg boravka kod nas.To saznanje i činjenica da trenutno u našoj velikoj kući živimo samo Dragan i ja, dovode nas do naše ideje, a to je osnivanje seoskog turističkog domaćinstva i mini-kamping odmorišta, gde bismo mogli da ugostimo sve putnike željne boravka u prirodi.Oni koji se opredele da borave kod nas, mogu očekivati čist vazduh, spavanje u tišini, buđenje uz cvrkut ptica, posmatranje zvezdanog neba noću, domaću hranu (po želji vegetarijansku, vegansku ili sirovu), maženje naših kućnih ljubimaca, planinarenje ili jahanje u prirodi, sakupljanje jestivog i lekovitog bilja i gljiva...ali i blizinu velikog grada sa brojnim kulturnim i istorijskim znamenitostima.Novac koji prikupimo ovim putem će biti upotrebljen za renoviranje i opremanje budućeg seoskog turističkog domaćinstva (koje će se zvati Dobro prase) i kamping odmorišta.2.800 USD - za renoviranje5.700 USD - za opremanje spavaćih soba, kuhinje i trpezarije3.500 USD - za opremanje kamping odmorišta i spoljašnjeg prostora*cene su izražene u USD radi jednostavnije bankarske transakcijeRadovi na renoviranju su zakazani za 15. april, do kada će, nadamo se, stići vaša pomoć :)Zahvalnost za vašu pomoć ćemo izraziti putem nagrada koje su navedene desno (dostupan je tekst samo na engleskom jeziku - zbog tehničkih mogućnosti na Indiegogo). Napredovanje radova na renoviranju ćete moći da pratite putem Fejsbuk stranice koja će biti otvorena.Takođe, možete pomoći i širenjem priče o našoj ideji - putem Fejsbuka, Tvitera ili slanjem e-mailova vašim prijateljima i porodici (koristite alate koji su postavljeni na Indiegogo).Hvala vam na vašem vremenu koje ste proveli čitajući ovaj tekst. story:
Short Summary

Helio Terra Vegan Cafe is a fast casual concept focusing on high nutritional content delivered through a fresh and flavorful menu, designed to satisfy the palates of a diverse range of diners.  Our food philosophy is to fuel the bodies of our guests with nutritionally rich, flavorful creations with an emphasis on wellness and the specific needs of athletic activities.  We will continuously research and experiment with new products available to the market.  Half of the menu will be 100 % raw, gluten free and soy free, and half will be cooked.  Offering raw cold pressed juices, whole food smoothies, complete lines of athletic nutritional supplements, house fermented probiotic items, and a full menu of soups, salads, sandwiches, wraps, flatbreads, entrees and desserts, we will have something perfect for athletes, juice fasters, caffeine lovers, raw foodists, gluten free individuals and those just looking for delicious healthy comfort food.

Situated on Prospect Avenue in Downtown Cleveland, Ohio with a shared entrance to Titan's Gym in Downtown Cleveland's Gateway District, the location is near Progressive Field, the Q Arena, East Fourth Street Entertainment district, Public Square, the Horseshoe Casino, hotels on Euclid Avenue and East 9th street, and many business and residential buildings.  We are well situated to capitalize on the steady flow of customers working, living and visiting our area.  Additionally, there are several major redevelopment projects underway or in the planning stages within 3 blocks of the site.

Austin Ruesch, our executive chef and president is uniquely qualified to guide the kitchen and business operations with 24 years of experience, spanning every job in the restaurant business.  He served 10 years in the kitchen and 14 in the front of the house, most as a trainer, shift leader or manager, and has has been vegan for the past 13 years.  He is currently General Manager of a top fine dining destination in Downtown Cleveland and has been with the company for 5 1/2 years, overseeing daily operations, social media, reputation management and marketing plans.  Additionally, he was recently employed in Los Angeles, CA as General Manager of a vegan cafe, giving him the opportunity to research the complex world of vegan cuisine from the inside in the most developed city in the country for this type of fare.

Valencia Santiago, our front of house manager has 19 years of experience as a server, bartender, barista and supervisor, and has also recently worked at a vegan cafe in Los Angeles, running the dining room and counter service.  Being mainly vegetarian or vegan throughout her life, she is uniquely sensitive to the needs of various dietary restrictions, and can execute custom experiences for diners based on their individual taste preferences in a cheerful and accommodating manner, guiding the staff to serve in a similar fashion.

The vegan restaurant industry in Northeast Ohio has reached sufficient critical mass to support many more businesses of this type, and Helio Terra Vegan Cafe is perfectly positioned to tap into the exponentially increasing market for healthy conscious cuisine, and also to be a major force in developing the local scene for the future. 

By contributing to this campaign, you will assist in creating lovingly prepared plant based nutrition to all our guests, improving the quality and longevity of life to all who dine here.

What We Need & What You Get

Our campaign goal is to raise $20,000 in addition to our current investment.  We will use this money for specialized equipment such as dehydrators, juicers, sous vide machines, a reverse osmosis water filtration system, vacuum sealer and other specialized tools we will use to create our unique offerings. 

The Perks: 

Inviting our guests and fans to join the conversation about food and fitness is the cornerstone of the relationships we work to build.  In keeping with this philosophy, all contributors will receive a complimentary loyalty rewards card pre-loaded with $8 toward your first visit, additional money for redemption any time and a fun window cling sticker with our logo. Our rewards structure will be: 

$20:  Rewards card pre-loaded with $8.

$50:  Rewards card pre-loaded with $8, additional $5

$100:  Rewards card pre-loaded with $8, additional $10.  Invitation to opening day with complimentary hors d'oeuvres, juice and smoothie samples.

$250:  Rewards card pre-loaded with $8, additional $25.  Invitation to opening day with complimentary hors d'oeuvres, juice and smoothie samples. Logo t-shirt in your choice of size and color available.

$500:  Rewards card pre-loaded with $8, additional $50. Invitation to opening day with complimentary hors d'oeuvres, juice and smoothie samples. Logo t-shirt in your choice of size and color available. Invitation to opening day after party at a local night club with complimentary bottle service.

$1000:  Rewards card pre-loaded with $8, additional $100.  Invitation to opening day with complimentary hors d'oeuvres, juice and smoothie samples. Logo t-shirt in your choice of size and color available. Invitation to opening day after party at a local night club with complimentary bottle service. 10% off all orders for 3 months.

$5000:  Rewards card pre-loaded with $8, additional $500.  Invitation to opening day with complimentary hors d'oeuvres, juice and smoothie samples. Logo t-shirt in your choice of size and color available. Invitation to opening day after party at a local night club with complimentary bottle service. 10% off all orders for 1 year.

For contributors outside of the Cleveland area, rewards will be redeemable online, as we will have many raw vegan and baked items suitable for shipping. 

Your Impact on the World

Every guest at Helio Terra will have the opportunity to explore our ingredients and menu, creating a unique experience matching their dietary needs.  Our staff will be trained to guide our guests on their journeys.  Quite literally, every dollar raised will benefit each and every person purchasing our products with increased quality of life. 

Our Risks & Challenges

Our success depends on a combination of carefully selecting the ingredients we use, patiently developing new recipes based on seasonally available local produce, and your contribution. The more money we raise, the greater opportunity we have for lasting success. We look forward to rewarding your contribution.

All individuals involved with this project are experts on vegan food and have many years of experience creating menus and running the daily operations of the restaurant business. This combined knowledge and experience guarantees we can react to all challenges with efficiency and confidence. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking the time to consider our campaign. We truly appreciate your interest.  Even if you are unable to contribute, you can assist our cause by reposting our campaign, messaging any friends with a passion for vegan food, or simply offering encouraging remarks on our Facebook or Instagram posts at helioterravegancafe. 

Be well friends!

story:
My name is Ron Berglas and I am the producer and host of KVCR TV’s INSIGHT with Ron Berglas. KVCR is the public television and radio station covering The Inland Empire, Coachella Valley, Riverside, and parts of Los Angeles County. The mission of this show is to provide a public service by focusing our programs on subjects that will have an immediate impact on the lives of our viewers. Please feel free to check out my website at www.insightwithronberglas.com

Our next program will be on the subject of Parental Alienation Syndrome (PAS), a term coined by Dr. Richard A. Gardner to describe “…a disorder in which a child, on an ongoing basis, belittles and insults one parent without justification, due to a combination of factors, including indoctrination by the other parent.” The clip from the recent Brazilian documentary A Morte Inventada included above dramatically illustrates the seriousness of the problem. Brazil was the first country to make Parental Alienation illegal.

Here are the Eight Symptoms of Parental Alienation Syndrome:

·  Consistently put down the targeted parent

·  Make reasons for their behavior that are weak or absurd

·  Have a lack of ambivalence towards the targeted parent

·  Claim that their words and actions are their own

·  Be supported in these acts by the alienating parent

·  Have an absence of guilt regarding their behavior toward or the exploitation of

  the targeted parent

·  Adopt borrowed scenarios

·  Extend the animosity to the targeted parent’s side of the family

The purpose of this show is to help the psychiatric and legal professions to understand how their lack of knowledge on this global and divisive issue has made worse the trauma so many families are presently going through. Your investment in this show will break open that traditional methodology and encourage therapists, psychiatrists, mediators, lawyers, and judges, not only to recognize the PAS dynamic when it is placed in front of them, but to educate themselves so that they can begin to find new ways to help these families.

The money we raised from the first part of this campaign helped to finance two on- location interviews with Dr. William Bernet and Linda Kase-Gottlieb, two of the foremost experts in the field.

In this second part of our fund raising campaign, we are hoping to raise enough money to get into the studio where we will shoot, edit, and finally market our program in order to alert families, licensed marriage and family therapists who presently are not obliged to learn about Parental Alienation Syndrome, mediators, lawyers, and judges about the terrible damage that is done to children when one parent tries to completely remove those children from the lives of the other parent. All children deserve to be loved by both of their parents. HELP US MAKE THAT POSSIBLE.

On this explosive episode of INSIGHT, we will bring together a panel of experts as well as alienated parents, adults who were alienated as children, dramatized readings from family therapy case notes, and much more. Once it has aired on KVCR, our plan will be to market the show to other PBS stations as well as to individuals, groups, universities, libraries, medical and family-orientated establishments around the country and the world.

The fund raising goal for this show is $5,000, and to date we have raised a little over $2,000. We have just 60 days to raise the remaining $3,000 so please consider making your tax deductible donation TODAY to KVCR: Attention Ron Berglas INSIGHT.

On behalf of the thousands of children and their targeted parents worldwide who have been so profoundly affected, we thank you for your generous support.

With sincere appreciation,

Ron Berglas

story:
01/06/16 Update: Thank you for your support and questions. I have made a couple of changes to the campaign per your request. Please keep them coming!

01/04/16 Update: Hello everyone, I hope you had a happy new year! I was just looking at the campaign traffic and it looks like a junior high school dance, you know where everyone shows up but doesn't want to be the first on the floor. We have had 700 hundred different people visit more than once and most have referred other people(Thank you! Dave C. is our top referrer so far). That's OK though, its still really early. So we have made a special get up and dance perk. For just $5 a tree will be planted in your name and we will send you a Living Green Guide that will save you way more than $5! Everybody wins! Also please send me any questions, concerns, comments or dance requests here or on our facebook page www.facebook.com/myfuturecard. 



What Is The Future Card?


Our Mission

   The Future Card is a Public Benefit Corporation that will make premium socially and environmentally responsible investing simple and affordable for everyone.  By way of our unique Visa gift card, clients simply add funds and in turn we invest those funds in environmentally and socially responsible companies, real estate, and commodities.  We make our clients money while at the same time making our planet a better place for all.

   It is our vision to create an affordable investment opportunity that will not only provide an impressive return, but also benefit our environment for generations to come. One of the most popular gifts in the mid-20th century was the U.S. Savings Bond. Parents and grandparents have long considered shares of stock or shares of mutual funds as an excellent gift for young people just learning the concepts of saving and investing.  The Future Card is a 21st century equivalent. 

   Getting your Future Card lets you take advantage of:

  • Responsible, high-return investing that until now was only available to high income investors                                                                                                                            

  • Access to your money anywhere Visa is accepted including ATMs, on line or even on your phone                                                                                            

  • No management fees. No minimum investment. No hidden costs

  • Peace of mind that your investments are not contributing to pollution, wage inequality, animal testing, global warming or discrimination

  • Group investing. Invite family and friends to invest for a specific goal such as a college fund, retirement, emergencies, or a dream vacation

  • Availability. Will be in gift card kiosks, in stores and on line                                           
  • Charity. The Future Card is a Public Benefit Corporation. Unlike most companies we do not exist to make ourselves money. It is our sole purpose to make you money while investing in a better world. Profits will be donated to responsible organizations such as World Wildlife Fund, Sea Shepherd Society, UNICEF, Greenpeace and Amnesty International                                                              
  • An effortless way to save for the future and invest in a better world – all at the same time!

Why Future Card?

 
   Everyday the news shows us more crimes against the environment and more people suffering. The rich keep getting richer, companies keep polluting and the average person works harder for less money. The Future Card is the solution. 
  •  50% of everyone in the United States have no savings. No money for emergencies, college or retirement. The average savings account yields less than 1% interest. The top investment funds have yielded more than 40% interest but require minimum deposits of hundreds of thousands of dollars. Most of the Forbes 500 made their fortunes with investing, all have significantly increased their wealth with investments. By combining funds we are able to make available high return investing for everyone and as easy as buying a soda.                                                                                                                                 
  • 50% of all wildlife and 50% of the worlds forests we had 50 years ago are gone forever. Unethical corporations are the number one cause of poverty, pollution, deforestation, global warming, animal abuse and wage inequality. Most mutual funds, ETFs, and hedge funds invest in these companies allowing them to continue their horrible practices. We screen all of our investments not only to exclude unethical companies but also to support those that help the environment and society. By defunding irresponsible companies and supporting growing ethical businesses we not only realize a high return for our customers but become a major force in securing a better future for all.



Why It Works...


  Gift cards are a 100 billion dollar a year industry. They are in virtually every store. But what do you really get? Basically 80 cents on the dollar and 40% are unused. Imagine instead giving someone a gift card for college tuition, retirement or a dream vacation. A gift card that never expires and actually gains value. That is the Future Card. 

   According to Geoff Burnand (Chief Executive, Investing for Good) the growth of responsible investing has been rapid, in part mirroring the rise of venture capital in the 1980s and in 10 years the operating environment will be unrecognizable. Sir Ronald Cohen, widely regarded as Father of British Venture Capital said, “Impact investing is the next Big Thing. Society cannot continue to cope with prevailing social issues in the traditional way. We need to harness entrepreneurship, innovation and capital to achieve in the social area what they have achieved in the creation and growth of entrepreneurial firms in general, and technology firms in particular”. 

   There are a number of sectors which have high growth potential for impact investment such as health care, renewable energy, green housing, arts, sport/fitness and education projects. Climate change initiatives and legislation alone will require an estimated $10 trillion in investment before 2020 to fund development of the low-carbon energy economy. At the 2015 United Nations Climate Change Conference 196 countries pledged to reduce their greenhouse gas emissions by as much as 55% by 2030 and 100% by 2050. Imagine investing in cars and oil when everyone was still riding horses. The only difference now is that there are 5,000,000,000 more consumers. 



Other Ways To Help

 We realize not everyone can afford to back our campaign, many people struggle to afford even the basic necessities, which is why we created the Future Card. First, you don't have to select a perk. Donations of even $1 are greatly appreciated and add up. You can also be an incredible help by spreading the word. Tell everyone you know on Facebook, Twitter, G+ and LinkedIn. When we achieve our stretch goal the top referrer perk is a Tesla electric car!
  Volunteer for a non profit! There are many organizations that are in desperate need of help. You can help out with a local charity or pick your favorite non profit  and champion their cause on social media.
 


About Me

  First let me say a huge THANK YOU to everyone that has helped put this together artists, economists, writers, stock brokers, NPOs, executives and friends. Most of whom contributed for no compensation. This would not have been possible without such wonderful, intelligent and giving people.
 As for myself, after college I planted trees and helped rebuild streams destroyed by logging companies. Later I started and managed a couple businesses, always giving employees a living wage while donating a percent of the profits to charity. I’ve been doing everything I can to make the world a better place, including volunteering and donating until it hurt. It never seemed enough. Half the wildlife that we had just 40 years ago is now gone. The environment keeps getting more and more polluted. People are working harder for less money. I knew there had to be a way to help more. My entrepreneurial spirit combined with my passion for good causes eventually led me to start Future Card, PBC. I am putting all my professional know-how and my ability to learn quickly into my dream of making Future Card the best and the simplest thing anyone can do for themselves and the world.                                  We need your help to get the Future Card into the hands of people that need it. All you have to do is decide whether to plant a tree, save the whales or save someones life! 


Q and A

 Please feel free to ask a question support@myfuturecard.com

Q; Why aren't you using PayPal?
A; In addition to the fees Indiegogo charges, which are very fair, PayPal charges an additional 5% just to take your credit/debt card information. The very same thing you would do anyway but it goes through multiple channels instead of one and they overcharge you. I know it is a little bit more of a hassle but it means we are able to give the NPOs more and you more which is a win in my book.

Investment projections are hypothetical in nature. Investing involves risk. Actual performance over shorter periods will vary and losses may occur.
story_txt:
01/06/16 Update: Thank you for your support and questions. I have made a couple of changes to the campaign per your request. Please keep them coming!
01/04/16 Update: Hello everyone, I hope you had a happy new year! I was just looking at the campaign traffic and it looks like a junior high school dance, you know where everyone shows up but doesn't want to be the first on the floor. We have had 700 hundred different people visit more than once and most have referred other people(Thank you! Dave C. is our top referrer so far). That's OK though, its still really early. So we have made a special get up and dance perk. For just $5 a tree will be planted in your name and we will send you a Living Green Guide that will save you way more than $5! Everybody wins! Also please send me any questions, concerns, comments or dance requests here or on our facebook page www.facebook.com/myfuturecard. 



What Is The Future Card?
Our Mission

   The Future Card is a Public Benefit Corporation that will make premium socially and environmentally responsible investing simple and affordable for everyone.  By way of our unique Visa gift card, clients simply add funds and in turn we invest those funds in environmentally and socially responsible companies, real estate, and commodities.  We make our clients money while at the same time making our planet a better place for all.
   It is our vision to create an affordable investment opportunity that will not only provide an impressive return, but also benefit our environment for generations to come. One of the most popular gifts in the mid-20th century was the U.S. Savings Bond. Parents and grandparents have long considered shares of stock or shares of mutual funds as an excellent gift for young people just learning the concepts of saving and investing.  The Future Card is a 21st century equivalent. 



   Getting your Future Card lets you take advantage of:

Responsible, high-return investing that until now was only available to high income investors                                                                                                                            
Access to your money anywhere Visa is accepted including ATMs, on line or even on your phone                                                                                            
No management fees. No minimum investment. No hidden costs
Peace of mind that your investments are not contributing to pollution, wage inequality, animal testing, global warming or discrimination
Group investing. Invite family and friends to invest for a specific goal such as a college fund, retirement, emergencies, or a dream vacation
Availability. Will be in gift card kiosks, in stores and on line

story:
The purpose of this campaign is to raise enough money for Joshua Kim, a lad passionate about helping others and adventure, to build affordable homes for families in need cities of American while biking across the country in Summer 2015. The journey is led by Bike and Build, a program that leads groups of young cyclists across the United States and arranges days to help Habitat for Humanity build affordable homes for families in need of a safe space. 

My goal for March and April is to raise at least $1500 through this campaign. But in order to be a part of Bike and Build every biker must raise at least $4500 for Habitat for Humanity. Part of this is directly donated to Habitat for Humanity and part covers the biker's food and living expenses during the program.

Bike & Build is a nonprofit organization that produces cross-country cycling trips to raise money and awareness for the affordable housing (AH) crisis. This summer, I will be biking from Charleston, South Carolina to Santa Cruz, California along with 30 other young adults for affordable housing (AH) charities. This journey will take me 70 days through 13 states. Along the way, we will be making scheduled stops to build and educate the communities we work in about the need for affordable housing. 

Full Itinerary
-Click above for a complete schedule of the trip

                   

 

Build Days (Affordable Housing Impact):

May 27 - Charleston, SC
May 30 - Sumter, SC
Jun 3 - Greenville, SC
Jun 8 - Rome, GA
Jun 13 - Tupelo, MS
Jun 23 - Oklahoma City, OK
Jul 5 - 11 Colorado Springs, CO
Jul 16 - Carbondale, CO
Jul 22 - Provo, UT
Jul 28 - Twin Falls, ID
Aug 10 - Chico, CA


About me
I'm Josh, I love the outdoors, rock climbing and a strong believer of helping those in need. I'm studying Business and Mathematics at Whittier College, California.  I'm interested in Bike & Build because of the people I will meet along the way as well as my fellow riders who also have a heart for helping others. I want to continue to learn what it means to have compassion for those in need and in what way I can help while actually making a difference in the process. 

Follow my progress on:

                          

Josh's Bike & Build      l      Facebook       l        Instagram


Where can I learn more about Bike & Build / Habitat for Humanity?
Check out their websites here: bikeandbuild.org/www.habitat.org

Can I volunteer / bike with you sometime?
Of course! Please! Facebook me or email me and we'll get together jkimwhit@gmail.com


(Credit: Pictures and template courtesy of Michele Lis)

story:
Hello! My name is Vadim. I am the head of Joomline Team for more than 5 years. We have developed more than 100 extensions for Joomla! CMS and some of them became very popular in its category. We also develop many websites based on Joomla! CMS and our customers often tell us about the problems with Joomla content editors.  Usually customers compare Joomla content editor with WordPress editor and the comparison is not in favor of Joomla. It is difficult to argue, because Joomla content editor has no major changes since Joomla 1.5.

You might think that Joomla! CMS has a lot of alternative editors, but most editors are not user friendly and are difficult to use. We want to bring WordPress standards into the usability of Joomla content editor. After analyzing the existing editors we came to the conclusion that one of the most user friendly editors is Imperavi. But the license costs money and we want to buy it for the whole Joomla community without the restrictions.

Demo editor Imperavi

What's our plan?

To buy the license of the editor for the entire Joomla community.

To create a plugin based on this script.

To implement all possible functions in the plugin.

What we will implement in the editor?

Directly the Imperavi editor.

Support for the following plugins:

  • Table
  • Video
  • Fullscreen
  • Image Manager
  • File Manager
  • Clips
  • Predefined Links
  • Font Size
  • Font Family
  • Font Color
  • Text Direction
  • Limiter
  • Counter
  • Text Expander

How can you help?

2$ - Thanks for the support. We will mention your name on the page editor.

20$ - You want to create a plugin and want the version for Joomla 2.5. And of course we will mention your name on the project page.

100$ - We will provide you with free support for 180 days and will certainly mention your name on the extension page.

200$ - We will respect your wishes to the editor and implement one function at your request. Also, you will be provided with free support in the next 365 days and we will post your name on the project page.

What if we will raise more than the required amount?

We believe that Joomla community needs an editor and we will be able to raise the necessary funds for the project. However if we will raise a large amount, then in this case we have a few ideas.

If we will reach $ 2000, we will implement a component for Imperavi editor management, which will allow you to customize the appearance for different groups of users and flexibly manage folders and files as well as permissions.

story:
El Timbiriche is a mobile wellness cart that collects, preserves, and shares traditional wellness and healing practices of the Latino community in North Brooklyn. El Puente, with the support of DesigNYC, teamed up with architect Farzana Gandhi and graphic artist Pablo Delcán to design a solution that builds on the community's rich culture and tradition of remedios caseros (home remedies) while responding to the issues of access and affordability of healthcare. After a series of community workshops and events, El Timbiriche emerged as a concept and a physical design that we are excited to build!



The Design 

El Timbiriche, meaning "little kiosk" (and also the name of a Mexican pop band!), acts as an interactive collector and distributor of valuable information. The mobile unit will travel to local schools, libraries, parks, community gardens, and senior centers to document information from elders to then pass along to younger generations. El Timbiriche acknowledges the community as experts and honors the deep knowledge of its elders. The project also aims to offer a low-tech, innovative model for user engagement - one that finds success in neighborhood place-making and physical interaction as a means to a larger goal of digitally documenting the unwritten stories, remedies, and traditions passed down through generations. The design attracts and invites several forms of participation on the street: from its ready-to-write-on chalkboard surfaces to a bike that rewards when ridden by powering digital tablets on hand.  Both interfaces (chalkboard and tablets) aim to record herbal recipes shared at the unit.  The resulting one-of-a-kind online database will be accessible by communities, near and far.


The Community 

 El Timbiriche speaks predominantely to Latino residents of Los Sures (Southside of Williamsburg) and Bushwick, Brooklyn, ameliorating issues that threaten their long-term wellbeing such as asthma, diabetes, and heart disease. El Puente is a 32-year old community-based organization that engages members, youth and adults, in the arts, community wellness, and environmental action, and reaches over 10,000 people annually through community events.  El Puente has a long history of and commitment to health education advocacy and research.
 Architect Farzana Gandhi has been working with El Puente and the community of Los Sures for over a year on this project, and has immersed herself in the neighborhood’s culture, expression of arts, and music in order to offer a design solution well suited to the needs of the community. Every stage of the design process has demonstrated that although modest in scale, the impact of El Timbiriche will be widespread. It has consisted of exchanging ideas, through workshops and public presentations, with enthusiastic residents, local artists and community gardeners. 

The Purpose 

El Timbiriche increases the visibility of a Latino healing legacy in gentrifying neighborhoods and empowers community members as experts in their own health. We need YOUR support to purchase materials, such as plywood, aluminum panels, a bicycle dynamo/generator, video camera and tablet, in order to build El Timbiriche. In addition, we will be stocking the mobile wellness cart with medicinal samples and educational materials. On behalf of our community, young and old, we thank you for your support in realizing our vision and building El Timbiriche!

story:
Short Summary

We are inventing a silicon putty which can do lots of things, such as repairing, form a shock absorbing layer, make object non-slippery, give protection, fill holes, make decoration, etc… 


What We Need & What You Get

  • We need funding for several areas, the R&D on formulation, product testing, and most importantly the material necessary for production. 
  • For everyone who contribute, we make sure you receive a product (even if we don't achieve our goal .)


The Impact

With your help on funding, we can launch this product sooner. 


What is Wrap-ber™?


Wrap-ber™ is a silicon putty that settles and cures quickly. It is durable, waterproof, cold and heat resistant. You can shape and wrap this product on almost any surface, such as metal, wood, plastics, tile, glass, etc...

Wrap-ber™ is a shape free silicon dough, that cures after compounds A & B are mixed together. After cured, it has infinite applications, such as cushioning hard object, making objects non-slippery, forming a protective layer, filling holes, making decoration, etc… 

It is not only about fixing and repairing, we design Wrap-ber™ for many more usages. There are many things we can make better to fit your lifestyle.



Advantage of Wrap-ber™


  • Wrap-ber™ consists of two compounds (A and B), they are packaged separately in the box and will therefore never react until the user mixes the two together. This is why Wrap-ber™ will never expire or dry out.

  • Compounds A and B are packaged in different shapes (circle and square) for users to easily identify which is which.

  • The two different colors of the A and B silicon dough, allows the user to tell if Wrap-ber™ is mixed well. 


How Wrap-ber™ works? 

  • Mix Wrap-ber™ A and B in 1:1 ratio, and mold onto the desired object.  

  • Wrap-ber™ A and B must mix together for at least 3 minutes to create the necessary reaction.  

  • Wrap-ber™ A and B must be thoroughly mixed together, or it will affect the cure performance.  

  • After the mixing process has completed, Wrap-ber™ will begin to cure anytime from 4 to 24 hours, depending on the air temperature. 


Thank you to Wrap-ber™ unique property, it is now much easier for engineering development.  It can make molds, electric insulator, flexible cover, fill holes, etc...

Tips:


Wrap-ber™ vs. others


What is Wrap-ber Bond?


Frequently Asked Question (FAQ)

Please contact us at wrap-ber@laion.com with any additional question you have.
Q1. When will I receive the reward?
A: We will ship the rewards out at end of June 2015, it should take 1-2 weeks to receive depends on where you are. 
Q2.Is this product harmful? What if its swallowed by children?
A: This product is safe according to US & EU Toxicological Risk Assessment Testing Review (TRA).   This is not a toy, so please keep this product away from children. If it is swallowed by children, seek medical advice immediately and show this pack. 
Q3. Any surfaces or materials not suitable for Wrap-ber™?
A: Although  Wrap-ber has a rubbery texture, Wrap-ber™ shall not contact with any rubber or latex material before it cures. Contact with rubbers or latex may affect the cure performance. 

Q4. Will Wrap-ber™ harm the object surface?

A: No, Wrap-ber™ is silicon base putty, it is non-corrosive nor it will not oxidize the object.

Q5: Can I use Wrap-ber™ if  I have skin allergy?  

A: Persons known to have sensitive skins or skin allergy should handle this product with caution and use glove if necessary. If seen allergy reaction, should stop using this product immediately and seek medical advice.   

Q6. Any preparation before using Wrap-ber™?

A: Prior to use, clean surfaces with dry tissue and ensure the surface is dust and grease free. Wash hands thoroughly with soap before and after use.  

Q7. What is the maximum weight can Wrap-ber™ Bond hold up to?

A: At our testing, we confirmed it can hold approximate 3 kg on a flat surface with surface area of 4 x 1.5 cm of Wrap-ber™ bond. For heavier object, the surface area should exceed mentioned surface area size. This is only for reference only. 

For further advice contact wrap-ber@laion.com.

story:
On A Mission to Deliver the Real Mexico 

We want to promote knowledge and respect for indigenous culture, its worldview, and how it relates to nature. We seek to carry out a travel experience with little impact on indigenous community life and yet allow for direct participation with the community and their traditional leaders in a respectful manner as well as promoting the sustainable use of tourism.

We Need You to Give So They Can Receive

Almost 7 years ago the idea was born to build an indigineous tour company where we would provide travelers an opportunity to live amongst the Tarahumara (raramuri) Indian Tribe, also well known as one of the best endurance runners of the world and one of the last intact traditional tribes in North America. In 2008, after creating and working with 150 migrant Tarahumara kids in a series of workshops to strengthen indigenous culture and identity in Chihuahua City, Mexico we decided the it was critical to continue and to securing a funding stream for it would be crucial. So we finally did it and created our company Eco alterNATIVE Tours Sierra Tarahumara, that seeks to create a multi-day experience into the Copper Canyon, that few have had the opportunity to be immersed in. 

The Tours Will:

  • Show a bit of the Tarahumara soul, who they really are as a people and their connection with nature and the world. 
  •  Celebrate and support indigenous worldviews and values as it strengthens the earths biological and cultural diversity. 
  • Benefit Tarahumara families economically. 

The Tarahumara concept of sharing in their language and culture is called "kórima" and is centered on helping one another and bringing well being and happiness to their community. We ask for your support and invite you to be part of our community. Korima. 

What We Need: 

  • $15,000 to purchase a 4 x 4 vehicle to transport our tour goers. 
  • $5,000 to purchase camping equipment and gear which includes materials for an ecological letrine. 
  • $5,000 other costs such as permits, marketing materials, utilities and administrative costs.

Meet Your Guides…They’re Also the Owners

Chunel Palma was born in a Tarahumara village located about five hours on foot from Norogachi the main gathering area of his community. At the age of four his family left his village and moved to a non-Indian town where his father was a disk jockey for an Indian radio station. Growing up he experienced firsthand the discrimination of being indigenous and living in a different social dynamic. The indifference of the non- indigenous spurred him to want to prepare himself and get an education that would help him comprehend and give him the tools to return to his community and be of service. After leaving the Sierra Tarahumara for the city to study Anthropology he collaborated in various projects with local nonprofits that worked with various indigenous communities and indigenous groups. He later created and led art and culture workshops with Tarahumara migrant kids in collaboration with a local museum. He has also participated in leadership training and cultural workshops in Mexico and the US. Chunel hopes to show a different face of the Tarahumara nation, revealing their dreams, challenges and their connection to mother Earth. 

Daniela Ramirez is originally from Oxnard, California born to a Mexican immigrant father and second-generation mother. She has a cultural anthropology degree from the University of California Berkeley and received her Masters degree in Chihuahua, Mexico from the National School of Anthropology and History – CIESAS. Her thesis is titled “External actors and Rarámuri perspectives about development in the Sierra Tarahumara”. She had the opportunity to collaborate with various indigenous communities and organizations in the state of Chihuahua, Mexico and produce a number of cultural and social documentaries on the Tarahumara. In the U.S. in 2009 she served as the director of a California statewide women’s farmworker organization and subsequently coordinated a countywide program called “House Farm Workers”. Her passion for the Tarahumara culture and the Sierra Tarahumara has remained and she’s excited to bring Eco alterNative Tours to the world! 

Our Website Is Ready

 Get the full scoop on our tours at http://www.ecoalternativetours.com

story:
Hello there indiegogo-ers!

I am a 24 year old guy who some 18 months ago launched a clothing company with a friend from uni. It was our first foray in business and although we got a solid product together, we made mistakes on the way, overran costs and made a fatal error of leaving nothing in the pot for marketing our product.

We had some success throwing parties to promote our brand locally, and planned to do more of that. it was great fun, we made money on the night as well as raising interest in the brand, but unfortunately for several reasons I had to move back home to my sleepy town in Essex and that was no more. To cut a long story short, I would like to raise these funds to put on events based promotions for my brand, as well investing in some equipment (A sewing machine and building our own silk screen press) in order to stop having to pay printing companies and the like so our future costs are minimal. Apart from that just some running capital so I can go back to Camden and Spitalfields Markets and effectively sell the product.

story:
Every $1 will treat one patient at this free hospital!

#ProjectArgora

Argora is a project that is planned in India, close to the city of Ranchi. There are many people in and around the village who require essential medical care but cannot afford it or don’t have access to it. Physicians of Oath will provide medical aid to the inhabitants of the village and fill the void of health care by setting up an easily accessible medical clinic which will be open to everyone who walks in. We already have the doctors and nurses in our team ready to go, all we need is the infrastructure!

The People in need



Meet Goalu. One of the inhabitants of our village in India. He is 6 years old, is in grade 1, does well in school, and loves to play videogames on my phone (draining its entire battery life). He will be one of the many children our free hospital will vaccinate against measles, mumps, rubella, hepatitis A, rota-virus, influenza, etc.

Providing vaccinations and medications to children, pregnant women, and the elderly is one of the major reasons we need to build this medical facility in Argora, India. People there do not have access to the most basic medical needs. In essence, the cost of treating 1 patient will be $1.

Meet Chotku. He is 7 and has just entered grade 2. He is eager to learn and loves to read books. He also loves to rides his red-yellow bike to school - even when the streets are flooded from the heavy monsoon rains. Chotku sometimes gets terrible ear infections (Otitis Media), which causes him to become sick with dangerous fevers, falling behind in his important studies.

Our free clinic would help provide the appropriate antibiotics which could cure simple ear infections such as the one Chotku gets. The medications have been around for decades, however, many people don't have access to them. Help us build this infrastructure through which Chotku and others like him can get the antibiotics  and free medical care they so desperately need.

Help the elderly! We will be providing preventive medical assistance to the elderly population. Providing medication for hypertension, high cholesterol, and diabetes. Giving them advice on changes in life style to live a healthier and longer life.  
 
YES! We are physically going to the village to build and maintain this free clinic!

Good news! We have already acquired the land required to build our free medical clinic! We plan to build a clinic in Argora, and initially hire local physicians and nurses to provide care. American and Canadian physicians will later guide, control, and manage the clinic, both virtually and physically.

Starting now, we are raising funds to build our free medical clinic. For that we need your encouragement and support. So join us, and help us in proving medical aid to the less fortunate.

Our Goals

  • Currently all our fundraising is directed towards building a free clinic in the village of Argora in India. The free clinic is estimated to cost around US$35,000.
  • Once the clinic is built, the average cost of running it is estimated to be approximately US$15,000/year.
  • At the clinic it will cost only $1.20 to treat each patient.

The Impact

According to the World Health Organization, approximately 30% of the world’s population does not have access to essential medical care. Many men, women, and children living in developing countries lack access to many basic health care services, resulting in high rates of morbidity and mortality. Physicians of Oath (PO) works to provide free medical care and assistance to populations who have no means of receiving care. Our goal is to open up medical clinics in developing countries, provide medical advice and care, in rural areas where health services are otherwise unavailable. PO will not charge any fees for such services. If PO cannot provide a specific medical service, our organization will try to find the appropriate accommodations for the patients in critical need. We have an open door and walk in policy.

Our doctors (majority of them being board members) will travel to India and work at the free clinic for a set duration of time. Our doctors might travel alone or in groups, depending on their work schedules. Once there, we will collaborate with local doctors and nurses at the clinic, and share the newest and best medical information available. Member physicians will travel to rural places for a short duration through the year, work with the locals and manage the clinic, come back and report to the entire board, and plan ahead as needed.


Making a Difference

Western currency is more valuable in the developing world. $1 US is equal to 60 rupees in India, which can be a week’s salary for many people. We can provide people with amazing heath care and proper medication and improve their life by donating funds and time. Physicians of Oath provides what most medical organizations usually do not - Board certified American and Canadian Physicians and their expertise in geographical areas where basic medical care is unavailable. On top of providing emergency relief, our organization amalgamates with the local populations, treats illnesses through preventative measures (i.e. regular clinic and home visits), and introduces the concept of primary medical care to the less fortunate. 

Physicians of Oath’s actions are guided by Hippocrates, often referred to as the “Father of Medicine,” and his ideals of the selfless dedication to the preservation of human life.

Other Ways You Can Help

How can I volunteer?

If you would like to donate time and effort, we would be more than happy to have you on board. Please contact Physicians of Oath directly.

Email us at info@physiciansofoath.org, or use our contact form.
You can help us spread awareness about our mission by liking us on Facebook, and sharing us on other social media.

Remember, you can also use the Indiegogo share tools!

Perks For Your Donations!

story:
Who are we?

World's Finest Books is a partnership company set up by two enthusiastic readers who live in Glasgow - Tom and Emzy. We want to create a retail space that specialises in science fiction, fantasy, and graphic novels, along with coffee, tea, and homemade cake, comfy chairs and a relaxing atmosphere!

We have plans to run book clubs for all ages, to host author signings and book launches, and to work closely with local groups such as schools and festivals so that World's Finest Books can become a community space. We want to spotlight Scottish writers and artists in addition to providing a diverse and interesting selection of both fiction and non-fiction. In the future we would also like to hold an annual short story competition, with the winners being published in a book collection that we would stock.

We both feel strongly that this is a shop that will enhance the West End of Glasgow. Sci fi and fantasy has always had its life-long fans, but with the exciting expansion of these genres into tv and film, that fanbase is larger than ever and still growing! We both had favourite bookshops growing up, and though big-name bookshops are great, there's nothing quite like having a local bookshop that's 'yours'. That's an experience we would love to share with the people of Glasgow.


What we will use the money for:

We are hoping to raise £10,000 to help us towards a shop refit; we will also use part of the funds to join the Bookseller's Association. By raising some of our funds through Indiegogo we will need to borrow less money from our bank, creating a more financially sustainable business.

By contributing to our Indiegogo campaign you will help us to refit the shop premises on Great Western Road, and allow us to use a local Glasgow joiners to create bookshelf space and comfy seats. It will also allow us to create a theatre-style kitchen/shop counter, which will mean fresh-baked cakes and biscuits every day!

We would like to use local contractors and suppliers as much as possible, as we believe in supporting small businesses like ours. We will run our business as ethically and environmentally-conscious as we can.


Other Ways You Can Help

The smallest amount of donation is appreciated, but if you are unable to donate then please share our story to as many people as you can! Word of mouth is the best way for World's Finest Books to get off the ground and become a sustainable business.

Here are our social media sites, to help keep you updated on how World's Finest Books is doing:

Twitter - @worldsfinestbks
Facebook - facebook.com/worldsfinestbks

Thank you for taking the time to read this. We are super excited about starting this business, and we hope that after reading our campaign pitch that you are too! We would love to hear from you if you have any comments or queries.

Tom and Emzy

That's an experience we would love to share with the people of Glasgow.

  What we will use the money for:
We are hoping to raise £10,000 to help us towards a shop refit; we will also use part of the funds to join the Bookseller's Association. By raising some of our funds through Indiegogo we will need to borrow less money from our bank, creating a more financially sustainable business.By contributing to our Indiegogo campaign you will help us to refit the 
shop premises on Great Western Road, and allow us to use a local Glasgow
 joiners to create bookshelf space and comfy seats. It will also allow 
us to create a theatre-style kitchen/shop counter, which will mean 
fresh-baked cakes and biscuits every day!We would like to use local contractors and suppliers as much as possible, as we believe in supporting small businesses like ours. We will run our business as ethically and environmentally-conscious as we can.
  Other Ways You Can HelpThe smallest amount of donation is appreciated, but if you are unable to donate then please share our story to as many people as you can! Word of mouth is the best way for World's Finest Books to get off the ground and become a sustainable business.Here are our social media sites, to help keep you updated on how World's Finest Books is doing:Twitter - @worldsfinestbksFacebook - facebook.com/worldsfinestbksThank you for taking the time to read this. We are super excited about starting this business, and we hope that after reading our campaign pitch that you are too! We would love to hear from you if you have any comments or queries.Tom and Emzy

story:
"The Cafe not only provides access to good, fresh, and healthy food, it also actively breaks down the stigma often associated with accessing food charity. 
Food here is shared and in that sharing we are all made to feel equal. "

"It's a lifeline.  I don’t know what I would do if it shut."


ABOUT WOODLANDS GARDEN COMMUNITY CAFE

Woodlands Community Garden's Pop Up Cafe offers an alternative model to most food banks - one which centres around a shared meal rather than dried food parcels.  We need your support to enable us to keep the cafe running after funding from the Big Lottery ends in June 2015.

         "I  am disabled and quite often don’t eat very well due to fatigue.  
       So coming here means I get good vegetarian food and a healthy meal."

The food we serve is freshly cooked, healthy and sourced locally, including ingredients grown directly at our community garden.  Meals are cooked by local volunteers who are supported by two part-time community food workers Irina and Soghra.  There is a great international flavour to our menus, which are comparable to those of top quality restaurants.

"The food is brilliant and the staff are amazing."

Volunteers also provide “front of house” support to people at the cafe. and ensure that it is a really welcoming and friendly place.  More in-depth help is provided at the cafes from local support and advice agencies, including our local Citizens Advice Bureau. We do not have referral criteria, vouchers or limits on the number of times people can attend as such conditions reinforce the stigma of accessing food aid. Our community cafes currently happen every Monday evening at Windsor Hall on Maryhill Road. Over the last 12 months almost 1500 people have attended our cafes, with attendance now averaging around 40 people per week.


WHAT YOUR MONEY WILL BE USED FOR
Our target of £15,000 will keep us going for 12 months and can be used as match funding for grant applications, enabling us to both sustain and expand our work to tackle food poverty and social isolation. If we exceed our target then it means we could either keep the cafe going longer or look at options for running the cafe on more days.


For every £1 raised we anticipate that 95p will go to support our frontline work. We will use this money to:

1) Employ a Community Food Worker to run the kitchen and supervise our volunteer cafe helpers. Due to the cafe being so busy and some of the people attending being from vulnerable backgrounds, it can't be run by volunteers alone.  That's why we are also asking for help to cover our essential staffing costs.  
2) Meet the the cost of our food and kitchen supplies, using fresh local organic produce whenever possible.
3) Increase the amount of food we grow ourselves that can be used at the cafe. This will be both at our community garden and other local community sites, including for example supporting  our local primary school to help grow food that they will donate to the cafe.
4) Train and support volunteers, increasing their skills and confidence to cook healthy meals on a budget, run cookery demonstrations and signpost people in need to relevant support organisations. 

Just 5p in every £1 will go towards some of the overheads involved in running the project - for example a small contribution towards the cost of our insurance, phone and broadband, stationary and office costs.


ABOUT US

Woodlands Community Garden is managed by Woodlands Community Development Trust. We are a registered charity (SC008741) and a Living Wage Employer. Further information on our work is available on our website www.woodlandscommunitygarden.org.uk

story:
GidwayExpress.com is an online shopping outfit located in Nigeria and owned and managed by Gidway Express Limited (a private company limited by shares).

The Company (Gidway Express Limited) was incorporated under the Companies and Allied Matters Act of Nigeria on the 28th day of November, 2014 with RC Number 12280018. It commenced business activities in January, 2015. See Certificate of Incorporation below: 

The mission of the company is to provide excellent value-added online services by investing in high quality personnel and leading-edge technology with a view to delivering exceptional and value for money customer services.

The objects for which the company is formed include:

a)  To provide a platform for goods such as books, magazines, journals, newspapers, educational and allied materials, printing and stationery materials, plant and machinery, space parts, furniture, office and household items, etc, to be marketed via the internet.

b)  To carry on business as printers and publishers.

c)  To carry on business as promoters, managers and facilitators of tourism, travels and entertainment.

d)  To carry on business of general merchandise including African arts, crafts and related items.

We will like to mention here that in order to ensure the security of data and efficient performance, our website is being hosted by Shopify Incorporated.

With your help GidwayExpress.com will be able to meet the growing demand of our teeming customers. 

A graphic illustration of our activities is as follows: 

In return for your support, you'll be one of the few to be a proud owner of fully handmade African art & craft T-shirts created exclusively for this purpose. Also for the vacation package, get the best treat in your vacation to Africa. Enjoy these awesome perks!!!

Obudu Mountain Resort: Nature's beauty can be witnessed in the mountain resort of Obudu, a beautiful town in south-south Nigeria. It attracts tourists for hiking, mountain climbing and Game reserve. For more information click here 

Olumo Rock: The ancient tourist attraction includes a new museum, water fountain, an elevator.


In total, we need $375,234 basically for,

  1. Inventory  - 30%
  2. Logistics - 60%
  3. Sundry - 10%
A graphic illustration of our activities is as follows: 
 1.  Administration/General Management - 30%
   2.  Logistics/Operations  - 60%

 3.  Sundry (Unclassified Expenses) - 10% 

Gidway Express Limited was founded in November 2014 with a goal of becoming the BEST online ecommerce store with the largest network in Africa. Our intention is to be able to deliver goods and services to every nook and cranny of Africa.

It may interest you to know that we are already enjoying tremendous traffic in Nigeria and the West African subregion. 

We’re proud to mention our milestone achievements as follows:

  •   We have a platform that can boast of both local and international standards
  •   Most secured website in Africa
  •   Increasing traffic by the day

We have put in place the following infrastructural facilities: 

  • Office space 
  • Electronic gadgets 
  • Motor cycle
  • Motor vehicle 
  • Warehouse etc. 
What to do Next

We are ready for the next stage. Our primary goal in this regard is to raise the necessary fund that will enable us properly equip the company so as to meet its target goal of covering the African continent. 

Consequently, the fund being asked for will be used for the acqusition of:

  • Additional motorcycles (dispatch riders)
  • Addition motor vehicles (delivery vans)
  • Employment and training of additional staff
  • Increasing inventory
  • Bigger warehouse

This will help GidwayExpress.com to truly live up to its vision of being the most preferred eCommerce store in Africa. For why this is important, please take a moment to read the “impact” section below.

A successful crowdfunding at indiegogo will also mean a tremendous progress on our long term vision.

Email Scams. Corruption. Oil Production. Danger. When people think of Nigeria this is often what comes to mind.

Nigeria is misunderstood.
This is why you won’t find Amazon, Paypal or eBay here.
This is why there are so few foreign startup investors

Fear creates barriers. It creates a stigma around a company's website. It deprives genuine startups of the much needed funding to actualize their businesses dreams particularly in Nigeria.

We want to show the world a different Nigeria – a real Nigeria, a hopeful Nigeria through the lens of everyday eCommerce, in particular through GidwayExpress.com.

GidwayExpress.com will have a great boost after a successful crowdfunding. Gidway will undoubtedly improve in infrastructure, marketing, human resources, prompt delivery, logistics etc. It will then be able to go into other core areas which include: printing & publishing, arts & crafts, tourism, entertainment and ticketing as soon as possible. Learn more

Also with a successful crowdfunding we will be set to go into more partnership with international organisations which include but not limited to the companies mentioned in the graphic display below:

Certainly, the sum of $375,234 is not enough to expand an eCommerce to a global standard. However, the amount being sought is needed to lay a foundation which will be built upon as progress is made. 

The fund will also enable us to introduce GidwayExpress.com to the global online market. 

We’re here to help businesses and consumers. Our goal is to be able to change the way business is conducted (in Africa). Traditional intermediary functions will be replaced, new products and markets will be developed, and new relationships will be created between businesses and consumers.  Please take note of the following:

  • Our platform will enable customers to shop or do other transactions 24/7, from all locations with internet access.
  • We will be able to provide prompt delivery services to customers worldwide.
  • We will be able to maintain substantial discounts and after sales services.
  • Our platform will enable people in the rural areas to enjoy products and services that otherwise are not available to them.

Building a viable and profitable eCommerce business is fraught with a number of challenges which include the following: 

Trust – The lack of trust in electronic means of payment continues to be a worldwide deterrent to online shoppers. However, due to our partnership with Shopify Inc. (a reputable internet hosting and security company), GidwayExpress.com has been able to minimize the lack of trust by customers. 

Resistance to change – Online shopping is relatively new compared to the traditional way of transacting buying and selling business. It is therefore obvious that changing from the old way to the new way of doing things will bring about resistance (change is naturally resisted). Gidway is trying to overcome this through vigorous awareness campaign. 

Lack of internet access - People living in rural communities particularly in Africa have no access to the internet and hence are unable to shop online. With African governments waking up to their responsibilities of developing the rural communities, it is hoped that accessibility to internet will spread across the continent.

Your support will enable GidwayExpress.com to overcome the challenges highlighted above and hence flourish. If we reach our goal of this campaign, we will be able to take GidwayExpress.com to the next level in an unprecedented manner.

For a long time now, Africa has been limited in the areas of funding, accessibility to the internet, as well as other technological developments. All these have negatively affected the development of eCommerce in the continent. 
We believe that raising funds from Indiegogo will enable us overcome some of the above mentioned challenges.

We hope our perks are the kind of cool stuff you would love to hold and cherish. You would certainly be delighted to have them. They have all been designed and crafted by some of Africa’s greatest minds. We assure you that all funds received by us will be transparently accounted for as well as judiciously utilized. Indeed, helping Gidway in this regard will go a long way in promoting the well being and happiness of humanity.  
--

We know that there are many folks out there who love what we are doing, but cannot give financially. That does not make your support any less valuable! Sharing our idea with family members, colleagues, associates and friends in what ever way possible will be a huge way to support this noble project.

  • Make some noise and share this page by word of mouth!
  • Share this page on all forms of social media. The more people we can reach, the greater chances we have of attaining our goal. Indiegogo has share tools to help you!
Please share this project with folks you think might be interested. And, as always, we are here and open to new ideas, so if you have a way that you would like to help or participate, please feel free to contact us (support@gidwayexpress.com).

Even taking the time to reading this treatise means that you have already supported us in a way. And for that, we say a BIG thank you! Much love from GidwayExpress.com team. You are greatly appreciated!

Thank you for backing this project. Companies like Gidway Express Limited grow because of the strong support of people like you who care about the quality and growth of a company but also for the advancement of the wellbeing and happiness of humankind.

When will I get my awesome stuff?

Our fundraising campaign starts on October 5 and ends on November 13. We will begin production immediately afterward. We anticipate that products will be available to recipients February 15, 2016.

Do I get to pick my own style and size (example, shirt style, size, etc.)?

Yes, you will be sent a questionnaire after the campaign ends, and will be asked to provide some details of what you prefer (eg,. Size, style etc.).

When will shipping commence?

Shipping will commence January 25, 2016.

When will I hear from Gidway Team?

We will be in contact with our contributors from the beginning right to the end. Updates with photographs will be uploaded regularly. We will do our very best to keep you in the loop and make you a part of the process. However, whenever you need to contact us please do so at info@gidwayexpress.com or call us on phone (+234-7056655115). Many thanks
